Job Title: Risk Advisory - Data & Analytics - 2022 Graduate Program (Sy...
Job Description:
Date: 18-Jul-2021

Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 14341

Receive unparalleled professional development through our year-round graduate training program, D|Academy
Roll up your sleeves for worthwhile causes on our annual volunteer day, Impact Day, or by working on pro-bono projects
Work with industry leaders and experts, and a top-tier list of clients

You’re an absolute data nut. You love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured – the better!). In Risk Analytics - Regulatory and Compliance, we help clients navigate risks and capture opportunities with insights from their data.

What will you get to do?
No two days are the same in the Risk Analytics - Regulatory & Compliance team. On a typical project, you’ll start off by sourcing and preparing data for analysis. Then, you’ll dive deep into the data to develop meaningful insights for the client using software like Excel, SQL and advanced statistical modelling software such as SAS, SPSS and R. Don’t fret, you'll have 100% support from the team as you pick up these new skills! Once you’ve discovered hidden data insights, you’ll get to develop tailored recommendations and solutions for the client. Pretty cool, right?

Your future starts with us.
Our curious and data-driven Regulatory & Compliance team is comprised of 2 main pillars:

Data Risk and Compliance Analytics: Our Data Risk and Compliance Analytics team supports our clients from development of their data strategy and governance framework through to implementation of operational analytics solutions leveraging robotic process automation and machine learning. Currently, we’re focusing on regulatory compliance, reducing operational risk, data lifecycle management, and controls transformation within a wide range of industries!
Workplace Integrity: Our Workplace Integrity team combines practitioners with advanced analytic skills and deep industrial relations expertise to support clients to navigate the complex workplace regulatory landscape and identify innovative opportunities to achieve great outcomes for businesses and their employees.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are an inquisitive student with a knack for solving complex problems. You may also have:

Bachelor degree or higher qualification in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Studies, Commerce, IT, Computer Science or equivalent fields
Great interpersonal skills and thrive in collaborative environments
Able to articulate business problems and data insights
A passion for data analysis and presenting data for visual impact
Enjoys coming up with creative solutions to solve ambiguous and fuzzy problems
Motivated to use your own initiative to achieve high standards for your clients and team.
Australian permanent residency or Australian/New Zealand Citizenship (required)

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Company Name: NSW Department of Communities and Justice
Job Description:
Division: Strategy Policy and Commissioning
Location: Parramatta, NSW, AU, 2150
Req ID: 26169
Business Analyst

Ongoing - Full-Time
Location: Ashfield (moving to Parramatta late 2021)
Clerk Grade 7/8, Salary ($97,443 - $107,864 pa), plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
This role is part of a reform and is only available to Department of Communities and Justice employees. No external candidates will be considered for the role.

About us

The Department of Communities and Justice carries an important purpose across many areas of its work, particularly when it comes to improving outcomes for children and young people, Aboriginal people, people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people experiencing domestic and family violence, victims of sexual assault, juvenile offenders, people at high risk of reoffending, and people experiencing homelessness.

Working together for stronger communities means we can continue to deliver our services with a more unified and collaborative approach. This means a greater focus on prevention and early intervention, faster responses, more seamless operations, less duplication of effort and better outcomes.

The Implementation, Performance and Stewardship is accountable for the following:

Program management of Specialist Homelessness Services and other homelessness programs and initiatives, including recommissioning of homelessness services
Implementation and monitoring of homelessness strategy initiatives
Homelessness programs stewardship and sector development, including quality assurance accreditation and an Aboriginal Service Improvement Strategy
Demonstrating achievement of outcomes and identifying improvement opportunities
Policy, design, implementation and monitoring of youth specific homelessness programs and pathways
Delivering homelessness programs reviews and evaluations
Identifying recommendations from evaluations to improve aspects of the commissioned solution across the whole commissioning cycle
NSW and National (AIHW) homelessness data reporting
Client Information Management System (CIMS) maintenance
Housing, Homelessness and Disability budget management and reporting
Housing, Homelessness and Disability change management and risk reporting

About the role

Providing financial expertise in the Housing and Homelessness Budgeting and Reporting team

Key accountabilities

Ability to undertake financial analysis
Experience using databases including SAP, Adaptive Planning and Adaptive Insights
Experience in journaling
Prepare advice in the form of briefs, budget submissions and discussion papers to contribute to responses to Ministerial, Cabinet or DCJ requests.
Liaise and work across the Housing and Homelessness Directorate on program area budgets
Essential requirements of the role

Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience
Knowledge of legislation relevant to the Department’s portfolio, government functions and the legislative process
About you

In addition to meeting the essential requirements, the successful candidate must demonstrate strong capabilities in:

Developing reports and analysis
Provide quality assurance of financial data
Trouble shooting
High level written skills
Does this sound like you? Click here to download the role description and here for supplementary information.

Applying for the role

When applying you will need to submit a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements and capabilities of this role and attach an up-to-date resume (maximum of 5 pages)

This role is part of a reform and only internal candidates to Department of Communities and Justice will be considered.

Closing date: Monday 2nd August 2021 at 11:59 pm

For role enquiries please contact Zoe Dendle on 0427 134 531 or via email at: zoe.dendle@facs.nsw.gov.au

If you experience technical difficulties when submitting your application, please contact Michelle Hutchison via Michelle.Hutchison@justice.nsw.gov.au

IMPORTANT

To ensure recruitment at the Department of Communities and Justice continues without interruption during the COVID-19 pandemic, some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods.
This may include video interviewing, telephone interviewing and online assessments. If you are successful following review of your application, you may need to perform assessments and/or interviews via online platforms using a PC, laptop or smart phone. By doing so, we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place.

Inclusion and Diversity lies at the heart of how we recruit

We continue to hire great people with a wide variety of skills, experience and backgrounds. This includes people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, people identifying as LGBTIQ+, culturally and linguistically diverse people, carers and other diversity groups.

If you require an adjustment within the recruitment process, please contact Michelle Hutchison via Michelle.Hutchison@justice.nsw.gov.au and advise us of your preferred method of communication.

If you are looking for more information about workplace adjustments at DCJ, please visit our Careers site.

Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

North Ryde location

Initial 6 Month contract + Extensions

Working across multiple projects

Key Responsibilities
Track and analyse projects by reporting on performance against agreed KPIs, key risks, variances, and trends
Provide accurate, timely and transparent project analysis data and reports to senior leadership and business stakeholders.
Analyse resources required for project delivery to identify resource capacity and update capacity plans and forecast to ensure resource allocations meet project requirements.
Monitor project scheduling and manage overall portfolio schedule in collaboration with other PMO Analysts.
Monitor and analyse project financials including assessing variances, reforecasting, accruals, transfers, and month end process.
Facilitate monthly project health check reviews.
Provide PMO induction to PMs and key project resources including Project Portfolio Management training and support to the specified Project Team.
Ensure projects are in adherence to PMO procedures, policies, and governance. Ensure documentation is completed in line with framework, and project templates are up to date, adhered to and rolled out effectively.
Support the Head of Project Assurance in ensuring a consistent focus on the delivery of Macquarie project portfolio and that milestones, quality criteria are met within the PMO standards.
Participate in change activities and adopt new ways of working to support organisational changes required to create and sustain IT and Faculties' technology capabilities.
Comply with relevant EEO and WHS regulations.
Perform any other duties as required and appropriate for this classification.
Providing advice and guidance to PMs and project resources on process and good practice.
Supporting Head of Project Delivery and PMs in the recruitment and onboarding of project resources.
Key Skills and Essential Experience
Tertiary qualification or diploma in Information Technology, Information Systems or a combination of relevant experience and training.
Strong financial and analytical skills.
Expert knowledge of project management tools and techniques.
Microsoft Office Suite and Microsoft reporting tools
Certifications in project management (Agile, PRINCE2) and Change Management (ADKAR) highly regarded.
Experience with MS Office Suite (with advanced Excel skills) MS Teams and SharePoint.
ServiceNow experience highly regarded
Extensive experience as a PMO Analyst or similar role in a complex environment.
Experience working in a PMO of more than $20 million portfolio capex.
Experience in methodologies such as PRINCE2, Agile, PMBOK.
Experience with business transformation projects.
Proficient with Microsoft MS SharePoint, ServiceNow, MS Visio.
data analysis and report preparation using Microsoft reporting tools.
Strong analytical and numerical skills with experience in monitoring and analysing project financials and budgets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
If interested in the role please select APPLY or contact Richard.bissitt@peoplebank.com.au quoting reference 236967

Job no: 504458
Work type: Permanent Full-Time
Location: Sydney - George Street
One day you’re helping us boldly innovate, another you’re leading an initiative, or pitching in where needed. At Tabcorp, each day brings a different challenge and another opportunity – and this is what we live for.
As part of the Data Analytics & Governance team, you will work across many facets of the wagering business. Supporting key stakeholders such as VIP Customer, Trading, Risk, CRM & Marketing, you will also work within cross functional squads to support the wider marketing team.

What you’ll do
As a Data Analyst, you will support the broader Analytics team in delivering reports and insights across Wagering with the goal of improving both financial performance and operational processes within the business. By serving our stakeholders with self service capabilities you will be tasked with spending time on ‘value-add’ initiatives and will be a key advocate for driving a data driven culture at Tabcorp.


Engage with various stakeholders within the business championing analytics.
Automate weekly business reporting processes ensuring accuracy and timeliness of output.
Support the business by identifying problems and providing solutions by applying the appropriate tools and techniques.
Gather requirements from key stakeholders and start new work streams.
Develop and maintain current Tableau dashboard.
Support Senior members of the team with data preparation and/or presentations for key tasks and priorities.
Participate in change initiatives by implementing new directions/initiatives and providing appropriate information and feedback.

What you’ll bring
1-3 years relevant analytics experience.
Degree level qualification specialising in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field, or equivalent experience with data analytics.
Experience using SQL, R/Python and Microsoft Office Suite is essential.
Knowledge with Tableau would be highly advantageous.
Adept at identifying data requirements to answer business questions in a timely manner.
Demonstrates robust problem-solving skills, participates in problem-solving discussions, and suggests ideas as opportunities arise.

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s largest gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.
Our 4,500+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing, Sky Sports Radio and MAX. As an ASX listed company we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au

COVID-19
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment.

Lendlease is one of the world’s leading property and infrastructure groups. Our vision is to create the best places not just for our clients and communities, but especially for our employees. Delivering iconic and award-winning projects, we are setting standards in innovative and industry-leading project management, construction and design services locally and globally.
An exciting opportunity has become available for a People Reporting Analyst to join our People Connect team. In this position, you will be responsible for the design and delivery of reporting solutions as well as providing guidance and advice to internal customers, across the Lendlease business, in relation to reporting capabilities.
In this position, you will also be responsible for managing data integrity, working with a high level of People analytics and information from across the business. You will be part of a highly supportive team and will have the opportunity to work across multiple systems and databases, as well as gaining an insight into large, matrix driven organisation.
To be successful in this role, you will have demonstrated experience with the design and delivery of Workday reporting (or similar cloud HR solutions) along with knowledge of business intelligence platforms such as Tableau. Critical to this role is advanced excel skills, along with the ability to confidently engage with a diverse range of stakeholders. You will have an excellent eye for detail, as well as having strong organisational skills.
We embrace the value of a vibrant and diverse workforce and recognise that our people have different experiences and needs at different times. Lendlease is a diverse, flexible and inclusive employer of choice. We engage, enable and empower our people and support their individual needs. Inclusion sets us all up for success.

Job Title: BI & Data Analytics Developer (Python) – Financial Markets
Job Description:
We are looking for a BI & Data Analyst with technical experience with Python to join our Financial Markets division to deliver business efficiency through process analysis, simplification, and workflow automation!
How will I help?
You will join the Westpac Institutional Bank’s (WIB)Business and Consumer Financial Markets (B&C) team focussed on providing Financial Markets execution, advice, support, and risk services to customers across the Business and Consumer Division of the Group. You will utilise your technical data and Python skills, along with your understanding of data science principles to deliver business efficiency through process analysis, simplification, and workflow automation.
You will work in a team of analysts with skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau and GitHub to support business performance through the analysis of data, workflow, and application development, to deliver tailored and targeted business process and insights which supports business growth and enables a better understanding of our customer base.
You will:
Construct appropriate new workflows and User Developed Applications using your experience of Python, SQL and others and adhering to operating principles for the BIO team.
Collaborate with the Data, Analytics & Systematic trading team to adhere to development and security principles.
Support the development of business efficiency, uplift the general digital capability of the B&C business, and reduce risk.
Identify risks to project or task timelines, and work to address risks identified.
Ensure standardised strong principles of data security, appropriate data access and effective data control are embedded throughout your work.
What’s in it for me?
Job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth and insurance offers) you’ll be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You’ll also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer.
What do I need?
Experience in analysing data and developing applications using Python and SQL, and other methods including Power BI, tableau, GitHub etc., and using this data to identify problems, design solutions and think in an agile manner. You will be able to work autonomously and understand business requirements and problems and can think creatively to deliver bespoke data and insight solutions to senior Stakeholders across Financial Markets.
Some further advantageous skills:
Experience in application and workflow design and development
Able to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
Understanding of compliance and risk obligations relating to data and customer information.
Experience in meeting the operational challenges involved in a highly demanding environment with competing priorities.
What’s it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start Here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces as long as required.

Looking for a Data Analyst role that has long term career growth? A Large Australian insurer is looking for a superstar Data Analyst. Is this you?

Large Australian Insurer

Located in the heart of Chatswood

Highly competitive salary

Role Outline

Are you a Data Analyst that is eternally curious that loves taking a deep dive in data to see what you can find? We are working with a large Australian insurer that is looking for a new Data Analyst that will work with fraud and compliance investigations .

Located within the heart of Chatswood you will join a team that knows that data is the future .

Your key task will be to work through a large and growing dataset finding and investigating irregularities and discovering potential issues.

Skills and experience

3 years experience in Data Analytics

SQL and Python experience

Data wrangling and analytical skills

Investigative skills for fraud and compliance

Data analysis, cleansing and modelling

Background in banking, finance or insurance would be beneficial

Ideally you will know PowerBI or Tableau (they can train you!)

Overall you will be proactive with a curiosity about what data can do . You will be able to not just analyse but tell the story of the data and its insights .

In this role you will be involved in working through large datasets to find fraud and compliance issues. You will be involved in the reporting, remediation and resolution of all found issues.

Aside from this you will be given many opportunities to work on industry leading projects that could propel you towards a data science career!

On offer to the successful candidate is a permanent role within one of Australia's largest insurers with a highly competitive salary. This is a company that is looking to grow its data and analytics team with long term career growth !

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Aidan Daly on 02 9464 5716 or email: adaly@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.

Paxus values diversity and welcomes applications from Indigenous Australians, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people living with a disability. If you require an adjustment to the recruitment process please contact me on the above contact details.

Highly competitive salary package

About us
At Transport, we’re passionate about making NSW a better place to live, work and visit. Our vision is to give everyone the freedom to choose how and when they get around, no matter where they live. Right now, we’re delivering the largest infrastructure program Australia has ever seen – to keep people and goods moving, connect communities and shape the future of our cities, centres and regions. At Transport, we’re also committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce, which reflects the community and the customers we serve.

The Division
The Regional and Outer Metropolitan (ROM) division is focused on understanding the particular needs of regional communities across NSW and delivering customer-centred integrated transport services and infrastructure.

The Opportunity
Right now, we have an opportunity for a Transport Analyst to join the Planning and Programs Branch based in Sydney CBD. The Transport Analyst role leads the analysis of data to identify network and service performance deficiencies and prepare studies/reports which support the development of the transport system to improve customer experiences and outcomes.
Some of your key accountabilities will include:
Lead the analysis of data to identify road safety, transport and traffic management, network management and deficiencies, service performance, and preparation of studies/reports which support the development of the network to improve customer outcomes.
Assess and evaluate the performance of network related project options using appropriate analysis techniques, tools and procedures.
Contribute to program development by providing high-level analytical services.
Build and review traffic models to support planning and programs project teams to deliver key network initiatives.
Lead network performance monitoring and reporting across the region as well as providing information and advice to the Manager for input to media and ministerial enquiries.
Work collaboratively with specialist teams within the matrix branch structure and across divisions to ensure the best possible planning outcomes.

About you
You have an affinity for transport and a passion for delivering better outcomes for regional NSW customers.
You know analytics – its second nature! You have extensive experience using data analytical techniques and tools to provide powerful insights to inform key decision making.
You are comfortable taking end-to-end responsibility for a body of work, managing client expectations and deliverables. Your data interpretation and communication ability allows you to deliver effectively to a broad range of stakeholders, tailoring your communications where appropriate. Success in the role will require collaboration with client groups and team colleagues, as well as other data custodians and specialists, to ensure we work effectively to meet client needs and solve challenging briefs.
You hold the appropriate tertiary qualifications and/or can demonstrate extensive experience in mathematics, geospatial analysis, engineering, transport modelling and/or data analytics.
Transport promotes flexible working practices. Whilst the predominant location for this role will be Sydney based, applications from those in the regional areas are encouraged and location may be negotiable for the successful candidate.

Salary and Benefits

Our Commitment to Diversity
Great people come from all walks of life. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve. We actively promote gender diversity in our workplaces, the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and the employment of people with a disability. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation.
If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role.

How to apply
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application process.

Need Help?

For any enquiries, please contact Blake Murphy at: blake.murphy@transport.nsw.gov.au and quote requisition number 17842.

The Company
Join an industry leader in the Health-care space who's technology has changed the landscape of reproductive health. The company has attributed much of it's success to putting I.T at the heart of their business.
Key Responsibilities:
Extract & cleanse Data from multiple sources using SQL
Utilise SSRS/SSIS & Power BI Reports to assist with Management reporting for key business requirements
Management of databases to ensure applications are running efficiently
Engage in ETL frameworks to ensure bespoke applications and systems are adequately supported
Key Requirements:
Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills
Experience managing multiple databases & extracting data from multiple sources
Data Visualisation experience (Power BI)

Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Regulatory and compliance
Job Location: Macquarie Park, NSW, AU, 2113
Job Ref No: 17562
Employment Type: Fixed Term Full-Time
Salary Range: $135898.0-$152204.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Opportunity

We are currently recruiting for a Data and Analytics Engagement Manager to join the team on a 12 month Fixed term, full -time basis. Whilst we promote flexible working, there will be an expectation to work in our new offices on occasion, based at Macquarie Park.

The role is responsible for the strategic planning, design and implementation for project delivery across customer and partner engagement. Reporting to the Director, Data and Analytics, this newly created role will be reviewing current processes, establishing networks and triage functionalities across the internal divisions. This position will also be partnering with key stakeholders in order to engage and build on current strategic capabilities.

On a day to day basis you will be responsible for, but not limited to:

Be key point of contact for service level delivery across divisions, providing proactive advice on roadmaps, strategy and the application of analytics to enable evidence-based business decisions

Partner with stakeholders to identify and prioritize key use cases aligned to Future Transport outcomes and translate this to data and analytics needs to deliver through functional areas

Contribute to cluster wide customer council to enable prioritisation of Use Case delivery and effectively communicate benefits of each, including feasibility to deliver from co-design with branch peers

Scope and structure use cases to enable analysis and assessment of business requirements into data and analytics solutions in conjunction with domain teams, architecture and engineering

Lead the design and implementation of data and analytics capabilities for the hub and downstream for spoke teams across the divisions

Prioritize the data and analytics product and solutions portfolio and feature roadmap in conjunction with cluster strategic priorities and outcomes

Co-develop business cases to validate proposed data and analytics investments and help prioritise decisions using endorsed use cases and ensure funding is available for branch to develop and maintain assets from new technology innovations

Define and track metrics that demonstrate operational effectiveness and value that the branch delivers and proactively showcase successes across the cluster and media stories

Model collegiate and collaborative behaviours to achieve the greater good for the community, celebrate a diverse workforce, create an environment where people can create and thrive, or support people’s wellbeing

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About You:

We are looking for someone that possesses a blend of data and analytics experience as well as strong verbal and written communication skills in order to build, track and monitor ongoing engagement initiatives that enhance the people experience.

The successful candidate for this role will have been involved in high level workplace strategy with an awareness for big picture thinking and customer impact on a larger business scale. Working autonomously, you will have built an understanding of the complexities across multiple business divisions and be an advocate in sourcing information to streamline our engagement delivery.

Salary and Benefits

The salary for this position is Transport Grade 9 ($135,898 - $152,204) per annum plus superannuation and annual leave loading.

In this new team, flexible working options and career progression, as well as the advantage of taking creative ownership of this role are on offer.

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

To apply for this position, please submit an updated resume and answer all questions within the online application process.

Applications close: Wednesday 4th August 2021 at 11:59pm

We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

In this role you will work with stakeholders to understand their needs and tailor data extracts and reports and analysis to different audiences. Using your strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, and ability to align data products with business goals, you will help this organisation to make the most of their data.

This is an initial 12 month contract opportunity, with a possible extension, based in Canberra or Sydney.
Key Responsibilities:
Gathering, understanding, and interpreting information from many sources; understanding the relationships between various data sets and the limitations of each set.
Data mining/collection procedures ensure data quality/integrity, interpret/analyse data problems and test performance of data-driven products.
Visualise data and create reports.
Support the organisation to deliver quality reporting and analytics services that are efficient, effective and in line with their objectives.

Conduct investigations and analysis to design solutions for projects and/or data system issues.
Provide analytic assistance and training to the organisation and data presentation advice to stakeholders.
Support the definition of data requirements and including documentation of procedures.
Obtain and maintain knowledge of data/information processes (source systems, raw entities, and attributes).

Identification of potential improvements in data capture, linkage, transformation & flow.

Knowledge of business analysis practices/processes.
Experience or knowledge of Machine Learning.
Experience in government or health sector.
Programming skills with working knowledge of SQL, and Advanced Excel.
Experience using data and insights to shape strategy and improve customer experience.
Knowledge of data management and visualisation techniques.
High level analytical skills, the ability to problem solve & to provide business content to data results.
Excellent work ethic, able to self-manage and progress tasks independently.

Job Title: Analyst - Digital Technology and Project Risk
Job Description:
Date: 20-Jul-2021

Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances
Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best
18-weeks paid parental leave

What will your typical day look like?

We are looking for a top performing professional to join this dynamic and fast-growing team to help us meet the demand for digital risk specialists. As a member of our Risk in Digital Transformation team the types of work you will be involved in include:

Advising on the risks facing digital transformations and ensuring that these are appropriately addressed at the right stage of implementations.
Designing and implementing target operating models for digital risk functions.
Defining and embedding risk management strategies for digital technologies such as automation, artificial intelligence and cloud.
Designing end to end risk management processes.
Embedding risk management solutions within client environments

Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work with our high-profile clients across all sectors of the economy, with likely focus on some of our biggest clients in retail banking, capital markets, insurance and NSW Government. There will also be the opportunity to engage with multi-disciplinary teams from across our business to draw together digital specialisms into client offerings.

About the Team

Our Risk in Digital Transformation practice sits within our Risk Advisory practice. We support Australia’s largest organisations to help them reduce risks and improve outcomes from their most complex transformation projects by designing, implementing and assuring risk management approaches across technology and business functions.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:
Experience and knowledge of complex project and program delivery methods, including the implementation of technology solutions.
General knowledge of the latest technology trends (i.e. AI, Automation, Cloud, Agile and DevOps), how these are being deployed across Financial Services and/or other industry sectors, and an appreciation of the risks they present.
Good technology and/or industry experience obtained via a career in industry or another consultancy.
Ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, question the status quo and deliver effectively against challenging objectives.
Experience of working in, or with, a Digital function, ideally on a change/transformation programme.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Possible tertiary or project management qualifications (e.g. Agile, MSP, PMBOK, Gateway, Prince 2)

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

About AMP Capital (Private Markets)
AMP Capital’s private markets business (comprising real estate, infrastructure debt and infrastructure equity) is going through an exciting change, separating from AMP Group and listing on the ASX as its own entity, expected to be complete in 2022.
As a new entity, the business will have the ability to operate independently, efficiently and in alignment with the needs of our global clients, setting it up for further local and international growth.
This exciting path forward doesn’t change the heritage and expertise that we have built over more than 60 years’ investing in, managing and developing iconic assets on behalf of institutional and retail investors around the world.
Over the years, we have been synonymous with some of the most recognised real estate and infrastructure assets around the globe, including Australia’s first skyscraper which opened in 1962, the iconic Quay Quarter Tower which is shaping the future Sydney skyline and some of the world’s prime airports including London Luton, Melbourne and Newcastle .
Working with AMP Capital, as we start our new chapter as a private markets business, you will have the rare opportunity to help shape a new business, whilst building on the foundations of leadership in real asset investment and management, sustainability, technology and innovation.
About Real Estate
AMP Capital Private Markets’ Real Estate is one of the largest direct real estate fund managers in the Asia-Pacific region with more than A$28 billion* in assets under management on behalf of institutional and retail investors. We are also one of the most experienced, with our heritage in real estate investment spanning over 50 years.
Within Real Estate, our purpose is to shape a better future. Our 600-strong team of real estate professionals does this by creating exceptional real estate experiences that deliver sustainable returns for our investors, supporting our tenant customers in their success and adding value to the lives of the millions of people and communities who either shop, work or experience our managed places each day.
As at 31 December 2020. This includes AMP Capital’s 24.9 per cent share of PCCP’s NAV, equivalent to A$1.8b

Purpose of the role
As part of the Retail team, this position is responsible for supporting the Portfolio Performance Analyst in delivering the analytics and insights for the portfolio.

Main focus areas
Retail Sales & Insights

Gather & analyse retail related data (internal & external) to derive top line portfolio performance and detailed tenant performance insights on a regular and ad hoc basis
Manage end-to-end analysis, structure, orchestrate and conduct analysis at varying degrees of detail, from high-level to deep dives on Retail Sales and traffic.
Present key sales performance and trends to internal and external stakeholders
Complete monthly reporting deliverables, including the portfolio sales and traffic reporting and ensure insights are distributed to relevant stakeholders across the business
In partnership with Research & other stakeholders, undertake competitor/peer analysis and benchmarking of the AMPCSC portfolio
Be the main point of contact for all sales, traffic, wifi related queries and requests
Support Portfolio Performance Analyst on all other data analytics initiatives and contribute to the development of retail portfolio insights as required
Assist Portfolio Performance Analyst & Research with consumer insights, business intelligence, data analytics and commercial analysis
Manage and supervise the submissions for all external communications, industry publications & benchmarks related to retail sales and asset information / performance including but not limited to PCA, SCCA, SCN, Urbis, Dimasi etc.
Collaborate with Stakeholders across the business e.g. Divisional Research Managers, Marketing etc. to develop and share insights through the integration of retail metrics, consumer and economic research data
Remain abreast of relevant industry, competitive and regulatory developments
Technical & Data
Execute & refine the monthly sales data upload process, ensuring accuracy and completeness standards are met
Work with Centre Admin, Marketing and Finance Lease Admin team to ensure the integrity and consistency of the information associated with centre data, tenant data and retail sales and rectify any discrepancies that may impact the downstream reporting to multiple stakeholders
Identify, recommend & execute potential solutions for issues related to centre and retail sales reporting that is in line with future AMPCSC BI strategy
Work with both Business and Technical Stakeholders to scope, acquire relevant into the data warehouse and surface the right information in Tableau to build impactful reports/dashboards and analytical/forecasting tools to facilitate business decision making
Intermediate to Strong SQL skills preferred: create stored procedures, views and joins in tables.
Familiarity with programming languages and big data frameworks (e.g. SQL, Spark, Hive, Python, R) is a bonus

Knowledge and experience
Graduate degree in economics, banking and finance, marketing, business, data analytics, property economics preferable with 2-3 years experiences in either property or retail industry
Strong analytical skills – ability to understand the retail market and the competitor framework
Excellent computing skills – proficiency in Microsoft Word & PowerPoint
Intermediate to Advanced Excel
Working experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau (Preferred) etc.
Strong knowledge of best practices for dashboards and BI reporting with emphasis in design and publishing
Ability to visualize the story telling dashboard based on the user interviews and insights: Create charts, graphs, infographics, dashboards, etc. to support knowledge acquisition and decision
Experienced in a similar role within the retail/property sector

Desired:
Keen interest to learn and develop skillset related to cloud based platform (e.g. Snowflake, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud) in particular to querying and manipulating large sets of data to produce value added insights
GIS proficiency (e.g. Maptitude, MapInfo, QGIS)
Demonstrated success or a keen interest and ability in data analysis that drives insights and recommendations.
Forecasting experience using statistical tool or machine learning
Programming e.g. SQL, VBA, Python or R proficiency preferred
Someone who has an understanding of shopper behaviour & retail property, supply chain or FMCG and Big Data e.g. Wifi, Traffic etc.
Retail / Store experience
Understanding and working with Agile processes

Be aware that you are not considered engaged on a role until it has been released by Talent Acquisition through our agency portal. We do not pay recruitment fees on candidate profiles/resumes introduced through any other method.

Senior Customer Insights Analyst

Permanent role
Surry Hills based with WFH flexibility
Key role within the Woolworths at Work (B2B) team

About us:

Woolworths at Work is a newly created business at WooliesX, part of the Woolworths Group, focussing on supplying everyday products to businesses across Australia. This role is key to shaping the strategic direction by enabling and supporting the team with timely insights and recommendations.

About the role:

As a Senior Customer Insights Analyst, your role will deliver analytical solutions to collaboratively support the Woolworths at Work team and help to shape the way we think about our customers by providing deeper insights into how they interact with our business. You will demonstrate a passion for data-driven outcomes which influence sustainable, profitable growth for the business, and you will be enabled with access to the best-in-class systems and tools at WooliesX.

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Lead the design, testing, and integration of analytical capabilities
Build self-service reporting tools and dashboards that enable internal stakeholders and our customers to make better business decisions
Utilise understanding of market drivers and trends to identify new business opportunities, including share of wallet opportunities across strategic vertical markets and customer segments
Provide a deep understanding of account management and customer portfolios, including trend analysis, performance vs targets, and account allocations
Develop new tools to increase transparency on sales pipeline progression and KPI activity levels
Partner with Sales, Operations, Marketing, and Pricing functional areas to drive higher productivity, effectiveness, and efficiency
Act as custodian in the system development life cycle for sales and customer related processes across various IT systems
Ensure there is high data quality, reliability, governance, and proper use across the business, whilst also ensuring quality control and oversight of reporting outputs
Transform analytical output into actionable and results-oriented insights
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders

About You:

A passion for data-driven outcomes will be at the heart of your thinking. You will relish the opportunity to enhance the analytics roadmap for B2B. If you enjoy starting with a blank piece of paper and creating the future, this role will suit you, whilst understanding that a core part of your role will be communicating your findings to senior leaders within the business to gain support for initiatives and projects that will drive sustainable and profitable growth.

3+ years’ experience as a data analyst, engineer, or scientist – preferably in a retail and/or sales environment
A self-starter – able to work with minimal supervision, able to deal with ambiguity, and self-motivated
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of data
Strong data visualisation and communications skills (written and verbal) to present data driven insights in an effective manner
Ability to maximise analytical insights by presenting data in a format that is easily understood by the business
Challenges the status quo and existing assumptions in order to promote innovative thinking and new solutions
Innovative and always looking for ways to simplify processes and automate, with strong attention to detail and an ability to identify/fix gaps in the data
Knowledgeable and experienced in using Tableau, Salesforce, Microsoft Excel, SAP, and/or any other relevant tools
Experience working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments
B2B experience preferred

If you meet a number of requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application.

ow will I help? A
n exciting opportunity for an Information Security Principal Consultant to join the Security Policy and Reporting team within the Information Security Group (ISG) at Westpac. he Information Security Principal Consultant will aid stakeholders and Business Information Security Officers (BISO) to make well informed decisions to secure their responsible areas by assessing, scoping and defining requirements for additional and improved metrics. ou will also be working with Engineers to automate data feeds, influence the data requirements to ensure the right data is being extracted to provide insights. Manipulate, clean and model data for business areas, to provide a clear picture of the state of security. I

ou will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. Senior Insights Analyst - Digital Media
Surry Hills location, with WFH flexibility
Permanent role
Help drive data-driven decision making at Woolies X
About Woolies X:
As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.

Based between Bella Vista and Surry Hills, our vibrant, innovative and energetic collaboration spaces empower our teams to innovate and deliver an exceptional experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online.
We are an agile team who embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. As a team we continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support and learn from each other!
About the role:
The Senior Insights Analyst will work collaboratively with a range of stakeholders to lead measurement strategy and make business recommendations through the analysis of data. This role works closely with our Data Science team to continually improve and fine tune the performance of our marketing personalisation models.
Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Work with squad leads on building and executing measurement strategy for the squad’s work
Develop testing methodologies and recommend actions based on results
Transform analytical output into actionable insights, build clients materials, and engage clients throughout the process (scoping to delivery)
Respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
Work with marketing teams to create a strategy for improving the targeting and channel mix of marketing campaigns.
Who we are looking for:
We are looking for a Senior Insights Analyst with a combination of strong technical skills and highly developed problem solving ability who will be able to work collaboratively to uncover business problems and devise frameworks and strategies to solve these.
Requirements:
5+ years of experience working as a data analyst or other analytics role. Experience in retail is preferred.
Highly skilled in writing complex SQL constructs.
Experience analysing digital marketing campaigns for performance optimisation.
Experience with A/B testing.
Familiarity with digital analytics concepts (e.g. tag management, event tracking)
Ability to think clearly about the underlying business problems and to consultatively recommend data-driven approaches to solving them.
Ability to present insights compellingly through clear-minded data visualisation
Ability to manage workload and relationships in a complex, multi-stakeholder environment.
The role will be placed in a technically diverse team and any other abilities across statistics, data science and data engineering will be highly regarded.
Experience in leading and mentoring junior analysts.
A degree in a quantitative area e.g. Actuarial, Maths / Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Physics etc is preferred.
Joining the Group
As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.
We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion.
As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.
We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.
We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.
We’d love to hear from You
If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au . #LI
Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. #work180

Here at HelloFresh, we're passionate about bringing dinner inspiration to everyday Australians. With 9 years of service under our belt, we are the market leader in the growing world of meal kit delivery services, operating in 15 different countries.

As we continue to deliver fresh, seasonal ingredients and delicious, wholesome recipes to our customers, we see our inspired community of empowered home-cooks continue to grow, and you could be a part of it!

Are you energetic and motivated with a team focus? Do you thrive in a dynamic, high-growth environment? If you're looking for a role that lets you make an impact every single day, we'd love to hear from you.
Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to be part of our Analytics team, whose objective is to help continue the ongoing HelloFresh growth!

Reporting through to the Head of Analytics:
You will...

Provide analytics on a variety of growth and marketing topics, including customer acquisition, marketing mix, retention and monetisation.
Improve our analytics capability: identify inefficiencies and gaps within our analytics process and work to streamline and improve the way the team operates.
Exemplify best practice: develop processes, analysis methodologies and dashboards to increase efficiency and consistency within the wider growth functions.
Enable data-driveness for better decision making: create innovative solutions that enable colleagues to easily track, report and identify trends and opportunities.
Identify growth opportunities: analyse business performance to identify opportunities to invest marketing budget more efficiently.
Use your technical skills: quickly learn about our data infrastructure, extract and aggregate data with complex SQL queries, and make clear summaries for stakeholders in Google Sheets or apply advanced analytics methodologies using Python/R where appropriate

Working knowledge of Github and version control

Strong organisational skills with a proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines
An aspiration to drive optimal decision making and maximum productivity
A logical way of working and high attention to detail
The ability to document findings in a clear and concise way, and present them to key stakeholders
An analytical degree; experience in analytics, data science or marketing is a plus
Passion for HelloFresh and the desire to be part of an extremely fast-paced business

What You'll Get In Return...

Get access to our staff discounts to our amazing meal delivery boxes - 70% off!

The opportunity to work in one of the fastest growing food businesses both in Australia and the world with in excess of 400% market cap growth in 2020
High level of responsibility from day one

Flat hierarchies, constant learning with room for personal growth

Working with a fun, energetic and supportive team

HelloFresh Academies - monthly internal learning & development

A diverse and vibrant international environment, with offices in 15 countries

Job Title: Data & Analytics Information Architect - 12 month contract
Job Description:
A large government agency is about to embark on a large scale, highly visible program of work. A Data & Analytics Program, this challenging project is actively recruiting an accomplished Data & Analytics Information Architect to join their team. Interviewing via MS Teams, the successful candidate will be onboarded remotely.

The primary purpose of the role is to provide information architecture and data design inputs for the Data & Analytics Program. This includes deliverables such as information/data impact assessments, logical and physical data models and data lineage. Secondary objectives of the role include contributing to the definition and management of the collective information architecture; research and analysis of products, services and emerging technologies; and liaison with business managers and users to align with overall technology plans, regulatory, audit, compliance and statutory requirements.

Key accountabilities will include:
Develop the architectural roadmap and design of solutions to ensure the Data & Analytics Roadmap can be implemented
Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, physical data models
Ability to work at varying levels of detail from high level architecture to low level aspects of component design
Create and maintain current- and target-state data architectures for the programs
Define and manage standards, guidelines, and processes to ensure data quality and data management
Demonstrate application of Agile / DevOps methodologies in the context of information architecture
Demonstrate model driven design and ability to work with Scaled Agile (SAFe) and toolsets including Jira Align, Confluence and Jira.
Guide development teams and ensure alignment with information architecture and business needs.
Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies for data management, Information Architecture, storage, data analytics, Data Science, AI and Reporting.
Demonstrated ability to convert business requirements into logical, implementation and deployment views aligning with existing framework
To be considered for this position essential requirements include:
Proven expertise and minimum 10+ years of experience in Information Architecture, Data Analytics, Reporting, Data Governance/Management frameworks and BI Architecture
Proven expertise and solid experience in Data Management Body of Knowledge framework (DMBOK).
Experience in developing modern data platform solutions, data governance and architecture frameworks and processes.
Proven expertise in E2E implementation of practices including information life cycle management and modern data analytics platforms
Excellent understanding and experience of real-time analytics and of emerging technologies.
Experience in delivery and successful implementation of Data Management artefacts such as Data quality frameworks, Metadata management frameworks, Master Data management frameworks, Data Load and handling frameworks, Data security and Data governance frameworks.
Understanding and experience of Cloud Platforms (Azure/ AWS)
Demonstrated experience in a consultative delivery of strategic design, planning and architecture services
Experience in using architecture-based modelling tools (Archi, SPARX EA, ERWIN or similar)
Data/information modelling expertise in various methodologies such as Inmon-3NF, Kimball Dimensional modelling and Data Vault Architecture and Data Vault Modelling
Proficient in SQL and modern analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI etc
Working experience with various technologies like, but not limited to, Informatica, SAP BODS/BO, Cognos, Oracle, Microsoft SQL server, Azure services (ADF, Synapse Analytics, AAS, Blob Storage, Power BI etc), AWS services such as AWS Redshift, S3 etc.

APPLY today to secure your new role. Got questions? Contact Alana on 02 9236 4500.

Exciting role within Financial Crime & Fraud Prevention
How will I help?
As a Data Analyst within Financial Crime & Fraud Prevention (FCFP), this is an exciting opportunity to help design, maintain and optimise data driven rules & models to identify fraudulent activity. You will need to be able to think critically and derive solutions to some of the most interesting problems financial institutions face. This includes identifying patterns within data, developing and deploying new detection scenarios and using statistical/ML models to drive predictive capability.
You will need to be able to extract, transform and understand extremely large data sets from various data sources. This includes managing the data science/analytics workflow from sourcing to interpretation and communication with stakeholders. Key to the success of the role is the ability to mitigate losses from fraudulent activity to the bank while ensuring our customers have a great experience.
Furthermore, you will work cross functionally most closely to an advanced Intelligence team, supporting and assisting with their data requirements. This will require developing regular or ad-hoc reports and processes to assist with stakeholders.
What is in it for me?
You will build your profile internally with a variety of cross functional stakeholders. As well as job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers) you will be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You will also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer. Importantly you will play a significant role in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years.
As a Data Analyst, you will get to be exposed to a number of interesting opportunities:
Data Driven Analysis : source, cleanse, validate and analyse data while working collaboratively to deliver working solutions
Project Ownership : identify and understand new and emerging problems the Bank faces to then execute appropriate analytics strategies
Risk Management : ensuring projects are well managed, while customer and Bank data is private and secure is critical to the function of this role
Career Growth : opportunity to work with an exceptional team while developing your technical skillset with some of the most exciting data sets around
What do I need?
A growth mindset with a desire to understand and innovate trends in the Financial Crime and Fraud Space
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Data Science
Advanced SQL knowledge and understanding of relational databases is a must
2+ years experience in R/SAS/Python programming languages is desirable
Ability to independently manage multiple tasks and prioritise business value
Experience with transaction monitoring, Debit/Credit cards, internet banking or other Banking fraud is desirable
Knowledge of Banking products and processes is desirable
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or PowerBI is desirable but not required
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility- and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

Are you energized by solving tough business problems, wrangling massive datasets, and exploring new analytical tools and capabilities?
As Data & Insights Analysts, we combine analytics and data science techniques to directly influence business strategy, pricing, media investments, retail, go-to-market strategy ... and much more. We use our data and boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it, and how we can grow our brands through immersive exploration and in-depth analysis. We influence the strategic decisions of management and work with multi-functional teams in Australia and around the region. We use programs and tools like PowerBI, KNIME, JMP, Python and apply techniques such as machine learning to analyse data and answer tough business questions. We're business facing and embedded in key business processes.
Does this sound interesting? Here's your opportunity! We're looking for hardworking and data-driven individuals. Join P&G as a Data & Insights Analyst and help us anticipate what consumers want to grow our business.
Your team
You will work with the Head of Analytics & Insights (A&I) for the Australia business, who is based in Sydney. You will be part of a winning team that is made up of business leaders and technical experts working on multi-million-dollar projects across the region and globe. We do this through state of the art analytics, deep understanding of the consumer, and passion for the business.
Job Responsibilities

Lead analytical projects and be accountable for delivering business value.
Lead creation and execution of analytic action plans that addresses top priority business challenges and create valuable insights.
Develop in-depth business and analytical knowledge for building relevant solutions and services - spanning retail analytics, ecommerce, media analytics and others.
Consult and coach business teams on appropriate uses of data, analytical solutions and tools.
Work in multi-functional teams to evaluate business activities.
Work with a diverse group of people within the P&G organization and the global analytics community as well as with external business partners.

Qualifications
Qualifications

Undergraduate or Masters Degree level qualifications. Preferred (but not a requirement) disciplines include: Business Analytics, Business Studies/MBA, Economics, Statistics, Engineering.
Min 2 years work experience in a business-facing role, preferably within FMCG or similar industries.
Track record of solving tough business problems, all the way from understanding a business question to communicating and actioning the solution, leveraging multiple, complex data sources in the process.
Work experience mining vast amount of data using statistical methods or machine learning models to provide actionable insights.
Advanced knowledge of analytical tools. Work experience or certification in SQL and Python or R.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to influence others to take action
Comfortable handling multiple priorities, strong problem-solving skills and a "can do" attitude
Business background and interest and technical/analytical skills are preferred

Positive, pro-active & 'can do' attitude, willingness to learn and to work across many different areas of law.

Highly organized and works with a high attention to detail.

Organisation/Entity: Sydney Metro
Job Category: Planning
Job Location: Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000
Job Ref No: 14623
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $118015.0-$132176.0
About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.

About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.

The Operations, Customer and Place-making team ensures Sydney Metro is equipped to deliver integrated, reliable, customer focused and efficient services. We are also managing large scale place-making projects, designing and developing thriving precincts where community members can gather, connect, shop, work and play. We are proud of what we have achieved so far and excited for the full vision of Sydney Metro to come to life.

The opportunity

Right now, we have an opportunity for an Operations Analyst to join us in Operations, Customer & Place-making - Operations Planning, based at 680 George Street Sydney and other site locations. The primary purpose of the role is to provide a range of rail operations analysis, planning and operations readiness advice and deliverables. A key deliverable will be the development, management and review of documentation considerate of the operational and asset life cycle requirements of the Sydney Metro product. The role will work as part of Operations Planning team, collaborating across all of Sydney Metro to provide operational planning advice and identify solutions within operations and customer focussed working groups and technical working groups.

What you will be involved in

Research and analysis which supports the development of operational concepts, strategies and planning for the future Sydney Metro program of projects.
Planning and facilitation of stakeholder workshops.
Development of operational papers, presentations and reports to support key project decisions.
Managing the complexity, risk and uncertainty associated with multiple stakeholders across various project interfaces and working groups whilst being an advocate for the metro customer and product.
Keeping abreast of current and emerging best practice, Government policy and operational requirements.
Basic team administration tasks

About you

You have demonstrated knowledge and experience within the rail or public transport industry and/or are a tertiary qualified in engineering, planning, or data analytics (or a similar discipline) and you are looking for an opportunity to utilise your analytical mindset in a public transport environment.

Ideally you will have intermediate/advanced MS Excel experience, a strong understanding of performance based transport projects and are a highly analytical thinker. You will enjoy the challenge of data interrogation to identify critical information to be summarised in support of project decisions by the Metro Leadership teams. A passion for data driven analysis and validation is a desirable mind-set.

You will have developed time management and planning skills and demonstrate professional communications skills both verbal and written.

Salary and Benefits

The salary for this position is Transport Grade 8 ($118,015 - $132,176) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.

One day you’re helping us boldly innovate, another you’re leading an initiative, or pitching in where needed. At Tabcorp, each day brings a different challenge and another opportunity – and this is what we live for.
As part of the Data Analytics & Governance team, you will work across many facets of the wagering business. Supporting key stakeholders such as VIP Customer, Trading, Risk, CRM & Marketing, you will also work within cross functional squads to support the wider marketing team.

What you’ll do
As a Data Analyst, you will support the broader Analytics team in delivering reports and insights across Wagering with the goal of improving both financial performance and operational processes within the business. By serving our stakeholders with self service capabilities you will be tasked with spending time on ‘value-add’ initiatives and will be a key advocate for driving a data driven culture at Tabcorp.


Engage with various stakeholders within the business championing analytics.
Automate weekly business reporting processes ensuring accuracy and timeliness of output.
Support the business by identifying problems and providing solutions by applying the appropriate tools and techniques.
Gather requirements from key stakeholders and start new work streams.
Develop and maintain current Tableau dashboard.
Support Senior members of the team with data preparation and/or presentations for key tasks and priorities.
Participate in change initiatives by implementing new directions/initiatives and providing appropriate information and feedback.

What you’ll bring
1-3 years relevant analytics experience.
Degree level qualification specialising in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field, or equivalent experience with data analytics.
Experience using SQL, R/Python and Microsoft Office Suite is essential.
Knowledge with Tableau would be highly advantageous.
Adept at identifying data requirements to answer business questions in a timely manner.
Demonstrates robust problem-solving skills, participates in problem-solving discussions, and suggests ideas as opportunities arise.

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s largest gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.
Our 4,500+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing, Sky Sports Radio and MAX. As an ASX listed company we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.

Job Location: Burwood, NSW, AU, 2134

About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

2 Permanent full time opportunities based in Sydney, flexibility offered
Exciting opportunity to work in a fast paced office and showcase your research, talent sourcing, problem solving and stakeholder engagement skills
A chance to be part of a close knit, proactive team of individuals passionate about producing and delivering high-quality talent solutions
Play a crucial role in our talent transformation

About People and Culture

Our People and Culture division is focused on our most valuable asset – our people. We’re planning for and building a workforce with the advanced skills needed to tackle the challenges of tomorrow. We’re also pioneering a values-driven culture that respects individuality, recognises achievement, provides opportunities and puts the customer at the centre of everything we do.

The Opportunity

Right now, we have an opportunity for a Talent Sourcing Analyst to join us. This role is part of our People Experience team. The primary purpose of the role is to assist in production of a pipeline of qualified talent.

This role assists in developing and maintaining talent pools and market insights by researching, identifying, contacting and attracting relevant level professionals to support talent planning and recruitment processes that enables the delivery of current and future business objectives. This includes direct and indirect candidate sourcing, sourcing channel optimisation and proactive development of talent pools aiding the delivery of strategic project support. This role draws on innovative thinking, deep research capability, project management capability, the incumbent will apply their previous research and/or search services experience developing relationships with the Talent colleagues and HR, in order to align talent pipeline to business needs at all levels and become a trusted partner.

What you will be involved in :

Build our data-driven recruiting reporting and analytics strategy
Leverage latest tools and technology to manage talent pipelines and ensure data hygiene and efficient practice
Working on a project basis to deliver customised outcomes to each business and function across attraction, digital, social, mapping, and campaign strategies offering part or end-to-end solutions.
Researching local and international markets, commercial landscape and emerging workforce trends to deliver proactive sourcing plans
Drive end-to end process improvements and establish clear pathways to achieve improved customer and business outcomes.

About you

We are looking for a passionate research or sourcing professional who has the ability to analyze data, provide insights and recommend improvements for recruiting strategy and operations. You will balance the art and the science of sourcing. You will have strong planning capability, be outcomes focussed and technologically astute. Creates cogent narratives and encourages business partners to critically engage in data-driven decision making. Outstanding interpersonal skills and experience building strong collaboration with partners would set you up for success. Experience with Recruiting systems, technology and tools is a plus

Want to know more?
