Interested?

Right now is an exciting time to join our team as we deliver an iconic $72.2 billion investment into future transport infrastructure and services over 40 years.

Be a part of something big.

Apply today to register your interest!

Salary and Benefits

This is a Transport Service Grade 6 $92,982 – $102,280 plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading

Company Description

NextGen.Net is Australia's leading provider of non-proprietary Software as a Service (SaaS) technology solutions to the mortgage lending industry. We are focused on delivering quality products and services to a range of financial institutions and intermediaries. Our 'ApplyOnline' platform is an industry standard in the provision of digital loan lodgement and assessment. We are experiencing strong growth and have an exciting roadmap full of opportunity in the Australian financial landscape.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented individual to join our Data Management Team.
Reporting to the Head of Data Management, you will be accountable for the management of our databases, all inbound change requests and data entry, to ensure that lenders' product and other information is accurately reflected in our systems.
About the role:
Triage and review all inbound data requests.
Proactive and reactive maintenance of a number of databases supporting our mortgage industry customers, such as lending product data.
Pro-actively seek updates where there is a suspicion data has changed or an update is overdue
Build and maintain strong working relationships with data sources (customer contact).

Qualifications

What you need:
Experience managing financial product data through spreadsheets
Strong attention to detail
Able to work independently and pro-actively
Unrestricted work rights in Australia (Australian Permanent Residency/Australian Citizenship).
What would be nice:
Strong written & verbal communication skills
Prior experience managing mortgage product data
Experience in mortgage origination or processing
Experience with JIRA.

Additional Information

About you
Comfortable working with an agile methodology.
Is able to demonstrate an aptitude for problem solving and issue diagnosis
Is able to demonstrate an eye for detail in their previous roles
Process focused, must be able to rigorously follow and ensure compliance to procedures
Is able to work independently and as a member of a team
Demonstrated ability to meet and maintain deadlines
Demonstrated capacity to learn new skills as required
Ability to work with minimum supervision.
This is a unique and exciting opportunity to work with a leading Australian technology provider. Successful candidates will work on exciting challenges and be given the opportunity to grow professionally within the organisation.
What's next?
Send us your resume and a cover letter describing your suitability for this role. If you have the right skills and experience for the role, someone from our Recruitment team will be in touch.
We would like to thank you in advance for taking the time to apply and inform you that only successful candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted.

This role will work closely with Interest Rate Risk subject matter experts and software developers within the organisation to design, implement and validate new models to meet new regulatory requirements in this space (APS117). The key focus will be on the implementation of an Expected Shortfall model for non-traded market risk, including validation of the underlying market data and pricing models, but the successful candidate will get broad exposure to the wider project and will have the opportunity to get involved in a range of activities. To succeed in this space we are looking for the following experience:
strong quantitative capabilities to support validation of market data and modelling outputs
sound knowledge of financial instruments, including hedging products
model development and testing
Experience in any of the following is not essential but would be highly desirable
knowledge and experience in interest rate risk management and oversight
experience with and knowledge of Asset & Liability Management, Treasury and Balance sheet risk concepts
experience implementing Value at Risk (VaR) & Earnings at Risk (EaR) using QRM or similar modelling tools, and knowledge of APS 117
experience working with large data sets, including use of tools such as SQL, Alteryx, Python, and visualisation tools (Tableau/PowerBI)
This is a great role for someone to be part of a major transformation project within an industry leading organisation. The successful candidate is likely to have experience with financial modelling within a financial institution. Initial contract is 12months, but with a large pipeline of change across Market Risk strong performance in this role is likely to create opportunity for extensions.
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Compass Group is the global market leader in providing food and beverage to customers in a range of food service environments. We operate in over 50 countries, employ over 508,000 people, and are a recognised top 10 employer worldwide.
We’re currently recruiting for a Bid Support Analyst to join our award-winning Foodbuy team. Based in Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth, or Sydney, you'll be reporting into the National Manager of Product Optimisation.
You will work across the Foodbuy team as the focal point for CGA in the receipt, review and response to both proposed new client menu designs in addition to providing the same insight and challenge to BAU menu design refresh across the Compass sectors.
The Role
Acting as the focal point, on behalf of Foodbuy, to CGA and BD clients in providing challenge, recommendations and input to costed menu design
Working within the team in the design, development, recommendations and presentation of sector specified products focused on driving culinary cost and labour improvements
Utilising Foodbuy technology and data platforms to undertake, measure and record sku optimization programs and outcomes
Utilising commercial data to undertake own analysis to support all work and recommendations
Working with Foodbuy to gain insight and support to validate proposed opportunities and recommendations within retail product categories for bid responses
Working with Foodbuy SCEGS teams to gain insight and support to validate recommendations for all services required in bid responses
Working with our Managed Order Guide (MOG) team to create and maintain an online repository of approved sector product lists with live state-based pricing to be utilized as part of bid estimation process
Working with culinary leads in the design, challenge and development of supply and cost-effective menus to support our growth
The Person
Tertiary education is highly desirable, procurement and supply chain preferable
Demonstrable experience in food service, hospitality and/or culinary environment
Proven and pragmatic advocate of driving new opportunities through data-driven analysis and recommendations
Advanced computer skills including MS Office, data analysis and visualisation
Strong communication skills – both written and verbal
Strong interpersonal skills – ability to establish and maintain a positive relationship with senior business stakeholders
Leadership in deconstructing & analysing situations and problem solving through to execution and closure.
Financially astute and able to create compelling commercial business cases
The Benefits
You will have the support, infrastructure, systems and processes that you would expect from a global organisational. To be recognised as an employer of choice we offer an attractive benefits program including a competitive salary and incentive scheme, recognition programs and company discounts. If you're looking for a career where you set the standard for personal advancement, then Compass Group is for you. Working together, we will continue to experience success as the industry's best.

Join an award winning team who have created our IGA Shop Online offering. In 2020, the team won the coveted Canstar Blue Award for the “most satisfied customers” for online groceries. In order to provide our customers with new products and features and continually enhancing our overall digital experience we are hiring!

In this newly created role we are looking for a Digital Performance and Reporting Analyst who will provide performance reporting, business intelligence, shopper insights and recommendations based on detailed data analysis on both online and offline data. These insights will be used to also provide an understanding of program and campaign performance, as well as shape strategy and planning to deliver increasing returns on investment from the Rewards program and IGA Shop Online.

What you’ll do

Establish standardised campaign performance reporting suite including reach, penetration, response, sales and return on investment metrics for IGA Shop Online, and upkeep & improve these reports for IGA Rewards.

Produce monthly & weekly KPI tracking reports at appropriate levels of granularity to provide visibility of program performance to stakeholders across Marketing, Merchandise and Promotions, Suppliers, State teams and Retailers.

Ensure the use of shopper data for all reporting and analytics is done within the frameworks of applicable legislation (Spam Act and Privacy Act) and best practice industry guidelines.

What you’ll bring

A proven track record in BI, analytics or marketing insight roles

An ability to create customer segmentations to target audiences based on purchasing behaviour, trends, geo-demographics etc

Experience with predictive modelling techniques such as Cluster analysis, Linear Regression modelling or CHAID analysis

What we can offer you

Hybrid working – flexibility is in our DNA, so we blend working from anywhere with time in the office, and flexible arrangements to suit your needs

Free on-site parking and convenient access to public transport

An extra week of annual leave after your first year as part of our Fifth Week program, and the opportunity to purchase annual leave to help you recharge

At Metcash, we’re the power behind an independent Australia. For almost 100 years we’ve been proudly supporting local, family-owned businesses – sticking up for the little guys and helping them become the best stores in town. Today we’re Australia and New Zealand’s leading independent retail partner and wholesaler in the food, liquor and hardware sectors. And while we may be large, we’ll always be locals at heart.

So, roll up your sleeves and bring your best self to work, and we’ll give you the support you need to develop a rewarding career and make your mark on the future of retail.

Make your Mark!

Classification: APS5 & APS6
Location: Sydney NSW, Brisbane QLD, Melbourne VIC
Salary: $79,232 - $97,090
THE ROLE
Austrade is Australia’s investment attraction and export promotion delivery agency. We are experienced commercial advisors, with a positive and proactive culture.

As an Analyst in Austrade’s Advanced Technologies and Manufacturing Centre of Excellence team you will play a key role in leading data sourcing and discovery, data cleansing, data analysis and reporting of insights and content that support Austrade’s delivery of trade and investment services.

You are comfortable identifying and analysing disparate data sources to identify trends or insights for use by Austrade’s trade and investment teams.

You enjoy engaging with various stakeholders with an ability to collaborate with partners inside and outside of Austrade.

You find satisfaction in delivering insights or presentations weaved into a narrative, supported by your analysis.

DUTIES INCLUDE
Working closely with a Senior Advisor, and part of a small team with responsibility for providing advice and developing or refining tools to support:

Research and analysis to:
inform Austrade’s investment and trade strategy
influence foreign companies on why they should consider Australia
identify Australian capabilities in technology and manufacturing to be promoted globally
identify challenges and barriers to export and investment
input into Executive and Ministerial briefings
Development of insights and content to define Australia’s value proposition to attract foreign direct investment.
Provide analytical support to Austrade international posts, Global Engagement Managers (GEMs) and investment advisors.

Given our commitment to diversity and inclusion, Austrade actively encourages applications from people with disabilities, LGBTIQ people, women, and people with diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds for all of our roles.

CLOSING DATE
Applications close at 11:30pm, Sunday, 15 August 2021 (AEST)

ELIGIBILITY
Australian Citizenship - Our successful candidate must be an Australian citizen

Security Clearance - Our successful candidate is required to hold, or have the ability to obtain, and maintain a Baseline security clearance.

Guy Carpenter is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Sydney office:

General Insurance Actuarial Analyst
What can you expect?
An exciting opportunity has become available for an experienced Actuarial Analyst to join Guy Carpenter in Sydney. In this role you will utilise your data analysis and problem solving skills to advise clients on reinsurance programs based on risk tolerance level and industry trends.
As a global leader in reinsurance broking, we will provide you with exposure to a wide range of clients and you will experience significant variety in your workload. You will collaborate with colleagues in the Asia Pacific region and maintain relationships with brokers, re-insurers and clients to support new business development within reinsurance actuarial services.
What is in it for you?
Exposure and involvement with a range of high profile clients
Professional environment where your career path really matters and is supported in our global organization
Training provided for required programming languages
Great team environment with energetic and supportive colleagues
Genuine work life balance
We will count on you to:
Provide actuarial and financial modelling consulting services to clients and colleagues
Model the probability distributions of the gross/ceded/net underwriting results of an insurance company client
Work with the catastrophe modelling team to understand natural peril drivers of clients’ financial performance and the influence of natural perils on primary pricing
Analyse how the distribution of results and relevant risk measures changes as a result of applications on various proposed reinsurance alternatives
Utilise cost/benefit analysis to advise brokers and clients optimal reinsurance programs based on risk tolerance level
Respond to client queries and concerns, resolving issues promptly
Provide technical training to clients and colleagues, and stay well informed on regulatory developments in the region
What you need to have:
Excellent communication, presentation and project management skills
Strong ability to handle significant workflow through efficient time management
Strong ability to identify and solve potential problems in their specialty and develop creative solutions
Understanding of the product lines, and the global and regional industry conditions to identify significant considerations that insurers should address in designing their programs
Well-versed in Microsoft Office software and programming languages, e.g. R-Studio, Python
Ability to work autonomously
What makes you stand out?
Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science or related quantitative field such as Mathematics or Statistics
3 - 5 years commercial experience, reinsurance or primary pricing experience preferred
Progress towards professional actuarial qualification, e.g. FCAS, FIAA, or FIA
About Guy Carpenter:
Guy Carpenter & Company, LLC is a leading global risk and reinsurance specialist with more than 3,100 professionals in over 60 offices around the world. Guy Carpenter delivers a powerful combination of broking expertise, trusted strategic advisory services and industry-leading analytics to help clients adapt to emerging opportunities and achieve profitable growth. Guy Carpenter is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The company’s 75,000 colleagues advise clients in over 130 countries. With annualized revenue approaching $17 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading companies including Marsh, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit www.guycarp.com and follow Guy Carpenter on LinkedIn and Twitter @GuyCarpenter

Guy Carpenter is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse and inclusive work environment. Job Title: BI & Data Analytics Developer (Python) – Financial Markets
Job Description:
We are looking for a BI & Data Analyst with technical experience with Python to join our Financial Markets division to deliver business efficiency through process analysis, simplification, and workflow automation!
How will I help?
You will join the Westpac Institutional Bank’s (WIB)Business and Consumer Financial Markets (B&C) team focussed on providing Financial Markets execution, advice, support, and risk services to customers across the Business and Consumer Division of the Group. You will utilise your technical data and Python skills, along with your understanding of data science principles to deliver business efficiency through process analysis, simplification, and workflow automation.
You will work in a team of analysts with skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau and GitHub to support business performance through the analysis of data, workflow, and application development, to deliver tailored and targeted business process and insights which supports business growth and enables a better understanding of our customer base.
You will:
Construct appropriate new workflows and User Developed Applications using your experience of Python, SQL and others and adhering to operating principles for the BIO team.
Collaborate with the Data, Analytics & Systematic trading team to adhere to development and security principles.
Support the development of business efficiency, uplift the general digital capability of the B&C business, and reduce risk.
Identify risks to project or task timelines, and work to address risks identified.
Ensure standardised strong principles of data security, appropriate data access and effective data control are embedded throughout your work.
What’s in it for me?
Job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth and insurance offers) you’ll be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You’ll also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer.
What do I need?
Experience in analysing data and developing applications using Python and SQL, and other methods including Power BI, tableau, GitHub etc., and using this data to identify problems, design solutions and think in an agile manner. You will be able to work autonomously and understand business requirements and problems and can think creatively to deliver bespoke data and insight solutions to senior Stakeholders across Financial Markets.
Some further advantageous skills:
Experience in application and workflow design and development
Able to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
Understanding of compliance and risk obligations relating to data and customer information.
Experience in meeting the operational challenges involved in a highly demanding environment with competing priorities.
What’s it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start Here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces as long as required.

Job Details
Who we are
At illion, we are focused on bringing data + analytics to life. The world of algorithms and data is constantly expanding and data + analytics are at the crux of the value we seek to provide to our customers. Our business is transforming and growing with the aim to explore new opportunities in order to deliver meaningful solutions. Our people are integral to our mission of developing and building our already strong service and product offering in the market and we are always seeking innovative and forward-thinking individuals to join us on our journey to drive this ambition.
The Role
We currently have an exciting new opportunity for a senior test analyst to join our test team in our Sydney office. The senior test analyst will perform the testing of new and enhanced systems (planning and execution), regression and production verification test and review documentation to ensure all test requirements are met.
Key responsibilities of this role include
Deliver quality application changes across cloud and mobile platforms through analysis, estimation, planning, creation and execution of test designs, cases and procedures;
Perform load, UI, web service and usability testing;
Raise defects identified, define priority and ensure defects are resolved by liaising with the project team;
Contribute to review of project documentation and perform peer review;
Provide support for user acceptance testing and contribute to release management;
Conform and contribute to the standards and practices of the illion Testing practice principles;
Assist more junior team members
The ideal candidate will have:
Sound understanding and experience in Agile frameworks and practices
Strong experience in automated UI web testing using Selenium, Cypress and JavaScript
Experience in automated mobile UI testing for IOS and Android using Selenium, Appium and Android Emulator;
Strong experience in Performance, Load and Stress testing using JMeter and Visual Studio Load Runner
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps, CI/CD and infrastructure
Experience in C#, React, TypeScript and SQL for creating unit and integration tests
Good verbal and written communication skills with high attention to detail;
Proficiency in SQL, XML and Microsoft Office (including word and excel);
Tertiary qualification or comparable senior test analyst experience.
If you believe you have the necessary skills and experience, we would love to hear from you!

Annalect is a global data, technology, and analytics consultancy, with offices based in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and major global hubs. We create solutions across data, measurement, analytics, visualisation, and marketing technology to maximise the effectiveness of media and our client's media ROI.
When we launched Annalect globally in 2011, we dedicated ourselves to transforming the effects of data and analytics on media. Now we have learned to transform the entire marketing process.
Developing a data-driven marketing strategy can be exceptionally complex – requiring a range of technical resources to strategise, deploy, monitor, and utilise technology solutions. Annalect, the data, tech and analytics division of Omnicom Media Group, exists to simplify this process. We arm clients with the knowledge, tools, and technical skills required to fully realise their technology and data aspirations to achieve their marketing objectives.
We come from creative, media, consulting, web development, analytics, data analysis and other core marketing disciplines to offer solutions that holistically solve client's marketing problems.
Our solutions deliver data-driven marketing strategies, powered by a connected system of technology, tools, consultants and activation.

The Role:
The Data Infrastructure, Integration and Visualisation team are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to be responsible for supporting delivery of a range of key, data-driven projects, both internally within Annalect as well as across OMG's agencies.
The role is an important part of the project team. To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Acting as the key interface between the users and the project manager you will perform detailed requirements analysis and documenting processes. You will develop data procedures and policies, and work closely with various teams to collect, prepare, organise and drive projects to completion.
The successful candidate will be a self-starter with a can-do, positive attitude.

Responsibilities:
Stakeholder management and communication across executive team, OMG, and regional stakeholders for special projects
Analyse the structure of the business and how it uses technology
Persuade internal and external stakeholders of the benefits of new technology or strategies
Oversee the implementation of new technology and systems
Run workshops and training sessions
Advise relevant stakeholders on data & BI issues in projects
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing & implementing solutions
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing reports
Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements
Performing user acceptance testing
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance
Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Strive to continuously improve OMG's data approach and infrastructures
Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis
Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Exceptional conceptual thinking skills
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Advanced technical skills. Preferably across:
SQL
Tableau
Knowledgeable of ETL principles and processes, particularly within:
AWS
Microsoft Azure
Understanding of database structure principles
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Benefits

Award winning culture that encourages innovation
Work within a diverse team, making positive & meaningful contributions.
Access to top tier clients and complex business challenges
Continuous development through our mixed learning approach.
Flexible working arrangements
Giving Back Opportunities
Pet-friendly oﬃce
Ski trips and much, much more!

Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. CommBank is recognized as leading the industry in IT and operations with its world-class platforms and processes, agile IT infrastructure, and innovation in everything from payments to internet banking and mobile apps.
Your Team
Group Operations Technology (GOT) is part of Enterprise Services. GOT is responsible for the IT delivery and IT service management for all of banks systems used by our operations teams. Our team aligns the individual needs of business units with the Enterprise Services IT platform model.
GOT is responsible for promoting the strategic application of technology into all business units by providing end-to-end technology solutions for business processes like customer lifecycle management, business lending, home lending.
Your Impact & Contribution
The Senior Technical Business Analyst will support the business during the Discovery and execution phases of initiative design and Solution delivery; deliver clear, concise technical delivery direction to their delivery team. Analysis, CI & Communication
This Tech BA role is specifically in the Data team. Where you will be part of the team that helps us navigate through all data management processes of the bank as part of a strategic technology implementation
Elicitation of business goals and requirements, population of coherent prioritized portfolio and product features and backlogs
Continuous review and management of the prioritized portfolio and product backlogs
Ensure business needs are properly modelled, analyzed and reflected and any impacts to benefit benefits are captured and agreed
Identify business requirements for enhancements to systems and/or business processes
Ensures best business requirement practices
Works closely with stakeholders and organizational change management to identify impacts to business processes as a result of system or application changes
Solution Design, Delivery & Risk
Partake in reviews of business requirements and solution designs with relevant stakeholders and leadership to obtain agreement and sign off of proposals
Lead requirements design and support prioritization of requirements
Oversees the analysis, testing and deployment of the prioritized business requirements
Ensure projects adhere to enterprise business requirements methods and minimum standards, including appropriate documentation and controls
Contribute to continuous improvement of business requirements practices and its integration with other delivery practices

Desirable:
Minimum five years business analysis or process improvement experience
Financial Services Industry Experience
Software and solution delivery lifecycle experience
Experience working on technology enabled projects
Detailed knowledge of trading and settlement systems and processes

Desirable:
Relevant IT or business tertiary qualifications
Recognised industry certifications
Any qualifications in Data Management

The Corporate Trust Analytics Specialist will be primarily responsible for understanding (via transaction documents) and then running and/or maintaining financial models for deals using proprietary systems on an on-going basis.

There may also be the possibility of reviewing other reporting analysts outputs and being involved in deal QA testing.

The Corporate Trust Analytics Specialist must have and be able to demonstrate the following:
The ability to comprehend, interpret and analyze legal documents on complex financial structures;
Highly developed PC desktop tools such as Excel;
The ability to communicate effectively with others including colleagues, business partners and other internal teams.
Time management (as reporting is time sensitive)
Project management (as the team often implements significant projects
Qualifications
The preferred candidate may also have a degree and around 5 years in a financial services environment.
Ideal candidates would be people with Corporate Trust experience, operations experience or corporate actions experience.

Due to our large program of work, we're looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our Remediation team. Your primary focus will be on systemic issues which may have impacted our customers/members. You will support the root cause analysis and end to end remediation of incidents within our business.

Key responsibilities:
Understand the business problem and design data analysis required to identify the accounts, transactions and members impacted.
Develop coding to receive data from different source systems, create data sets/cohorts per requirements and generate files to support execution activities.
Manage and take ownership of cases and issues to ensure the customer experience is of the highest standard.
Manage and coordinate the end to end remediation process from root cause analysis to execution of compensation and communication to our members.
Liaise with IT teams and manage data extracts and calculations with finance stakeholders.
Solve for and articulate complex problems.
Continuously seek and raise ideas to improve processes and systems that lead to better member outcomes.

About You
In addition to your strong technical capability you will exhibit strong interpersonal, influencing and negotiating skills that can be used to motivate, influence and advise senior stakeholders. You will enjoy working in a collaborative environment and be an independent, creative thinker.
You will also have:
A relevant qualification in IT, Commerce, Finance or relevant field (preferred)
Prior experience in data analysis and root cause analysis to identify and solve complex problems
Experience in remediation methodologies across large member groups would be beneficial
Knowledge and experience with data analytics techniques such as compiling, integrating, cleaning, analysing and reporting data
Ability to write code to solve complex data analytics problem in R, Python, SAS, STATA, Microsoft SQL, PL/SQL or PostgreSQL
Knowledge and experience creating data visualisation tools and dashboards
Superannuation/Pension/Insurance experience

Benefits
In return, we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company
A professional, supportive and friendly culture
A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits

The Business
IOOF is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations, undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The IOOF group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time, we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).

How to Apply
If you believe you're a good fit for this opportunity, we would like to hear from you. Please apply online today!

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

IOOF is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Accelerated Data Migration Program
Job Description:
Opportunity to work on a high impact data transformation program; long term contract
Access to a wide-range of staff benefits, including gym facilities, fitness classes and café
Provide business analysis services and program support to the Bank’s Accelerated Data Consolidation Program
Do work that makes a difference
Opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to plan and management strategies and activities across the Accelerated Data Consolidation Program (ADCP) to support the delivery of business objectives and outcomes relating to the consolidation of Bank's data on the enterprise data warehouse.
A key focus of the role will be to work with business subject matter experts to understand, gather, document, communicate, and manage the data related requirements and business benefits to Enterprise Data Office (EDO) standards. This will involve working with stakeholders in order to elicit, analyse, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems.
Your team
Reporting directly to the Business and Change Manager, you will be working closely with Scrum teams, external and internal business stakeholders, IT and Enterprise Data Office (EDO) to business analysis services and program support.
Your background
To be successful in this critical role you will possess;
Advanced understanding of business analysis domain and knowledge of tools, methods and communication techniques to extract, develop, validate and document business requirements.
Knowledge of Agile practices, processes and tools and experience in project planning and work prioritisation
Extensive knowledge of data analysis, such as data flow design and data modelling.
Experienced facilitating workshops or meetings with business and technical stakeholders and external parties at various levels.
Experience in business requirements elicitation for Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence tool sets.
Your development & career
Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.
Why RBA?
The RBA pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.
Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Job Title: Systems and Data Analytics Officer - Water Infrastructure NS...
Job Description:
Utilise your project management, data systems and analytics skills in a dynamic role
6-month Temporary assignment Full time, Clerk Grade 7/8 role. Salary range from $97,443 plus super
Hybrid office and Work from home model, Newcastle or Parramatta location

The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment is currently seeking a Systems and Data Analytics Officer to join the Portfolio Management Office (PMO) Delivery Performance team within Water Infrastructure NSW.

About the role
As a Systems and Data Analytics Officer, you will contribute to the development, implementation and maintenance of various project management and related system software and databases to support project management, performance reporting, and portfolio oversight. The role identifies, collects, cleans and analyses data for use in high quality analytics and data visualisation services for Water Infrastructure NSW.
You will be part of a high performing team with a supportive leader that provides opportunities for professional development and growth. The role is fast-paced and challenging. You will have the ability to work in a new growth area within Water Infrastructure NSW where there are genuine opportunities to deliver improvements and make a difference.

About You
To be successful in this role, you will have previous experience in:

Developing and maintaining software systems and tools that support information management, project management, performance reporting, or portfolio oversight.
Developing reports or data outputs with easy to interpret visualisations
Communicating with clients or stakeholders to capture, analyse and report key information, and be able to modify a process or guidance so that it is fit for purpose for your client
Well developed communication skills (verbal and written) and the ability to clearly communicate complex information to a variety of audiences

About Us
Water Infrastructure NSW was established in 2020 within the Department of Planning Industry and Environment (DPIE) as part of a suite of water sector reforms. Its primary purpose is to build NSW Government capability to develop and deliver major water infrastructure projects across NSW. Water Infrastructure NSW is rapidly building its capacity and capability to deliver all the necessary functions to support its purpose, with a focus on supporting the needs of project teams across planning and construction activities to build momentum in the delivery program.

Applying for the role
Applicants must address their suitability by supplying an updated copy of their resume and a brief cover letter (no more than two pages) that outlines their skills and experience relevant to the role.

For further information, please contact Kyle Furner via email at kyle.furner@dpie.nsw.gov.au

Applications close on 5th August 2021, at 11:55pm

A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.

We support an inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels, enabling our team members to drive innovation, productivity, and delivery of high-quality services. We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Our commitment to diversity:

Flexible working options are available

About the Role:
The Senior Analyst role is part of the Division’s Data and Analytics Unit. The Senior Analyst will develop and implement methods for identifying comprehensive data and related analytical capabilities, develop and deliver frameworks, policies and standards to build capability and understanding of the implications of data, undertake analytical projects to answer key energy questions of relevance for the department, support the development of strategic energy policy, monitor, evaluate and enhance program delivery, and support the creation of an integrated, long-term view of likely future energy market outcomes.

The role is also to develop and implement data governance plans to ensure programs are managing their data effectively. This will require you to engage and work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders to conduct data audits, maintain relevant data management systems, and understand the linkages between data and evaluation.

Essential requirements:
Qualifications or relevant experience in mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, information management, finance, economics, or another relevant discipline.
Understanding of energy markets and data analysis techniques including statistical analysis and use of programming languages is preferable (e.g. DAX, R, Python)
Experience with data management and visualisation software (e.g. MS Excel, PowerPivot, PowerBI, ArcGIS)
Experience with performing both technical and economic analysis, including using a range of relevant platforms and techniques.
Demonstrated ability to learn and apply new analysis and modelling techniques as required.


To be successful int the role, ideally you will have:
Proven knowledge, skills and experience in data management, analysis, and monitoring programs.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Strong stakeholder management capability
Ability to work within a team and under minimal supervision.


For further information on the role, contact Neha Nagaraja, Principal Analyst (Energy Data & Analytics) on 02 9995 5970.


About us
The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster brings together the functions from the former Planning & Environment and Industry Clusters.

Our vision is to create thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We focus on some of the biggest issues facing our state. We deliver sustainable water resource and environment management, secure our energy supply, oversee our planning system, maximise community benefit from government land and property, and create the conditions for a prosperous state. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.


To Apply:?

To apply for the position complete the questions on the online application form, supply a resume and a cover letter detailing how your skills are relevant to the role.

Applications Close: 11.59pm Monday 9 August 2021
Salary relative to experience, and ranges from $111,077 to $122,404 + super.

About the role
Uber Eats is looking for an outstanding analytics specialist to join the Merchant Operations team. Reporting into the Senior Customer Operations Manager, you will be responsible for driving data led decisions throughout the Restaurant Organisation.
This role is an exciting opportunity to identify & drive high impact initiatives across the Uber Eats organisation.
What you'll do
Use analytics to provide insights on important strategic decisions and inform business initiatives by understanding the key levers to improve restaurant performance
Measure the impact/further opportunities of the strategies that you execute in order to drive continuous improvement across the business
Create visibility through robust self serve automated reporting reporting
Identify & own opportunities to create efficiencies within the business using automation
Communicate to Senior Operations and Sales leaders on projects/priorities; able to organize and lead effective meetings, collect and provides actionable feedback & communicate priorities and goals effectively
What you'll need
Bachelor or advanced degree in Maths, Computer Science, Business, Engineering, Science, Econometrics, or equivalent
4+ years of relevant experience
Experience leveraging cross-functional stakeholders in order to manage and execute high-impact projects
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong business acumen
Proven data analytics skills
SQL - able to build advanced tables & queries from scratch
Experience with statistics, Python and/or R
Advanced in Excel / Google Sheets
Ability to map out processes and automate these

The ANZ Eats Restaurant team manages the complete restaurant lifecycle from sales acquisition to long term retention and experience. Our 30,000+ restaurant partners represent small businesses right through to global enterprise partners. The Merchant Operations team delivers value to our merchant partners by bringing new products to the local market and enabling safety, high performance, and the very best customer experience at scale.

With Uber Eats, we're building Uber's newest and fastest growing business, spanning 180+ cities across all six continents in two years. Today, Uber Eats is available across many parts of APAC including Mumbai, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Auckland, Sydney and Melbourne - and we're just getting started.
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. IT Business Analyst
North Sydney based permanent role
Sharpen your business analysis skills in a diverse, matrix based organisation
Ensure technology solutions and services meet the current and future needs of large rail business
Join a stable and successful “essential services” provider delivering freight nationwide
Pacific National is committed to diversity in our workforce and encourages women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.
About the role
Reporting to the Future Rail Team Lead, the role of the IT Business Analyst is to understand what the business does and how it operates; examine existing business processes; identify gaps in processes and opportunities for improvements and automation; capture requirements; generate functional and technical requirements and business process maps, and proof of concept solutions; and help design, test and implement the new processes, applications and technologies.
Key responsibilities include:
Elicit requirements using a range of techniques: interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyse information needs and functional requirements and deliver the artifacts as needed including Functional requirements, Technical specifications, Use Cases, GUI, Screen and Interface designs, Test cases/scripts and Training materials
Data Migration requirements and gathering
Work independently with users to define concepts and requirements
Collaborate with solution architects, developers, and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision
Develop communications and change management approaches to ensure stakeholders are fully informed of and aligned to changes
Monitor all projects in the pipeline and work with project managers and delivery teams to manage issues and mitigate risks
Collaborate with the Application and Infrastructure teams to manage stakeholder expectations by ensuring timely review of all project exceptions
Ensure that all IT project work uses and conforms with the Pacific National IT Project Management Framework and any supplementary processes.
About you
With proven business analysis skills and significant experience preparing detailed business cases, you will have ideally worked for a large business and have gained exposure to integrated applications in a Rail, Logistics / Supply Chain Management business environment. Customer focused and results oriented with a passion for excellence and proven ability to deliver to customer expectations, you will be an excellent communicator skilled at presenting information effectively to a diverse audience.
The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, experience and attributes:
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Business Management, Operations Management or Engineering
Business analysis (e.g. BABOK) and Project Management qualifications (e.g. Prince2 or PMBOK)
Accounting qualifications or knowledge of accounting and financial processes or systems
An understanding of Terminal Operating Systems that support rail operations
Experience with data visualisation software (Tableau, Power BI) and best practice methods
Proficient SQL skills to analyse large data sets or write reports
Working knowledge of SDLC and Agile methodologies
Knowledge and experience with ITIL
Exposure to current best of breed business processes and business process modelling, including Financial, Logistics, Supply Chain, and Customer management processes
Strong understanding of the principles of project management
Experience in project estimating and planning.
The benefits
We value diversity, inclusion, collaboration and the contribution of each of our employees. Working for us will enable you to take ownership of your career and gain access to the following benefits:
Opportunities for growth and career development
Access to mentoring programs
Flexible working arrangements (subject to business needs)
12 weeks paid parental leave for primary carer at full pay following 12 months of service
Opportunity to purchase additional annual leave
Provision of Salary Continuance Insurance
Novated leasing and discounts on selected health insurance funds, travel, gyms, retail brands, vehicles and more.
About us
Pacific National (PN) is the largest provider of diversified rail freight services in Australia. We haul a variety of freight including coal, intermodal containers, steel, and a range of bulk commodities and materials that keep the region’s economy, businesses and households running. We operate nationally with approximately 3,500 staff in over 90+ sites across Australia.
Join us as we continue to transform our business and shape the rail freight industry, to achieve our vision of becoming Australia’s recognised leader for safe, innovative and sustainable rail freight solutions.
We are seeking applicants who share our values: safety, integrity, accountability and teamwork and live these values through open and honest communication and respect.
Closing date
Applications close on 6th August 2021.
Next steps
Are you ready to be part of our future?
To apply, please click on the 'Apply' button below and follow the prompts.
To find out more about Pacific National, our benefits and opportunities we offer, visit our careers page: www.pacificnational.com.au/careers

About the Company
As a vital link in the technology value chain, Ingram Micro creates sales and profitability opportunities for vendors and resellers through unique marketing programs, outsourced logistics, technical and financial support, managed and cloud-based services, and product aggregation and distribution. The company is the only globally broad-based IT distributor, serving more than 150 countries on six continents with the world's most comprehensive portfolio of IT products and services.

The Logistics Analyst will be responsible for preparing and reporting on Operational metrics including volume, productivity,Global KPI’s,financial metrics including cost per line, storage saturation and utilization and other defined KPI’s to support the Ingram Micro business
You will be responsible for:
Gathering data, and compiling daily reporting for use by the Operations team
Conducting testing on system enhancements

Collaborating across all areas of the business to ensure data integrity
Identifying trends and highlighting these trends to the relevant stakeholders
Building easy to use and highly informative dashboards

Bachelors Degree is Business, Supply Chain or similar

Previous experience in a Logistics Analyst or similar style role

Highly developed skills using Business Intelligence applications such as Power BI
Advanced skills using MS Office in particular MS Excel
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate a customer first approach, a high degree of accountability and integrity and will enjoy working within a fast paced, dynamic and ever changing environment where you will have plenty of autonomy but will also work with strong leaders who will provide you with guidance and coaching in order to continue to grow your career.

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
About the Role

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology – a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with the Extended Enterprise Risk Management Team.

About our Extended Enterprise Team

Our Software Compliance and Advisory specialists assist clients in identifying, evaluating and mitigating the risks associated with their use of an external organisation’s intellectual property. Our specialists use an independent fact-based, approach to rapidly recover value for our clients, or provide software asset management (SAM) services to help clients control and maximise value from their software assets and future investments.

Work you’ll do

As an Analyst within our team, you will:
Conduct software vendor licensing research
Complete Effective licence Position (ELP) analysis for strategic software vendors using discovery and vendor tool data
Assist with Project Management activities to monitor progress of ELP team tasks
Create materials for facilitating client meetings that will provide strategic recommendations related to the stakeholder engagement
Present ELP analysis findings
Use data to provide trend analysis and assist with determining potential future licensing needs
Advise best practices on point solutions for individual software vendors
Provide advisory and implementation services of SAM tooling solutions
Complete pricing analysis to determine potential cost to organization and assist with optimizing software spend
Determine and aid in managing the impact of software licensing on cyber security
Serve as first level of review for all analysis completed
About your Skills

We are seeking experienced professionals with the following skills/experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information System or Engineering or similar
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel/PowerPoint/Word
Project Management experience
Data Analysis experience
Experience with Software Asset Management and Software Licence Compliance practices is preferred
It’s your career

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

You must be legally authorized to work in Australia without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future and should be able to maintain the required security clearance for this role.

An exciting new role as Markets Insights Analyst in the BT wealth team is now live!
Permanent position available, flexible work options
Markets Analyst
Reporting and Insights

How will I help?
An exciting new role as Markets Insights Analyst has become available. Sitting within the wealth team, your role as reporting and insights analyst will be to determine market segments, create strategy, visualisation and execution on these insights, as well as post analyst reporting. You are always looking for how we can do better to achieve overall business goals and drive value. You will work with other business leads, and metrics to drive insights and provide better tools for the business to use. Your role is pivotal to understanding customer behaviours and scoping out new insights to understand current performance, and possible opportunities which then will be integrated into business practices.

In addition, the analytics teams are investing in developing new capability leveraging Python and APIs to increase multi-channel capability, marketing and insights automation, and focus on value led activities driving strategic benefit. The products you will be working with include; superannuation, investment, insurance, advisor and employer markets, across the whole wealth profile.

What’s in it for me?

A chance to really power up your career prospects – and delight our customers along the way. After all, better banking can't be delivered without the right people. We'll support and actively encourage your career development and growth, giving you flexible work options and a host of some of the best financial and non-financial benefits out there.
We invest heavily in our team, and support continuous training and professional improvement. You will have the opportunity to upskill your Python knowledge on a training course, and have the support of a highly capable team to lean on whenever necessary.

What do I need?
With expert knowledge in Teradata SQL, Python and knowledge in Tableau, you are equipped with the tools to hit the ground running. You have polished interpersonal and communication skills. When working with managers, technical leaders and a mixed group of clients, you are comfortable adjusting your presentation and explanation skills to be understood by a wide range of stakeholders. You are technically confident and comfortable, with expert skills as an insights reporting analyst, data scientist, campaign analyst, or visualisation analysis. You are an autonomous worker, who is self driven to achieve goals, and work cohesively in a team environment. Previous banking industry experience is preferred but not essential.

What’s it like to work here?

We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working, and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer, we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.

About the role
Our Data & Analytics Department is seeking a Senior Insights Analyst to deliver analytical services across our Marketing and Sales Teams, enabling data driven decision making.
As part of the Foxtel Data & Analytics function you will innovate new data and technology, accelerating the analytics capability within the enterprise and become a trusted partner in the delivery of insightful recommendations.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy strategic analysis across the Marketing and Sales Teams addressing key business challenges
Identify key analysis needs and provide end to end management of analysis from briefing to solution recommendation
Build analytical insights into compelling stories to support business recommendations you provide
Provide expertise to ensure analytical outputs from the team are statistically valid and reliable
Design and implement new analysis / modelling processes that will assist the team through greater standardization, speed, simplicity or automation
Analyse new data sources, unlocking new metrics and definitions for development into the data warehouse
Build strong relationships across the business and proactively work with stakeholders to implement processes, allowing testing and roll-out of solutions
Capabilities
Proven experience in a similar role essential with a demonstrated skillset in planning and executing large analysis projects in stages
Successful development and execution of advanced analysis such as cluster segmentation and propensity modelling
A thorough understanding of the fundamentals of statistical analysis to ensure outputs are valid and reliable
Experience working with large volumes and complexed data, cleansing where needed
Exposure presenting to senior stakeholders, providing clear actionable recommendations
Proficient in SQL with a strong understanding of analytics techniques such as regression, cluster, cohort analysis and customer lifetime value, Tableau and R skills an advantage
Highly developed stakeholder management skills with ability to autonomously manage senior stakeholders
Exposure presenting to senior stakeholders, communicating complex technical analysis as simple, clear and actionable recommendations
Past exposure to marketing communications or related fields
Knowledgeable of Next Generation Data Paradigms highly beneficial – cloud analytics platforms)
Comfortable working in a fast paced environment where norms are constantly being challenged
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and achieve shared goals is essential
Experience using Python and or Looker would be highly regarded
About us
The FOXTEL Group is Australia’s leading entertainment and sports subscription television business. Our brands include FOXTEL, FOX SPORTS Australia, FOXTEL Media, Kayo Sports and BINGE. Working at Foxtel means being part of something different, better, special. We put our customers first, we own it, we’re authentic, we focus on changing the game, and we win together.

We have a benefits program with something for everyone, but we’re in the entertainment business, so what would a Foxtel benefits program be without a free Foxtel subscription and discounted broadband.

This role will work closely with Interest Rate Risk subject matter experts and software developers within the organisation to design, implement and validate new models to meet new regulatory requirements in this space (APS117). The key focus will be on the implementation of an Expected Shortfall model for non-traded market risk, including validation of the underlying market data and pricing models, but the successful candidate will get broad exposure to the wider project and will have the opportunity to get involved in a range of activities. To succeed in this space we are looking for the following experience:
strong quantitative capabilities to support validation of market data and modelling outputs
sound knowledge of financial instruments, including hedging products
model development and testing
Experience in any of the following is not essential but would be highly desirable
knowledge and experience in interest rate risk management and oversight
experience with and knowledge of Asset & Liability Management, Treasury and Balance sheet risk concepts
experience implementing Value at Risk (VaR) & Earnings at Risk (EaR) using QRM or similar modelling tools, and knowledge of APS 117
experience working with large data sets, including use of tools such as SQL, Alteryx, Python, and visualisation tools (Tableau/PowerBI)
This is a great role for someone to be part of a major transformation project within an industry leading organisation. The successful candidate is likely to have experience with financial modelling within a financial institution. Initial contract is 12months, but with a large pipeline of change across Market Risk strong performance in this role is likely to create opportunity for extensions.
About the Risk Management Group
The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Annalect is a global data, technology, and analytics consultancy, with offices based in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and major global hubs. We create solutions across data, measurement, analytics, visualisation, and marketing technology to maximise the effectiveness of media and our client's media ROI.
When we launched Annalect globally in 2011, we dedicated ourselves to transforming the effects of data and analytics on media. Now we have learned to transform the entire marketing process.
Developing a data-driven marketing strategy can be exceptionally complex – requiring a range of technical resources to strategise, deploy, monitor, and utilise technology solutions. Annalect, the data, tech and analytics division of Omnicom Media Group, exists to simplify this process. We arm clients with the knowledge, tools, and technical skills required to fully realise their technology and data aspirations to achieve their marketing objectives.
We come from creative, media, consulting, web development, analytics, data analysis and other core marketing disciplines to offer solutions that holistically solve client's marketing problems.
Our solutions deliver data-driven marketing strategies, powered by a connected system of technology, tools, consultants and activation.

The Role:
The Data Infrastructure, Integration and Visualisation team are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to be responsible for supporting delivery of a range of key, data-driven projects, both internally within Annalect as well as across OMG's agencies.
The role is an important part of the project team. To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Acting as the key interface between the users and the project manager you will perform detailed requirements analysis and documenting processes. You will develop data procedures and policies, and work closely with various teams to collect, prepare, organise and drive projects to completion.
The successful candidate will be a self-starter with a can-do, positive attitude.

Responsibilities:
Stakeholder management and communication across executive team, OMG, and regional stakeholders for special projects
Analyse the structure of the business and how it uses technology
Persuade internal and external stakeholders of the benefits of new technology or strategies
Oversee the implementation of new technology and systems
Run workshops and training sessions
Advise relevant stakeholders on data & BI issues in projects
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing & implementing solutions
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing reports
Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements
Performing user acceptance testing
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance
Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Strive to continuously improve OMG's data approach and infrastructures
Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis
Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Exceptional conceptual thinking skills
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Advanced technical skills. Preferably across:
SQL
Tableau
Knowledgeable of ETL principles and processes, particularly within:
AWS
Microsoft Azure
Understanding of database structure principles
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Benefits

Award winning culture that encourages innovation
Work within a diverse team, making positive & meaningful contributions.
Access to top tier clients and complex business challenges
Continuous development through our mixed learning approach.
Flexible working arrangements
Giving Back Opportunities
Pet-friendly oﬃce
Ski trips and much, much more!
For more information on this role or to start a conversation about your future, please don't hesitate to reach out directly at fraser.rix@omniccommediagroup.com.

Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst- Wealth and Investments
Job Description:
• Senior Technical Business Analyst
Max Term/ Fixed Term, Sydney based
Wealth and Investments Technology

As the Senior Technical Business Analyst, you will play an important role in scoping requirements definition, specifications and testing of technical solutions and ensures that the detailed design and operations are fit for purpose. The role will be delivering within a program of work focused on Wealth and Investments Technology.
How will I help?
In GroupTech we are striving to be game-changing technologists, shaping the future of banking. We understand the big picture and focus on things that will move the dial for the Westpac Group.
The Westpac Group has a complex Information Technology environment that needs to deliver to the rapidly changing needs of our customers and employees, the ever-evolving IT landscape, and the Group's regulatory and statutory requirements.
As the Senior Technical Business Analyst, you will play an important role in scoping requirements definition, specifications and testing of technical solutions and ensures that the detailed design and operations are fit for purpose. The role will be delivering within a program of work focused on Wealth and Investments Technology.
As the Senior Business Analyst, you will:
Lead the achievement of project strategy by working with stakeholders and vendors to elicit, analyse, communicate, and validate requirements for changes to business processes, information, and systems
Defining and managing the requirements through the delivery lifecycle to meet business and technology needs
Supporting testing, training, and implementation activities to ensure the successful delivery of the overall business and technology solutions
Collaborate with project team members and partner organisations to ensure strong relationships are maintained and business and GroupTech requirements and solutions are understood
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
Extensive working experience as a Technical Business Analyst.
A strong understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally.
Investment and/or superannuation data experience will be highly regarded.
Experience in Banking or the wider Financial Services is highly desirable.
Understanding of dev environment and working with complex systems are highly regarded.
Intermediate SQL querying with a good understanding of data is required.
You are innovative in your problem solving and will be energetic, pro-active, and enjoy working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment where efficient management of competing priorities is key.
You bring exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills and are able to appropriately elicit information, challenge, and influence stakeholders across a broad range of business functions, to enable the successful achievement of outcomes.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
