#LI-JD1

Who We Are:
Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more – all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.
We are looking for someone who is:
A team player, immersed in diverse environments (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers
A team leader, driving the team’s output: you will be a close partner with a General Manager and will be heavily influencing the prioritisation.
An analyst, leveraging complex datasets: you will need to go through multiple data sources and manipulate it to reach an easier-to-digest format
An internal consultant, sharing actionable insights to help your business partners make better decisions on the full spectrum of the customer journey (e.g. Marketing recommendations to drive customer acquisition; site analysis to improve the UX; operations to improve the “On-Time-Delivery”; etc.)
A storyteller, communicating effectively with all audiences: you will communicate risks and dependencies to help with prioritization, as well as communicating complex analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders to drive data driven decisions. You will use visualization or crisp narratives to deliver your message tailored to your audience.
A scientist, designing and analyzing a/b/n tests: you will design experiments and analyze results to provide insightful recommendations to the business
A student, learning new techniques when required: you will have to learn new skills to get to the best possible recommendations when required. We’ve got you covered with in-house experts and trainings (unlimited access to Udemy on top of company’s workshops)
An owner, solving problems that might appear “out of scope”: you will have to raise your voice if something seems broken and be pro-active to offer solutions
Your Qualifications:
6+ years of experience in data analytics, consulting, business operations or other quantitative field
2+ years of experience mentoring other analysts (or managing a data analytics team)
Ability to understand and prioritize business goals and initiatives
Experience managing and developing highly talented team members
Proven record of helping stakeholders make decisions
Strong problem-solving skills (ability to first translate a business ask into a very concrete question and then to breakdown this question into meaningful analysis)
Compelling communication (able to articulate your point clearly based on your audience)
Good SQL knowledge (aggregations, subqueries, joins, conditional logic, and analytic functions)
Visualization and dashboarding (e.g. Looker or Tableau)
Desired Skills/ Experience:
Degree in math, statistics, engineering, economics, finance, business or other quantitative field
Experience in E-commerce
Experience using Web Analytics tool (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)
Experience in experimental design and A/B/N testing
Experience with a programming language (e.g. R/Python)
What's in It for You?
You will grow and learn a lot. You will be exposed to a wide variety of projects in our growing company, work with amazingly hardworking colleagues, and can solve a diverse set of problems.
You’ll have the chance to create a difference. You’ll be working on projects that can have a real impact on decisions – we are a very data driven company
You will love your colleagues and teammates. You will work with people who are as upbeat, smart, and driven as you are. Our Analytics organisation is a distributed team with hardworking professionals from different specializations and backgrounds.
About Us:
As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth – for both our customers and our team.
To apply:
Does this sound like an exciting opportunity for you? Then we'd love to hear from you! Apply now providing your CV and cover letter. We are looking forward to talking to you!
s, we strive to do more than the law requires

Role purpose
This position’s primary purpose is to effectively manage and maintain rate setting, margin management and rate distribution to the business within RTS and associated systems in a timely and efficient manner. Active involvement with all key stakeholders is essential. The successful candidate will also support other team members by providing data extraction and manipulation services as well as analytical support, as he grows with the role.
Key accountabilities
Manage and maintain rate setting, margin management and rate distribution
Ensure all margins are updated and correct, as advised by Head of Pricing & Commercial Operations.
Calculate all core and non-core rates within RTS and Foxweb ensuring defined schedule is followed.
Ensure core and non-core rate calculations are distributed using site manager as per the agreed schedule.
Ensure all rate sheets are saved to the intranet immediately after the rate calculation is completed.
Ensure all rate sheets are emailed immediately after the rate calculation is completed as per the agreed schedule
Ensure Salt rates are updated as per the agreed schedule; take all necessary measures to ensure rates are updated if agreed timeline is not achieved.
Ensure all ATM rates are updated as per the agreed schedule; take all necessary measures to ensure rates are updated if agreed timeline is not achieved.
Ensure all maintenance (adding of additional stores/account holders and products, moving store between site groups etc.) within RTS is completed in a timely manner.
Undertake all activities as outlined by Head of Pricing including data extraction and manipulation as well as analytical support
Analytical, Reporting and control
Assist in preparing and presenting pricing strategies to the Asia Pacific senior management team that will improve both the short-term and the long-term profitability of the company
Assist in implementation, monitoring and maintenance of all Foreign Currency pricing related activity for various online and mobile platforms, as well as for traditional retail segment
Analytical review of margin management and performance against targets
Perform regular reporting (rates/margins, rates/margins achieved, discounts given, etc.)
Maintain historic rate tables (archives)
Maintain a close working relationship with Wholesale Banknote dealers.
Confirm all Base rates have been updated and are current before commencing rate calculation.
Advise dealers of all changes within RTS.
Advise dealers of any unconfirmed variances in rates
Key interfaces/ relationships
Head of Pricing: To ensure margins and rate management is updated and amended as outlined.
Dealing Operations: To gain alignment on base rate setting and rate updates across geographies
Regular communication with: IT, Sales & Marketing
Role specific experience and skills
Essential
Tertiary qualifications in Business/Finance/Economics or other related field
Very strong analytical skills
Strong technical skills, including advanced working knowledge of Excel including VBA
Ability to problem solve
Excellent communication abilities
1+ years of experience in a similar role
Desirable
Understanding of financial markets and the impact their movements may have on customer demand
Experience with RTS within Travelex Australia
Knowledge of Access/SQL, Python, R
Experience in a medium size commercial and professional organisation which is customer and sales focused
General experience and personal qualities
Self-motivated person
Ability to work independently
Strong attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of people

Our Macquarie Asset Management division has embarked on an ambitious roadmap for Identity and Access Management transformation and is now seeking a Business Analyst to join our Document & Identity Governance team based in Sydney. The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team performs a vital role for Macquarie Group ensuring access is provided to Macquarie systems to the right users for the right reasons at the right time.

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with diverse stakeholders representing the asset management business, technology, and operational risk. You will perform business analysis activities for the design and onboarding of asset management applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ) as well as business process mapping for business Roles, Segregation of Duties (SoD) and other IAM related activities.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

engaging business and technology subject matter experts to gather requirements and identify strategic solutions for system integration with SailPoint
mapping business processes to build out SoD and business roles where appropriate.
ensuring all requirements are completed to smoothly transition to Design and Development phases with the MAM Technology UAM team
identifying data issues and work with appropriate resources to resolve them
developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases

To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously and coordinate multiple assignments. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are expected as is the ability to engage and build relationships at all levels, particularly when under pressing and time-driven circumstances. You have a good understanding of IAM domains such as Access Management, Identity Life cycle Management, Privileged Access Management, Reporting, and analytics and have experience in SailPoint IdentityIQ, or similar Identity and Access Management tool.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, please .

About Macquarie Asset Management

Macquarie Asset Management is a large scale, global asset manager, providing clients with access to a diverse range of capabilities and products across infrastructure, real estate, natural resources, private credit, fixed income, equities, multi-asset and liquid alternatives. As at 31 March 2021, Macquarie Asset Management had $A562.2 billion of assets under management.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the trust placed on us and the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers. We never lose sight of it.
Our Purpose
MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide over 1.15 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most.
Our purpose is supported by Our Values: Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers and each other that defines who we are.
Our Strategy
Our Strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support everyone to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution.
With more about 1,500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion are core to us. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.
The Role
We currently have two permanent opportunities in our Product, Pricing and Proposition function as a Technical and Research Analyst.

This team has a focus on building trust by developing propositions and designing and managing products that meet customer needs and deliver on our promises. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the product research, regulatory and technical aspects to build customer trust and provide partner support.
Your responsibilities will include:
Monitoring and conducting analysis of the Australian insurance market including competitors across product pricing, features and services.
Providing periodic (and ad-hoc) updates on MLC Life Insurance’s competitive position for internal stakeholders
Supporting and conducting analysis and impact assessment of current and proposed regulatory change including communication of opportunities and impacts
Ensuring research houses accurately reflect our product features and premium rates
Assist in developing and maintaining a technical training, advice strategies and presentation library in support of key internal and external partners including advisers
Identifying and maintaining access to sources of market intelligence
Data extraction and manipulation from multiple data sources
Providing accurate product data / written submissions for tenders, awards and surveys.
About You
Degree qualifications in a business-related field, or equivalent extensive insurance experience. RG146 qualification or a willingness to obtain.
Demonstrated experience in an insurance or investment research, technical or data type role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in using excel, Power BI and SQL to interrogate data
Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously, to achieve planned goals and objectives
Strong internal and external stakeholder engagement
Strong interpersonal skills to influence stakeholders and resolve issues
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Why Choose Us?
At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:
work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality
enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution
embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer
access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and
wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.

Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position.

hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
What’s so exciting about this role?
We have an exceptional opportunity for an IT/Finance Business Analyst as a fixed term contractor, to the end of FY22 to help drive a Finance Transformation Project to success. The role will join our CRM/Commercial Team, which sits within Enterprise IT. This is a perfect role for someone with a strong Finance background to work in an exciting project within a vibrant Fintech! Our CRM/Commercial team is responsible for the delivery of improvements across diverse technologies and parts of the business – Sales, Operations and Finance.
What does an average day look like?
As a member of the team, you will be a key conduit in facilitating relationships within the Project Team, other internal teams and third-party vendors by running workshops and meetings as required
You will be responsible for the capture and documentation of clear and concise requirements, tasks and issues in JIRA using your strong communication, analytical skills and problem-solving skills
You will have the opportunity to work closely with technical teams and provide input in designing solutions
You will be closely involved throughout the testing phase, (e.g. running functional testing, regression testing and coordinating user acceptance testing)
You will deliver training and coordinate implementation activities
You will be working closely with the Finance team, technical delivery team and Project Manager, so you’ll have plenty of support and guidance to help ensure good outcomes and business solutions.
Who will thrive in this role?
The Finance Business Analyst interfaces with multiple parties across the business, IT product teams and external vendors, so your exceptional communication abilities, agile mindset and collaborative ethos will be crucial to your success.
You are flexible, driven and passionate about customers; you can operate in and contribute to a fast paced and dynamic environment and you bring excellent multi-tasking skills and a focus on delivering outcomes.
We’re looking for someone who has:
5+ years of overall Business Analysis experience, 2+ years in an agile environment
Proven track record of delivering Finance related projects
Detailed Finance business understanding in many of the following areas:
Financial Control experience (e.g. Bank Statement / Suspense Reconciliation, Cash Management, Double Entry Accounting)
Industry and Financial Reporting (eg. APRA reporting)
Tax & GST reporting)Working with Financial Data and Reporting experience
Treasury/securitisation,
Compliance Reporting (eg APRA), Tax & GST reporting
Financial understanding of Products like Leases, Credit Cards, Loans, BuyNowPayLater(BNPL) for both Consumer and Commercial customers
Treasury/securitisation
Strong technical skills and experience with:
Technical or Operational knowledge of ERP Systems like Oracle Fusion
Strong experience using SQL queries (SQL Mgt Studio) to extract data from source systems
Strong experience in working with tools (like Excel) to manipulate Financial data to validate and confirm data
Experience with subledgers in product source systems
Outstanding ability to analyse, isolate and understand business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions.
Ability to create and execute test cases based on requirements documented
Ability to communicate with senior stakeholders, vendors and team members
Strong visual, verbal, and written communication skills that enable you to lead and facilitate interactions with team members and to drive positive outcomes.
Experience in leading workshops and training sessions
Strong customer service focus
Knowledge and application of business process re-engineering
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
 Working at hummgroup

humm embraces flexible working arrangements, ensuring a genuine work-life balance and fun, vibrant culture – a team of highly engaged and high performing people, all intent on revolutionising the way people pay.

Do you have a passion for finding solutions, an enquiring mind and an eye for detail? Are you looking for an opportunity to expand on your existing knowledge and develop new skills through on the job learning and formal training? Does the thought of working in a leading forensic accounting and data team excite you? If so, then this opportunity may be for you!

Based in our Sydney office, you will have access to:
World-class learning and leadership programs
Opportunities for professional development
Flexible working environment – work in a way that suits you best

About the team

Deloitte Forensic is the pre-eminent forensic practice in Australia. Our team in Sydney are market leaders. Our growth has created an outstanding opportunity for someone with a hunger for success to join our market leading team in Sydney.

Through the process of forensic examination, data collection and analysis we provide insights to our clients to assist them in making informed decisions in sensitive and high-profile investigations and legal proceedings.

This role provides a great opportunity for the right candidate to work closely with market leading forensic specialists.

Enough about us. Let’s talk about you.

You are an ambitious person with a great motivation to learn. You understand that data is all around us and is in everything we do.

To be considered for this role, you must:
Have an interest in exploring how to use data to solve complex problems
Have a desire to learn and explore analytic techniques
Seek to critically analyse business processes and supporting data
Work through complex issues to deliver actionable insights and solutions
Have the desire to work collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Have an enquiring and curious mind
Be excited for a new challenge.
Prior experience and/or qualifications in a field relating to accounting, data analytics or business processes is valued but not essential.

What will your typical day look like?

You will participate in the delivery of a wide range of forensic services to clients across a variety of industries and sectors.

In this role, you will be exposed to:
A large and diverse range of clients across a variety of industries
Engagements which deliver the full range of forensic services including investigations, disputes, financial crime advisory, forensic technology and analytical solutions
Diverse work where there are many solutions to a problem and where the best solution for the client is always sought
Designing of tailor made products and solutions for our clients
Unique engagements with ever-changing situations and data sets
An energetic and dynamic environment, with approachable Partners within a flat structure
Exceptional career development in a global business
Deloitte forensic teams nationally and internationally.

Why Deloitte?

We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing individuals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social – and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of diversity and inclusion.

Next steps

Does this sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, feel free to contact Brad Tamaskar from the Talent Acquisition team on 02 8260 4313.

External Job Title

Senior Analyst - Forensic Analytics

By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.

The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profit and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Consulting brings this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.
As a Data Analytics Technical Specialist in our Microsoft Team, your impact will be seen by:
Gathering business requirements from stakeholders and translating them into technical requirements
Creating and gaining approval of design documents
Managing the technical delivery using either of Agile or Waterfall methodologies in project delivery
Oversee and implement data solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform using a combination of Azure native services or Industry solutions (XaaS)
Developing and maintain data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, and analytical models needed for business, financial and operational analysis and/or reporting
Developing highly performant, secure, reliable and scalable solutions
The work you do will vary from project to project but will typically include developing data ingestion frameworks and modules, building data models, building reports, dashboards and scorecards and doing data exploration and visual analytics using Microsoft tools and technology. Please note it is not a requirement for you to be expert in all of what is listed below, we are looking for expertise in a couple of areas and a willingness to learn and keep up to date with future technology.
Must have skills:
Expertise with Data Warehousing and data modelling design techniques and principles
Expertise with Power BI development, service configuration and deployment techniques
Expertise with DAX, M Language and writing SQL based queries
Experience with compute services using tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HDInsights
Experience with database services such as Azure Synapse and /or Azure SQL
Experience with data lakes resources using Azure Blob Storage, and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
Good understanding of Azure data platform architectures and design patterns
Nice to have skills:
Experience embedding Power BI into other Microsoft 365 and Microsoft D365 environments.
Experience with Data Governance techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with Data Quality techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with real time data ingestion using Azure Event Hub, Stream Analytics
Expertise with monitoring using Azure Monitor, Log Analytics
Expertise with Azure Key Vaults for credentials management
Experience with performing data migration
Good understanding of Big Data Architectures and design patterns
Performance tuning of high-volume transactions and databases
Data science expertise
About you
You have a solid background in Microsoft Azure Data Platform and Analytics stack and can use technology to solve business problems. You have demonstrated experience in implementing enterprise grade Business Intelligence, Data and Analytics solutions using various SQL Server, Azure services and Power BI and are quick to learn new concepts. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate
Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer

Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Regulatory and compliance
Job Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU, 2020
Job Ref No: 13718
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $103965.0-$116441.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division

The Legal, Privacy and Internal Audit Branch, is within the Corporate Services division providing strategies, solutions and services that make our clients’ working lives easier and their projects more efficient and effective. Our high-performing teams work collaboratively across the organisation, partnering to provide critical advice, analysis and guidance for sensitive and complex matters.

The Opportunity

With the goal of delivering ever greater public value for the people of NSW, our branch is undergoing an organisational transformation including streamlining processes, enhancing the breadth and depth of our internal specialist skill-set and investing in our operational capabilities. With a focus on growing our Branch Operations team, we are seeking 4 x permanent Business Analysts to join our expanding team to undertake roles in process improvement/digital enablement, data analytics and human resources.

Our Business Analysts will support across our branch in process innovation, change management, resource planning and management, data analytics and business reporting. Our business analysts will undertake research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with stakeholders from across the business.

What you will be involved in

Develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of service delivery.
Partner with external and internal clients and stakeholders to ensure business improvements align with the long-term business strategies.
Perform regular environmental scans and research analysis and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements that can be achieved.
Maintain knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, analysing and delivering data.
Assist business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions.
Manage support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes.
Work positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.

About You

You will have tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience.
You will have demonstrated experience, potentially from a consulting background – ideally in change management.
You will be detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
You will possess experience delivering on digital enablement, process automation and business process improvement experience and resource management.
You will possess analytical thinking and problem solving.
You will have the ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a collaborative team environment whilst maintaining a high level of work ethic.
You will also possess exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.

Key Knowledge and Experience
Extensive knowledge of business design and improvement processes.
Experience working in customer service and technology environments.

Want to know more?
Please click here to view a copy of the position description

Salary and Benefits

Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.
For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a covering letter which identifies your preferred roles and order of preference:
process improvement/digital enablement
data analytics
or human resources

In your covering letter you will also need to answer the following two questions:
1. Describe your contribution to a change management initiative and the artefacts you prepared? (Maximum 350 words)
2. Describe a program of work or project that you had primary responsibility for delivering? (Maximum 350 words)

Apply today to register your interest!

Applications close: 11:59pm, Monday 9th August 2021.


We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email DYANNA HERNANDEZ at DYANNA.HERNANDEZ@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
How will I help?
As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
You will prepare fraud performance reports that accurately reflect the impact of fraud on the Westpac Group as well as maintain the integrity of data contained in fraud case management systems and the fraud general ledger by performing reconciliations and partnering with other fraud teams within Westpac. You will also prepare financial and statistical reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis and support the restoration of funds to customers in a timely manner.
You will understand and meet compliance/regulatory fraud reporting requirement as well as prepare and submit various reports to external bodies.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
You will have SAS coding experience paired with strong excel skills and extensive accounting knowledge. You will be proficient in analysing and interpreting and translating data and have experience in producing Management Reports. Reconciliation experience is desirable and you will preferably come from a banking background (or any other highly regulated environment).
You will have a high attention to detail paired with strong communication skills. You will be able to build strong and effective relationships and be a self leader.
What’s it like to work there?
Joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

Why Sunsuper?
Driven by a shared purpose and core values, we are one of Australia’s largest, fastest growing and most highly rated superannuation funds that exists to benefit our members. When you work for Sunsuper, every day is another opportunity to inspire and empower Australians to fulfil their retirement dreams – we think that’s pretty special.
We care deeply about our people and our teams are as diverse and unique as the members we live to inspire and empower. Our inclusive culture encourages and empowers all of us to belong, learn and connect with each other, because when you are part of the Sunsuper team, you will be valued and heard in a respectful and inclusive workplace where you can be your authentic self every day.
Flexibility is a foundation of our inclusive culture and we are committed to supporting you to make flexibility work for you, your leader and your team. At Sunsuper, we believe flexibility is for everyone, and we embrace everyone’s different personal circumstances and preferences. We support you to manage the ever-changing demands of work and personal life.
About the role
To support our success we are currently seeking a Portfolio Analyst to join the Investment Risk team in our Sydney office.
Working with members of the Investment Strategy team, other colleagues at Sunsuper and external advisors you will provide investment risk analysis and support for the development, implementation and ongoing review of Sunsuper’s investment strategy. You will also support the Investment Risk function and the Head of Portfolio Strategy with the development and management of Sunsuper’s investment risk capability within the Portfolio Strategy team.
This role is available as a permanent opportunity.
About you
To ensure success you will possess:
Tertiary qualification, preferably in finance, economics, commerce, mathematics, actuarial studies, engineering or a related discipline.
Minimum 3 years of work experience in the investment industry, and working toward post graduate qualifications.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications, with relevant computer programming experience in Matlab, VBA, R, Python or related language.
Advanced analytical and numerical skills.
Our promise to you
Every moment of your journey with us matters and we are committed to providing our people with a great experience. Our Sunsuper team members enjoy an employee promise with our culture and values at its heart, with benefits including:

Your Business
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers. We offer market-leading products and services, supported by some of the world’s best systems and processes.
Your Team
The Customer Stream within Program of Action (Customer PoA) is responsible for strengthening the Group’s Financial Crime compliance capability through uplifting the following policies, processes and systems:
Customer Risk Assessment (CRA);
Customer Population Management;
Customer data uplift
Ongoing Customer Due Diligence (OCDD) and Enhanced Customer Due Diligence (ECDD) enhancements.
We partner with stakeholders across the Business to drive execution and alignment to the Group strategy.
Your Impact & Contribution
You are empowered by the business sponsor of an initiative(s) to convey the vision and work with the team on a daily basis to achieve it. You are the voice of the customer and ensure stakeholder needs are met. Coordinate and manage the analysis required to support the Customer Program of Action Product
Owners and the interdependencies of overlaid backlog items. Your role will primarily focus on supporting the Customer PoA’s CRA initiative as the program moves towards execution. You should be prepared to support in the development of business cases, uplift of customer data, assisting in building user stores or conducting detailed analysis into issues.
Your Responsibilities
As a Business Analyst you will:
Identify relevant stakeholders, select appropriate techniques and processes to derive and manage requirements
Assess and document the current state of business functions and processes to identify and recommend improvements, including application of User and customer journeys
Lead requirements elicitation, including workshops to capture requirements. Constructively challenge stated requirements
Articulate requirements and communicate business and customer value to the project delivery / scrum team. Help establish success criteria.
Contribute to the conversion of business and customer needs into functional designs
Define problems and opportunities. Perform data analysis that can be used to support or challenge business initiatives
Support the project delivery / scrum team to break down work and translate requirements into functional specifications using appropriate method (e.g. backlog creation, user stories, as-built functional documentation etc.).
Contribute to assessment of dependencies and associated risk and compliance implications of requirements and solutions
Support business verification testing activities
Effectively communicating requirements to stakeholders, managing conflicts, issues and changes in order to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope
Your Skills & Experience
Strong stakeholder management skills and a strong customer focus
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Data analysis and problem solving skills
Facilitate change management to ensure successful implementation, including user acceptance testing (UAT), user documentation, training and support
Support in preparing high level summaries, reports, presentations packs for senior managements
Experience in continuous improvement activity
Ability to build business requirements and design and implement new processes
Ability to identify areas of opportunity in existing process analysis/design
Project delivery experience or business analyst experience is advantageous
The capacity to work in a busy, commercial, competitive environment and the ability to meet objectives and deliver exceptional customer service
Microsoft Office suite skills, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint Demonstrable knowledge and background in compliance and operational risk management
Your Qualifications
Tertiary/post graduate level education in business management, strategy and/or finance
AML/CTF & KYC expertise (2-5 years)

Description

This job is for you if you're an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company - and an industry - where you'll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience. You'll also have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills that make you the ideal team player. The nature of the role means that analysts travel frequently, so you'll need to be ready to jet-set across the globe.

Our Macquarie Asset Management division has embarked on an ambitious roadmap for Identity and Access Management transformation and is now seeking a Business Analyst to join our Document & Identity Governance team based in Sydney. The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team performs a vital role for Macquarie Group ensuring access is provided to Macquarie systems to the right users for the right reasons at the right time.

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with diverse stakeholders representing the asset management business, technology, and operational risk. You will perform business analysis activities for the design and onboarding of asset management applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ) as well as business process mapping for business Roles, Segregation of Duties (SoD) and other IAM related activities.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

engaging business and technology subject matter experts to gather requirements and identify strategic solutions for system integration with SailPoint
mapping business processes to build out SoD and business roles where appropriate.
ensuring all requirements are completed to smoothly transition to Design and Development phases with the MAM Technology UAM team
identifying data issues and work with appropriate resources to resolve them
developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases

To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously and coordinate multiple assignments. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are expected as is the ability to engage and build relationships at all levels, particularly when under pressing and time-driven circumstances. You have a good understanding of IAM domains such as Access Management, Identity Life cycle Management, Privileged Access Management, Reporting, and analytics and have experience in SailPoint IdentityIQ, or similar Identity and Access Management tool.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, please .

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. See yourself in our team? We’re interested in hearing from people who have:

If you have an appreciation for Data Management and are looking to build your career in this rapidly growing specialisation, there is a unique and exciting opportunity to join the Group Data Office within Macquarie’s Financial Management Group. This role will see you working closely with stakeholders across the business to identify critical data and drive effective data management across our group.

What impact will you have?

As a Data Management Executive, you will work alongside large change initiatives, guiding the implementation of our data management steps. You will build relationships with these stakeholders, helping to increase understanding of data governance and promote accountability for its ongoing implementation.

In joining the team, you will:

support the Group Data Officer in the strategy and project planning for data management processes and policies
work with stakeholders to understand their critical data, business processes and data flows & controls
be involved in documentation and data element mapping across systems (definitions, validations, lineage, and assessment of data controls)
work to implement and embed the use of new data management tools across the business
assist with designing processes and templates to facilitate effective data management.

To be successful in the role, you will possess 2 + years’ experience working with data management principles. This experience may have been gained through building data solutions, identifying data requirements or addressing data quality issues. Other key skills include:

knowledge of data management and data governance principles
prior experience translating technical concepts into business concepts
ability to produce detailed documentation – including mapping business processes and data elements
excellent communication skills and desire to partner with business stakeholders to solve interesting problems.

This is an exciting opportunity where you will find yourself involved in diverse work, utilising your strong communication skills to work collaboratively with and build relationships across multiple business groups.

About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division

The Legal, Privacy and Internal Audit Branch, is within the Corporate Services division providing strategies, solutions and services that make our clients’ working lives easier and their projects more efficient and effective. Our high-performing teams work collaboratively across the organisation, partnering to provide critical advice, analysis and guidance for sensitive and complex matters.

The Opportunity

With the goal of delivering ever greater public value for the people of NSW, our branch is undergoing an organisational transformation including streamlining processes, enhancing the breadth and depth of our internal specialist skill-set and investing in our operational capabilities. With a focus on growing our Branch Operations team, we are seeking 4 x permanent Business Analysts to join our expanding team to undertake roles in process improvement/digital enablement, data analytics and human resources.

Our Business Analysts will support across our branch in process innovation, change management, resource planning and management, data analytics and business reporting. Our business analysts will undertake research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with stakeholders from across the business.

What you will be involved in

Develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of service delivery.
Partner with external and internal clients and stakeholders to ensure business improvements align with the long-term business strategies.
Perform regular environmental scans and research analysis and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements that can be achieved.
Maintain knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, analysing and delivering data.
Assist business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions.
Manage support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes.
Work positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.

About You

You will have tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience.
You will have demonstrated experience, potentially from a consulting background – ideally in change management.
You will be detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
You will possess experience delivering on digital enablement, process automation and business process improvement experience and resource management.
You will possess analytical thinking and problem solving.
You will have the ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a collaborative team environment whilst maintaining a high level of work ethic.
You will also possess exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.

Key Knowledge and Experience
Extensive knowledge of business design and improvement processes.

As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
How will I help?
As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
You will prepare fraud performance reports that accurately reflect the impact of fraud on the Westpac Group as well as maintain the integrity of data contained in fraud case management systems and the fraud general ledger by performing reconciliations and partnering with other fraud teams within Westpac. You will also prepare financial and statistical reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis and support the restoration of funds to customers in a timely manner.
You will understand and meet compliance/regulatory fraud reporting requirement as well as prepare and submit various reports to external bodies.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
You will have SAS coding experience paired with strong excel skills and extensive accounting knowledge. You will be proficient in analysing and interpreting and translating data and have experience in producing Management Reports. Reconciliation experience is desirable and you will preferably come from a banking background (or any other highly regulated environment).
You will have a high attention to detail paired with strong communication skills. You will be able to build strong and effective relationships and be a self leader.
What’s it like to work there?
Joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

About us
Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.
The Division
The Legal, Privacy and Internal Audit Branch, is within the Corporate Services division providing strategies, solutions and services that make our clients’ working lives easier and their projects more efficient and effective. Our high-performing teams work collaboratively across the organisation, partnering to provide critical advice, analysis and guidance for sensitive and complex matters.
The Opportunity
With the goal of delivering ever greater public value for the people of NSW, our branch is undergoing an organisational transformation including streamlining processes, enhancing the breadth and depth of our internal specialist skill-set and investing in our operational capabilities. With a focus on growing our Branch Operations team, we are seeking 4 x permanent Business Analysts to join our expanding team to undertake roles in process improvement/digital enablement, data analytics and human resources.
Our Business Analysts will support across our branch in process innovation, change management, resource planning and management, data analytics and business reporting. Our business analysts will undertake research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with stakeholders from across the business.
What you will be involved in
Develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of service delivery.
Partner with external and internal clients and stakeholders to ensure business improvements align with the long-term business strategies.
Perform regular environmental scans and research analysis and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements that can be achieved.
Maintain knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, analysing and delivering data.
Assist business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions.
Manage support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes.
Work positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.
About You
You will have tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience.
You will have demonstrated experience, potentially from a consulting background – ideally in change management.
You will be detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
You will possess experience delivering on digital enablement, process automation and business process improvement experience and resource management.
You will possess analytical thinking and problem solving.
You will have the ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a collaborative team environment whilst maintaining a high level of work ethic.
You will also possess exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.
Key Knowledge and Experience
Extensive knowledge of business design and improvement processes.
Experience working in customer service and technology environments.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Process Management and Continuous Improve...
Job Description:
Your Business
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers. We offer market-leading products and services, supported by some of the world’s best systems and processes.
Your Team
The Customer Stream within Program of Action (Customer PoA) is responsible for strengthening the Group’s Financial Crime compliance capability through uplifting the following policies, processes and systems:
Customer Risk Assessment (CRA);
Customer Population Management;
Customer data uplift
Ongoing Customer Due Diligence (OCDD) and Enhanced Customer Due Diligence (ECDD) enhancements.
We partner with stakeholders across the Business to drive execution and alignment to the Group strategy.
Your Impact & Contribution
You are empowered by the business sponsor of an initiative(s) to convey the vision and work with the team on a daily basis to achieve it. You are the voice of the customer and ensure stakeholder needs are met. Coordinate and manage the analysis required to support the Customer Program of Action Product
Owners and the interdependencies of overlaid backlog items. Your role will primarily focus on supporting the Customer PoA’s CRA initiative as the program moves towards execution. You should be prepared to support in the development of business cases, uplift of customer data, assisting in building user stores or conducting detailed analysis into issues.
Your Responsibilities
As a Business Analyst you will:
Identify relevant stakeholders, select appropriate techniques and processes to derive and manage requirements
Assess and document the current state of business functions and processes to identify and recommend improvements, including application of User and customer journeys
Lead requirements elicitation, including workshops to capture requirements. Constructively challenge stated requirements
Articulate requirements and communicate business and customer value to the project delivery / scrum team. Help establish success criteria.
Contribute to the conversion of business and customer needs into functional designs
Define problems and opportunities. Perform data analysis that can be used to support or challenge business initiatives
Support the project delivery / scrum team to break down work and translate requirements into functional specifications using appropriate method (e.g. backlog creation, user stories, as-built functional documentation etc.).
Contribute to assessment of dependencies and associated risk and compliance implications of requirements and solutions
Support business verification testing activities
Effectively communicating requirements to stakeholders, managing conflicts, issues and changes in order to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope
Your Skills & Experience
Strong stakeholder management skills and a strong customer focus
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Data analysis and problem solving skills
Facilitate change management to ensure successful implementation, including user acceptance testing (UAT), user documentation, training and support
Support in preparing high level summaries, reports, presentations packs for senior managements
Experience in continuous improvement activity
Ability to build business requirements and design and implement new processes
Ability to identify areas of opportunity in existing process analysis/design
Project delivery experience or business analyst experience is advantageous
The capacity to work in a busy, commercial, competitive environment and the ability to meet objectives and deliver exceptional customer service
Microsoft Office suite skills, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint Demonstrable knowledge and background in compliance and operational risk management
Your Qualifications
Tertiary/post graduate level education in business management, strategy and/or finance
AML/CTF & KYC expertise (2-5 years)
Your Development
If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a more senior leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key. Use the capabilities required for this role as a guide to the critical skills and behaviours you need for your next move.
If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.
We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Work in a project module with support and guidance from senior team members
Facilitate in producing reliable and accurate research for client projects and proposals

Our Macquarie Asset Management division has embarked on an ambitious roadmap for Identity and Access Management transformation and is now seeking a Business Analyst to join our Document & Identity Governance team based in Sydney. The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team performs a vital role for Macquarie Group ensuring access is provided to Macquarie systems to the right users for the right reasons at the right time.

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with diverse stakeholders representing the asset management business, technology, and operational risk. You will perform business analysis activities for the design and onboarding of asset management applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ) as well as business process mapping for business Roles, Segregation of Duties (SoD) and other IAM related activities.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

engaging business and technology subject matter experts to gather requirements and identify strategic solutions for system integration with SailPoint
mapping business processes to build out SoD and business roles where appropriate.
ensuring all requirements are completed to smoothly transition to Design and Development phases with the MAM Technology UAM team
identifying data issues and work with appropriate resources to resolve them
developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases

To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously and coordinate multiple assignments. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are expected as is the ability to engage and build relationships at all levels, particularly when under pressing and time-driven circumstances. You have a good understanding of IAM domains such as Access Management, Identity Life cycle Management, Privileged Access Management, Reporting, and analytics and have experience in SailPoint IdentityIQ, or similar Identity and Access Management tool.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, please .

Macquarie Asset Management is a large scale, global asset manager, providing clients with access to a diverse range of capabilities and products across infrastructure, real estate, natural resources, private credit, fixed income, equities, multi-asset and liquid alternatives. As at 31 March 2021, Macquarie Asset Management had $A562.2 billion of assets under management.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job Title: Senior Data & Reports Analyst (3 month contract only)
Job Description:
Senior Technical Data Analyst
Work on a transformative initiative impacting customers
Work with a talented, personable and ambitious team
Fixed Term contract (12 months)
The Know Your Customer (KYC) Stream within the Financial Crime Program is responsible for strengthening the Group’s Financial Crime Compliance capability predominantly through uplifting the Customer Risk Assessment (CRA) practices. The Stream is also delivering other 10+ other projects, themed around Customer Datasets and Due Diligence processes.
What will your impact be?
You work with core delivery and analytics team within the KYC Stream to realise the vision of CRA. You manage the analysis required and the interdependencies of overlaid backlog items. Though you report to the Executive Manager - CRA/HRC Delivery, you have exposure to a range of senior stakeholders of the Program and have an influence over a handful of related Programs in the Financial Crime and Customer Lifecycle Management space.
About your role
As a Senior Technical Data Analyst you
Analyse and/or document and/or update documentation of technical/data processes and requirements using standard data analysis methodologies and tools
Converts business needs into technical/data designs using knowledge of system capabilities, rules, and architecture
Ensure data and data analytics related technology solutions are aligned with the Groups enterprise architecture and the CRA objectives
Complete and oversee delivery of data analytics, including quality control and/or sign off
Identify data related project delivery issues and risks, assist with mitigation strategies, and escalate where necessary
Work closely with stakeholders and change management to identify impacts to business processes as a result of data model or data dependency changes
Provide support and participate in testing activities including unit testing, BA testing and system testing ensuring adequate project coverage
Undertake any other tasks assigned by your manager that you have the capability to perform safely in line with relevant internal Group policies and external regulatory requirements.
See yourself in our team? We’re interested in hearing from people who have:
Highly Desirable:

How will I help?
The Senior Business Analyst role is an integral part of the Project team. As part of the Data Platforms team, you will work in a Hybrid Agile team to assist with data gathering, analysis and technical documentation tasks.
Key responsibilities:
To elicit, analyse, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies, information and systems
Defining and driving ‘As Is’ and ‘To Be’ processes;
Defining and managing the requirements through the delivery lifecycle to meet business needs, including writing user stories and test cases
Providing and directing recommendations for process re-design and improvements and business solutions, enabling changes to processes, policy and/or information that supports Westpac to achieve targeted business outcomes and deliver business value
Documenting the developer’s logic in business terminology in the required template in order to build up a knowledge repository (wiki) for the business to use.
Managing the development of detailed Business Requirements, Business Process Specifications and/or System Functional / Non Functional Specifications that will drive the desired change to business process, system enhancement / development activities;
Supporting testing, training and implementation activities, to ensure the successful delivery of the overall business and technology solutions;
Work with stakeholders and develop and maintain collaborative working relations; eliciting and analysing business requirements and supporting the business test effort.

What’s in it for me?
 You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies.
