If you have an appreciation for Data Management and are looking to build your career in this rapidly growing specialisation, there is a unique and exciting opportunity to join the Group Data Office within Macquarie’s Financial Management Group. This role will see you working closely with stakeholders across the business to identify critical data and drive effective data management across our group.

What impact will you have?

As a Data Management Executive, you will work alongside large change initiatives, guiding the implementation of our data management steps. You will build relationships with these stakeholders, helping to increase understanding of data governance and promote accountability for its ongoing implementation.

In joining the team, you will:

support the Group Data Officer in the strategy and project planning for data management processes and policies
work with stakeholders to understand their critical data, business processes and data flows & controls
be involved in documentation and data element mapping across systems (definitions, validations, lineage, and assessment of data controls)
work to implement and embed the use of new data management tools across the business
assist with designing processes and templates to facilitate effective data management.

What skills will you use?

To be successful in the role, you will possess 2 + years’ experience working with data management principles. This experience may have been gained through building data solutions, identifying data requirements or addressing data quality issues. Other key skills include:

knowledge of data management and data governance principles
prior experience translating technical concepts into business concepts
ability to produce detailed documentation – including mapping business processes and data elements
excellent communication skills and desire to partner with business stakeholders to solve interesting problems.

This is an exciting opportunity where you will find yourself involved in diverse work, utilising your strong communication skills to work collaboratively with and build relationships across multiple business groups.

About the Financial Management Group
The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst | Manager 12 months FTC
Job Description:
Line of Service
Advisory
Industry/Sector
Not Applicable

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profit and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Consulting brings this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.
As a Data Analytics Technical Specialist in our Microsoft Team, your impact will be seen by:
Gathering business requirements from stakeholders and translating them into technical requirements
Creating and gaining approval of design documents
Managing the technical delivery using either of Agile or Waterfall methodologies in project delivery
Oversee and implement data solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform using a combination of Azure native services or Industry solutions (XaaS)
Developing and maintain data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, and analytical models needed for business, financial and operational analysis and/or reporting
Developing highly performant, secure, reliable and scalable solutions
The work you do will vary from project to project but will typically include developing data ingestion frameworks and modules, building data models, building reports, dashboards and scorecards and doing data exploration and visual analytics using Microsoft tools and technology. Please note it is not a requirement for you to be expert in all of what is listed below, we are looking for expertise in a couple of areas and a willingness to learn and keep up to date with future technology.
Must have skills:
Expertise with Data Warehousing and data modelling design techniques and principles
Expertise with Power BI development, service configuration and deployment techniques
Expertise with DAX, M Language and writing SQL based queries
Experience with compute services using tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HDInsights
Experience with database services such as Azure Synapse and /or Azure SQL
Experience with data lakes resources using Azure Blob Storage, and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
Good understanding of Azure data platform architectures and design patterns
Nice to have skills:
Experience embedding Power BI into other Microsoft 365 and Microsoft D365 environments.
Experience with Data Governance techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with Data Quality techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with real time data ingestion using Azure Event Hub, Stream Analytics
Expertise with monitoring using Azure Monitor, Log Analytics
Expertise with Azure Key Vaults for credentials management
Experience with performing data migration
Good understanding of Big Data Architectures and design patterns
Performance tuning of high-volume transactions and databases
Data science expertise
About you
You have a solid background in Microsoft Azure Data Platform and Analytics stack and can use technology to solve business problems. You have demonstrated experience in implementing enterprise grade Business Intelligence, Data and Analytics solutions using various SQL Server, Azure services and Power BI and are quick to learn new concepts. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

Job Title: Systems and Business Analyst - Governance Risk and Quality
Job Description:
Organisation/Entity: Transport For NSW
Job Category: Regulatory and compliance
Job Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU, 2020
Job Ref No: 13718
Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
Salary Range: $103965.0-$116441.0
About us

Transport for NSW (TfNSW) is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate metro, train, bus, ferry, light rail, road and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.

The Division

The Legal, Privacy and Internal Audit Branch, is within the Corporate Services division providing strategies, solutions and services that make our clients’ working lives easier and their projects more efficient and effective. Our high-performing teams work collaboratively across the organisation, partnering to provide critical advice, analysis and guidance for sensitive and complex matters.

The Opportunity

With the goal of delivering ever greater public value for the people of NSW, our branch is undergoing an organisational transformation including streamlining processes, enhancing the breadth and depth of our internal specialist skill-set and investing in our operational capabilities. With a focus on growing our Branch Operations team, we are seeking 4 x permanent Business Analysts to join our expanding team to undertake roles in process improvement/digital enablement, data analytics and human resources.

Our Business Analysts will support across our branch in process innovation, change management, resource planning and management, data analytics and business reporting. Our business analysts will undertake research and analysis on a variety of business problems and processes to assist with determining the optimal solution to meet requirements, working closely with stakeholders from across the business.

What you will be involved in

Develop process improvements to integrate new systems and processes with existing ones for continuous improvement of service delivery.
Partner with external and internal clients and stakeholders to ensure business improvements align with the long-term business strategies.
Perform regular environmental scans and research analysis and collate, analyse and provide advice for improvements that can be achieved.
Maintain knowledge of current developments in information management and champion the application of innovative techniques for storing, managing, analysing and delivering data.
Assist business as usual and project teams in problem definition, exploration of options to address these problems and propose and document potential solutions.
Manage support, maintenance, and enhancement of business processes.
Work positively as a member of a multidisciplinary team, contributing to the achievement of Branch business outcomes.

About You

You will have tertiary qualifications or demonstrated, relevant, equivalent professional experience.
You will have demonstrated experience, potentially from a consulting background – ideally in change management.
You will be detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy.
You will possess experience delivering on digital enablement, process automation and business process improvement experience and resource management.
You will possess analytical thinking and problem solving.
You will have the ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a collaborative team environment whilst maintaining a high level of work ethic.
You will also possess exceptional communication skills both written and verbal.

Key Knowledge and Experience
Extensive knowledge of business design and improvement processes.
Experience working in customer service and technology environments.

Want to know more?
Please click here to view a copy of the position description

Salary and Benefits

Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.
For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.

Interested?

Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a covering letter which identifies your preferred roles and order of preference:
process improvement/digital enablement
data analytics
or human resources

In your covering letter you will also need to answer the following two questions:
1. Describe your contribution to a change management initiative and the artefacts you prepared? (Maximum 350 words)
2. Describe a program of work or project that you had primary responsibility for delivering? (Maximum 350 words)

Apply today to register your interest!

Applications close: 11:59pm, Monday 9th August 2021.


We are the community we serve

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.

We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.

Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.

For any enquiries, please email DYANNA HERNANDEZ at DYANNA.HERNANDEZ@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.

Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us

Set up and identify systems and procedures to effectively complete a data cleanse of payroll database of approx. 4200 profilesEvaluate, maintain and ensure P&C data collection and validation is a smooth and consistent processBuild a data quality and review plan for ongoing maintenance of quality and accuracy of data for point of entry improvementReport on data errors and trends and provide recommendations to maximise data integrityDelivery of accurate data information to support integration with other HRIS applications

As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
How will I help?
As a Senior Fraud Reporting Analyst, you will sit in the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FC&FP) Team and assist with the Westpac Group’s exposure to fraud loss while maintaining a positive customer experience.
You will prepare fraud performance reports that accurately reflect the impact of fraud on the Westpac Group as well as maintain the integrity of data contained in fraud case management systems and the fraud general ledger by performing reconciliations and partnering with other fraud teams within Westpac. You will also prepare financial and statistical reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis and support the restoration of funds to customers in a timely manner.
You will understand and meet compliance/regulatory fraud reporting requirement as well as prepare and submit various reports to external bodies.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
You will have SAS coding experience paired with strong excel skills and extensive accounting knowledge. You will be proficient in analysing and interpreting and translating data and have experience in producing Management Reports. Reconciliation experience is desirable and you will preferably come from a banking background (or any other highly regulated environment).
You will have a high attention to detail paired with strong communication skills. You will be able to build strong and effective relationships and be a self leader.
What’s it like to work there?
Joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

Why Sunsuper?
Driven by a shared purpose and core values, we are one of Australia’s largest, fastest growing and most highly rated superannuation funds that exists to benefit our members. When you work for Sunsuper, every day is another opportunity to inspire and empower Australians to fulfil their retirement dreams – we think that’s pretty special.
We care deeply about our people and our teams are as diverse and unique as the members we live to inspire and empower. Our inclusive culture encourages and empowers all of us to belong, learn and connect with each other, because when you are part of the Sunsuper team, you will be valued and heard in a respectful and inclusive workplace where you can be your authentic self every day.
Flexibility is a foundation of our inclusive culture and we are committed to supporting you to make flexibility work for you, your leader and your team. At Sunsuper, we believe flexibility is for everyone, and we embrace everyone’s different personal circumstances and preferences. We support you to manage the ever-changing demands of work and personal life.
About the role
To support our success we are currently seeking a Portfolio Analyst to join the Investment Risk team in our Sydney office.
Working with members of the Investment Strategy team, other colleagues at Sunsuper and external advisors you will provide investment risk analysis and support for the development, implementation and ongoing review of Sunsuper’s investment strategy. You will also support the Investment Risk function and the Head of Portfolio Strategy with the development and management of Sunsuper’s investment risk capability within the Portfolio Strategy team.
This role is available as a permanent opportunity.
About you
To ensure success you will possess:
Tertiary qualification, preferably in finance, economics, commerce, mathematics, actuarial studies, engineering or a related discipline.
Minimum 3 years of work experience in the investment industry, and working toward post graduate qualifications.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Office applications, with relevant computer programming experience in Matlab, VBA, R, Python or related language.
Advanced analytical and numerical skills.
Our promise to you
Every moment of your journey with us matters and we are committed to providing our people with a great experience. Our Sunsuper team members enjoy an employee promise with our culture and values at its heart, with benefits including:
Rewards: 14% Superannuation, Employee Referral Program, Recognition Program
Development: Professional Development Platforms, Development Conversations, Career Development Portal
Wellbeing: Partnership with AIA Vitality, Employee Assistance Program, Financial Wellbeing Program
Benefits: Employee Discounts, Salary Packaging, Paid Parental Leave

Customer Risk Assessment (CRA);
Customer Population Management;
Customer data uplift
Ongoing Customer Due Diligence (OCDD) and Enhanced Customer Due Diligence (ECDD) enhancements.

Your Impact & Contribution
You are empowered by the business sponsor of an initiative(s) to convey the vision and work with the team on a daily basis to achieve it. You are the voice of the customer and ensure stakeholder needs are met. Coordinate and manage the analysis required to support the Customer Program of Action Product
Owners and the interdependencies of overlaid backlog items. Your role will primarily focus on supporting the Customer PoA’s CRA initiative as the program moves towards execution. Your Responsibilities

Define problems and opportunities. Perform data analysis that can be used to support or challenge business initiatives
Support the project delivery / scrum team to break down work and translate requirements into functional specifications using appropriate method (e.g. backlog creation, user stories, as-built functional documentation etc.).
Contribute to assessment of dependencies and associated risk and compliance implications of requirements and solutions
Support business verification testing activities
Effectively communicating requirements to stakeholders, managing conflicts, issues and changes in order to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope
Your Skills & Experience
Strong stakeholder management skills and a strong customer focus
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Data analysis and problem solving skills

Support in preparing high level summaries, reports, presentations packs for senior managements

Ability to build business requirements and design and implement new processes
Ability to identify areas of opportunity in existing process analysis/design

Job Description:
Our Macquarie Asset Management division has embarked on an ambitious roadmap for Identity and Access Management transformation and is now seeking a Business Analyst to join our Document & Identity Governance team based in Sydney. The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team performs a vital role for Macquarie Group ensuring access is provided to Macquarie systems to the right users for the right reasons at the right time.

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with diverse stakeholders representing the asset management business, technology, and operational risk. You will perform business analysis activities for the design and onboarding of asset management applications to our IAM governance platform (SailPoint IIQ) as well as business process mapping for business Roles, Segregation of Duties (SoD) and other IAM related activities.

Your key responsibilities in this role will be:

engaging business and technology subject matter experts to gather requirements and identify strategic solutions for system integration with SailPoint
mapping business processes to build out SoD and business roles where appropriate.
ensuring all requirements are completed to smoothly transition to Design and Development phases with the MAM Technology UAM team
identifying data issues and work with appropriate resources to resolve them
developing test plans and supporting the business through execution of user acceptance test cases

To be successful in this role you will have previous experience in a similar position and possess the ability and drive to operate autonomously and coordinate multiple assignments. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are expected as is the ability to engage and build relationships at all levels, particularly when under pressing and time-driven circumstances. You have a good understanding of IAM domains such as Access Management, Identity Life cycle Management, Privileged Access Management, Reporting, and analytics and have experience in SailPoint IdentityIQ, or similar Identity and Access Management tool.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, please .

Job Description:
Senior Technical Data Analyst
Work on a transformative initiative impacting customers
Work with a talented, personable and ambitious team
Fixed Term contract (12 months)
The Know Your Customer (KYC) Stream within the Financial Crime Program is responsible for strengthening the Group’s Financial Crime Compliance capability predominantly through uplifting the Customer Risk Assessment (CRA) practices. The Stream is also delivering other 10+ other projects, themed around Customer Datasets and Due Diligence processes.
What will your impact be?
You work with core delivery and analytics team within the KYC Stream to realise the vision of CRA. You manage the analysis required and the interdependencies of overlaid backlog items. Though you report to the Executive Manager - CRA/HRC Delivery, you have exposure to a range of senior stakeholders of the Program and have an influence over a handful of related Programs in the Financial Crime and Customer Lifecycle Management space.
About your role
As a Senior Technical Data Analyst you
Analyse and/or document and/or update documentation of technical/data processes and requirements using standard data analysis methodologies and tools
Converts business needs into technical/data designs using knowledge of system capabilities, rules, and architecture
Ensure data and data analytics related technology solutions are aligned with the Groups enterprise architecture and the CRA objectives
Complete and oversee delivery of data analytics, including quality control and/or sign off
Identify data related project delivery issues and risks, assist with mitigation strategies, and escalate where necessary
Work closely with stakeholders and change management to identify impacts to business processes as a result of data model or data dependency changes
Provide support and participate in testing activities including unit testing, BA testing and system testing ensuring adequate project coverage
Undertake any other tasks assigned by your manager that you have the capability to perform safely in line with relevant internal Group policies and external regulatory requirements.
See yourself in our team? We’re interested in hearing from people who have:

Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Senior Technical Data Analyst having worked within large project teams delivering successful business and customer outcomes
Hands on experience with Hadoop (Big Data) platform or Teradata environment
High Proficiency in querying data on Big Data platform or Data Warehouse and carrying out data analysis
Experience working with data management, analytics and data control, preferably with a focus on customer data and development of customer data controls
Knowledge and experience of AML/CTF regulation including KYC and Customer Risk Assessment
Demonstrable knowledge and background in compliance and operational risk management
Superior commercial approach and understanding of relevant risks, ability to apply these to problems to create options and justify or validate proposed solutions using Data Analysis tools
Ability to navigate, and steer a team effectively, in a complex and fast-paced environment, constantly managing and prioritising competing demands for scarce resources and balancing tangible with intangible costs and benefits
Ability to understand and develop complex concepts and communicate them effectively through oral, written and visual means
Ability to present to and interact with stakeholders at all levels, including members of Leadership Teams, and senior business and technology stakeholders in affected areas
Qualification:
Desirable:
Tertiary/post graduate level education in business management, strategy and/or finance
Deep knowledge of business analysis in an Agile environment

knowledge of data management and data governance principles

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything’ mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We’re brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.

The Role

Are you interested in using AI and data analysis to improve customer experience? Do you want wish to develop a career in Data Science with an organisation that actively supports learning? IAG might be just the place!

We’re looking for a budding Data Scientist to join our established and highly collaborative Analytics team. In this role you will work under the mentorship of one of our Senior Data Scientists to infuse AI into IAG’s business operations. You will be given the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end analytics lifecycle; from AI concept, model build and deployment of advanced analytical models in programming languages such as SQL, R & Python. If you have a curious mindset with some exposure to advanced analytical models and are eager to progress in the data science world then this will be an amazing opportunity to propel your career!

Key Responsibilities

You will prototype, update and test advanced analytical models under the direction of a data scientist and lead within your team.
You will contribute to building tools and processes supporting the activation of claims analytics within IAG.
You will work with data scientists to produce datasets for use in analysis and model training.
You will contribute to analysis seeking to understand claims processes and the impact of changes to the claims experience that IAG can make, with a view to aiding critical business decisions.
You will conduct preliminary analysis to test hypotheses and assumptions for proposed machine decisioning products and process changes and monitor the impact of changes implemented.

Skills & Experience

Degree qualification in a related field; e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or other relevant technical field.
Elementary programming and statistical modelling experience (including experience with modelling software such as R and Python).
Knowledge of analytics and data processing technologies and architectures is desirable.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences is desirable.
Problem solving skills and with a curious mindset are desirable.

Ready for anything? Let’s talk.


IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.

Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.

IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

About the opportunity

An exciting opportunity exists for a Business Analyst, ideally with Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience to join the Forensic & Analytical Science Services (FASS), Information Communications Technology Team for a period of up to 5 years.

Forensic & Analytical Science Service (FASS) specialises in providing independent and objective forensic analysis to the criminal and coronial justice systems, as well as quality scientific analysis that contributes to community health and safety. Our services include illicit drug analysis, forensic and drug toxicology, chemical criminalistics, forensic biology and DNA, forensic medicine, environmental toxicology, and environmental microbiology.

Being part of NSW Health Pathology means you’re helping create better health and justice systems every day.
We operate more than 60 laboratories and around 200 collection centres across NSW and conduct over 60 million tests per annum. Our network of pathologists are supported by scientists, technicians and support staff who quickly and accurately assess samples so clinical teams can make the best possible treatment decisions for patients. We encourage our staff to be involved in research and innovation opportunities to help create safer, healthier communities.

Overview
The Review Delivery Team has responsibility for the data management, production and distribution of over 20 million communication and correspondence items annually.
This is a key role within the Review Delivery Team, and is responsible for annual and interim Fund review processing and member statement production.
The purpose of the role is to test and run annual and interim system reviews, maintain data mapping and business rules based on Fund statement requirements, and test that the statement output accurately meets requirements and is delivered on schedule.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Ensure that allocated review tasks are completed in line with the agreed review timetable.
Prepare and execute data test scripts and manage the resolution of items through relevant stakeholders.
Conduct scheduled system testing prior to review date to ensure processes run correctly and timely.
Run system review processes in production and provide relevant data files to the Mail House.
Manage the resolution of any issues in test or production system review processing.
Liaise with the Mail House to resolve any queries regarding data and/or files.
Record and reconcile output based on system review records, data files, Mail House lodgements, etc.
Support the identification of changes in Fund statement data and conditional requirements.
Review statement requirements and ascertain if changes are required to mapping/business rules.
Document and maintain the statement data mapping and business rules in line with Fund requirements.
Manage the versioning and provision to the Mail House of the data mapping and business rules.
Resolve any queries from the data Validation Reports and ensure that reports are error free.
Coordinate with the Mail House the transfer of PDF files and raise requests to upload files to TRIM.
Communicate status and participate in stakeholder meetings as required
Facilitate raising/resolving Work Requests for statement production and review processing as required.

Strong organisational management and multi-tasking skills
Ability to priorities, organize and forward plan to meet at times very stringent deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy
Work collaboratively and proactively with Service Delivery Manger, internal work groups and third parties.
Positively contribute to improving the way we operate with innovation and the use of best practice processes
Sound communication and problem management skills
Good knowledge of superannuation and pension business desirable
Proven experience or aptitude in translating needs into requirements documentation
Working knowledge of Link systems and business processes desirable
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, V & H lookups, and formula utilization) Word and Outlook
Ability to write/tune SQL for data analysis and validation
Shares expertise and learning across the team and encourages others to do so. Consistently seeks feedback on own performance.

As part of the Behavioural Risk division of Macquarie’s Risk Management Group (RMG), the Risk Culture team assist Macquarie businesses to determine the soundness, and enable the alignment, of culture to drive good risk outcomes throughout Macquarie Group Limited. A sound risk culture has been integral to Macquarie’s risk management framework since inception and continues to be of high importance to the Group.

The primary function of our team is to apply our well-developed assessment process and undertake independent risk culture reviews across the operating and central service groups to identify the relative strengths and areas for development within a business or function. These findings and accompanying actionable recommendations are shared with senior management to effect positive change.

Risk culture is an exciting area to work in, with growing global recognition that risk cultures are fundamental to their long-term success. In addition to on-the-job learning and working alongside a team of experienced subject matter experts, you will also benefit from a supportive team environment which values diversity and inclusion, workplace flexibility and continued learning opportunities.

To drive a strong risk culture, you will have opportunities to enhance the risk culture assessment methodology and act in an advisory capacity to Macquarie businesses where the team’s expertise will lead to better risk outcomes. You will also be expected to support continuous improvement initiatives to drive greater efficiency and effectiveness across the team and the wider Risk Management Group division.

The team consists of members with varied backgrounds and welcomes diverse perspectives. As such, we value hearing how you could apply your previous work experience to further enhance how our team operates. While the role is Sydney-based, the role will at times require overseas travel (in line with governments’ health guidance) due to Macquarie global business operations.

As a Risk Culture Senior Analyst you will be pivotal in supporting risk culture reviews applying professional judgement and relevant experience to our review process. You will develop surveys, including customised questions, that will effectively assess risk culture, manage the online survey process (through Qualtrics) with a focus on end-user experience and critically analyse survey output (quantitative and qualitative) and presenting findings in an insightful way using a range of software (e.g. PowerBI and Excel).

Other Responsibilities include:

Transcribing behavioural interviews to a high standard, and depending on your level of experience, being the lead or secondary interviewer.
Triangulating survey, interview, and organisational data to assist in developing risk culture insights and recommendations
Supporting and facilitating the presentation and reporting of key findings to senior management.

To be success in this role you will have relevant education and experience at least two years post-graduate in human behaviour (e.g. psychology, behavioural science) and/or business and finance (e.g. economics, human resources, consulting). You will bring strong attention to detail and data literacy skills, working with both quantitative and qualitative data and strong verbal and written communication skills to assist in delivering risk culture insights and working within a collaborative team environment.

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything’ mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We’re brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.

The Role

Are you interested in using AI and data analysis to improve customer experience? Do you want wish to develop a career in Data Science with an organisation that actively supports learning? IAG might be just the place!

We’re looking for a budding Data Scientist to join our established and highly collaborative Analytics team. In this role you will work under the mentorship of one of our Senior Data Scientists to infuse AI into IAG’s business operations. You will be given the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end analytics lifecycle; from AI concept, model build and deployment of advanced analytical models in programming languages such as SQL, R & Python. If you have a curious mindset with some exposure to advanced analytical models and are eager to progress in the data science world then this will be an amazing opportunity to propel your career!

Key Responsibilities

You will prototype, update and test advanced analytical models under the direction of a data scientist and lead within your team.
You will contribute to building tools and processes supporting the activation of claims analytics within IAG.
You will work with data scientists to produce datasets for use in analysis and model training.
You will contribute to analysis seeking to understand claims processes and the impact of changes to the claims experience that IAG can make, with a view to aiding critical business decisions.
You will conduct preliminary analysis to test hypotheses and assumptions for proposed machine decisioning products and process changes and monitor the impact of changes implemented.

Skills & Experience

Degree qualification in a related field; e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or other relevant technical field.
Elementary programming and statistical modelling experience (including experience with modelling software such as R and Python).
Knowledge of analytics and data processing technologies and architectures is desirable.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences is desirable.
Problem solving skills and with a curious mindset are desirable.

An exciting opportunity exists for a Business Analyst, ideally with Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience to join the Forensic & Analytical Science Services (FASS), Information Communications Technology Team for a period of up to 5 years.

Forensic & Analytical Science Service (FASS) specialises in providing independent and objective forensic analysis to the criminal and coronial justice systems, as well as quality scientific analysis that contributes to community health and safety. Our services include illicit drug analysis, forensic and drug toxicology, chemical criminalistics, forensic biology and DNA, forensic medicine, environmental toxicology, and environmental microbiology.

Being part of NSW Health Pathology means you’re helping create better health and justice systems every day.

Our network of pathologists are supported by scientists, technicians and support staff who quickly and accurately assess samples so clinical teams can make the best possible treatment decisions for patients. We encourage our staff to be involved in research and innovation opportunities to help create safer, healthier communities.

Performs root cause analysis including problem definition, investigation and developing correction and prevention processes.

Supports projects to analyse, cleanse, enrich and monitor master data elements

Participate in the implementation of master data governance processes.

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Degree qualified in IT, Computer Systems, software or computer engineering fields or equivalent.

Proven working experience as an MDM analyst or MDM specialist

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

Master Data Management (Preferably Informatica)

Informatica data profiling, SQL profiling etc.

Informatica ETL or equivalent

Metadata Management using Informatica Metadata Manager or equivalent

Netezza / Teradata / Oracle Exadata Data warehouse platforms or equivalent.

SQL

Relational Database Management System (RDBMS)

Hadoop / Big Data knowledge and experience

Data Modeling using tools like ERWin

Java

Cognos BI or equivalent Analytics/Reporting tools.

Pro-active, self-motivated, organised, with an ability to plan.

Ability to explain technical information in business terms.

Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing.

Strong in User Requirements Gathering, Maintenance and Support.

Familiar with Business Intelligence (BI) applications.

We're ideally seeking candidates who are available immediately or soon to be finishing other projects/contracts. This is a full-time role which will require you to work onsite at least 3 days per week when safe to do so. For more information email Lee Shorter - lshorter@aquent.com

Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profit and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Consulting brings this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.
As a Data Analytics Technical Specialist in our Microsoft Team, your impact will be seen by:
Gathering business requirements from stakeholders and translating them into technical requirements
Creating and gaining approval of design documents
Managing the technical delivery using either of Agile or Waterfall methodologies in project delivery
Oversee and implement data solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform using a combination of Azure native services or Industry solutions (XaaS)
Developing and maintain data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, and analytical models needed for business, financial and operational analysis and/or reporting
Developing highly performant, secure, reliable and scalable solutions
The work you do will vary from project to project but will typically include developing data ingestion frameworks and modules, building data models, building reports, dashboards and scorecards and doing data exploration and visual analytics using Microsoft tools and technology. Please note it is not a requirement for you to be expert in all of what is listed below, we are looking for expertise in a couple of areas and a willingness to learn and keep up to date with future technology.
Must have skills:
Expertise with Data Warehousing and data modelling design techniques and principles
Expertise with Power BI development, service configuration and deployment techniques
Expertise with DAX, M Language and writing SQL based queries
Experience with compute services using tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HDInsights
Experience with database services such as Azure Synapse and /or Azure SQL
Experience with data lakes resources using Azure Blob Storage, and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
Good understanding of Azure data platform architectures and design patterns
Nice to have skills:
Experience embedding Power BI into other Microsoft 365 and Microsoft D365 environments.
Experience with Data Governance techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with Data Quality techniques within the Microsoft Landscape
Experience with real time data ingestion using Azure Event Hub, Stream Analytics
Expertise with monitoring using Azure Monitor, Log Analytics
Expertise with Azure Key Vaults for credentials management
Experience with performing data migration
Good understanding of Big Data Architectures and design patterns
Performance tuning of high-volume transactions and databases
Data science expertise
About you
You have a solid background in Microsoft Azure Data Platform and Analytics stack and can use technology to solve business problems. You have demonstrated experience in implementing enterprise grade Business Intelligence, Data and Analytics solutions using various SQL Server, Azure services and Power BI and are quick to learn new concepts. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

Job Title: Systems and Business Analyst - Governance Risk and Quality
Job Description:
Who we are and what we do
While you may not have heard of Audinate, our products might be more familiar to you than you realise. Used by leading pro audio brands globally, our digital audio networking products and technologies are found in thousands of products, from microphone systems in stadiums to AV connectivity solutions in commercial buildings.
In the entertainment industry alone, our impact has been far reaching. From playing a small part in performances by the likes of Paul McCartney, Bruce Springsteen, Elton John, Bob Dylan and more, to receiving an Emmy Award in recognition of our contribution to AV connectivity, we continue to push boundaries into the future.
What you’ll be working on
As a result of ongoing growth, we are now recruiting an experienced Business Systems Analyst to assist with the strategic and tactical development of business software and systems. This will involve working cross-functionally to help define initiatives and strategies, analyse requirements, document designs, and deliver application and system solutions.

You will collaborate with product managers, software architects, Dev Ops & business system owners as well as working with internal customers such as finance, sales, product delivery and the executive leadership team, you will determine customer requirements, set priorities, determine product featuring, examine and document process work flows, etc. to align internal systems with external products and services

This is a role that will include interaction with global teams and requires a strong ability to communicate effectively with various business and technical teams. The right candidate is someone who loves solving complex problems and has a proven track record of being able to successfully identify a solution, prepare a plan, and execute it with strong results.

This is a full-time position located at our office in Sydney, NSW Australia.

Responsibilities: Using Agile methods, work cross-functionally with various stakeholders, and both in-house and remote offshore teams to determine needs and requirements Working with product managers, software architects, devops and business systems owners, lead the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative projects combining data, design sense, and empathy towards Audinate’s internal & external customers Build and maintain a transformational roadmap and ensure development connects to user needs and business goals Document, analyse and evaluate a range of data, systems and business processes and make recommendations to improve efficiency Work closely with the business to document and understand existing ICT system functionalities and where improvements need to be made optimise system functionalities Participate in the product development process as the voice of internal systems and drive development of tools; integrations and process supporting business outcomes Build use cases and user stories and communicate them effectively Assess and mitigate risks, resolve bottlenecks, serve as an escalation point of contact, anticipate and access trade-offs and balance business needs with technical constraints Obtain and integrate user feedback into product requirements to ensure products satisfy user needs as well as wants Make informed product decisions leveraging quantitative and qualitative data
What we’re looking for
 B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent related experience 5+ years of experience in business analysis in IT or software products. Experience with the integration and process work flow mapping of Salesforce, NetSuite, or other related CRM, Accounting, and ERP systems preferred. Experience mapping business process workflows in a platform as a service environment preferred. Experience in Agile product development methods as a product manager or product owner preferred. Experience in using tools such as Jira, Confluence, as well as Microsoft Office suite of products preferred. Experience writing detailed requirements, prioritizing work, dealing with ambiguity of requirements, and driving through MVP implementations. Outstanding commitment to service and quality Independent, proactive and self-driven Strong user experience sensibilities and appreciation for robust interface design
What you’ll experience with us
When you join us in our brand-new office in Surry Hills (that’s right, brand new in August 2019) you’ll be joining a global team of talented and passionate people who work hard together and enjoy it!
In addition to a competitive salary, annual bonus and equity incentive plan, you’ll have the opportunity to truly make a difference in our growing organization. You’ll also experience our diverse, values-based culture and a range of benefits such as flexible working hours through to volunteering leave and social activities.

Overview
The Review Delivery Team has responsibility for the data management, production and distribution of over 20 million communication and correspondence items annually.
This is a key role within the Review Delivery Team, and is responsible for annual and interim Fund review processing and member statement production.
The purpose of the role is to test and run annual and interim system reviews, maintain data mapping and business rules based on Fund statement requirements, and test that the statement output accurately meets requirements and is delivered on schedule.

Key Accountabilities and Main Responsibilities
Ensure that allocated review tasks are completed in line with the agreed review timetable.
Prepare and execute data test scripts and manage the resolution of items through relevant stakeholders.
Conduct scheduled system testing prior to review date to ensure processes run correctly and timely.
Run system review processes in production and provide relevant data files to the Mail House.
Manage the resolution of any issues in test or production system review processing.
Liaise with the Mail House to resolve any queries regarding data and/or files.
Record and reconcile output based on system review records, data files, Mail House lodgements, etc.
Support the identification of changes in Fund statement data and conditional requirements.
Review statement requirements and ascertain if changes are required to mapping/business rules.
Document and maintain the statement data mapping and business rules in line with Fund requirements.
Manage the versioning and provision to the Mail House of the data mapping and business rules.
Resolve any queries from the data Validation Reports and ensure that reports are error free.
Coordinate with the Mail House the transfer of PDF files and raise requests to upload files to TRIM.
Communicate status and participate in stakeholder meetings as required
Facilitate raising/resolving Work Requests for statement production and review processing as required.
Experience & Personal Attributes
Strong organisational management and multi-tasking skills
Ability to priorities, organize and forward plan to meet at times very stringent deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy
Work collaboratively and proactively with Service Delivery Manger, internal work groups and third parties.
Positively contribute to improving the way we operate with innovation and the use of best practice processes
Sound communication and problem management skills
Good knowledge of superannuation and pension business desirable
Proven experience or aptitude in translating needs into requirements documentation
Working knowledge of Link systems and business processes desirable
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, V & H lookups, and formula utilization) Word and Outlook
Ability to write/tune SQL for data analysis and validation
Shares expertise and learning across the team and encourages others to do so. Consistently seeks feedback on own performance.
Thinks and acts strategically in relation to problem solving and cost savings

As part of the Behavioural Risk division of Macquarie’s Risk Management Group (RMG), the Risk Culture team assist Macquarie businesses to determine the soundness, and enable the alignment, of culture to drive good risk outcomes throughout Macquarie Group Limited. A sound risk culture has been integral to Macquarie’s risk management framework since inception and continues to be of high importance to the Group.

The primary function of our team is to apply our well-developed assessment process and undertake independent risk culture reviews across the operating and central service groups to identify the relative strengths and areas for development within a business or function. These findings and accompanying actionable recommendations are shared with senior management to effect positive change.

Risk culture is an exciting area to work in, with growing global recognition that risk cultures are fundamental to their long-term success. In addition to on-the-job learning and working alongside a team of experienced subject matter experts, you will also benefit from a supportive team environment which values diversity and inclusion, workplace flexibility and continued learning opportunities.

To drive a strong risk culture, you will have opportunities to enhance the risk culture assessment methodology and act in an advisory capacity to Macquarie businesses where the team’s expertise will lead to better risk outcomes. You will also be expected to support continuous improvement initiatives to drive greater efficiency and effectiveness across the team and the wider Risk Management Group division.

The team consists of members with varied backgrounds and welcomes diverse perspectives. As such, we value hearing how you could apply your previous work experience to further enhance how our team operates. While the role is Sydney-based, the role will at times require overseas travel (in line with governments’ health guidance) due to Macquarie global business operations.

As a Risk Culture Senior Analyst you will be pivotal in supporting risk culture reviews applying professional judgement and relevant experience to our review process. You will develop surveys, including customised questions, that will effectively assess risk culture, manage the online survey process (through Qualtrics) with a focus on end-user experience and critically analyse survey output (quantitative and qualitative) and presenting findings in an insightful way using a range of software (e.g. PowerBI and Excel).

Other Responsibilities include:

Transcribing behavioural interviews to a high standard, and depending on your level of experience, being the lead or secondary interviewer.
Triangulating survey, interview, and organisational data to assist in developing risk culture insights and recommendations
Supporting and facilitating the presentation and reporting of key findings to senior management.

To be success in this role you will have relevant education and experience at least two years post-graduate in human behaviour (e.g. psychology, behavioural science) and/or business and finance (e.g. economics, human resources, consulting). You will bring strong attention to detail and data literacy skills, working with both quantitative and qualitative data and strong verbal and written communication skills to assist in delivering risk culture insights and working within a collaborative team environment.

You will also bring sound Excel and PowerPoint skills to analyse and present findings in informative ways and a desire to continually learn and develop your skillset across a broad range of subject matters. Your sound time management skills and experience with a range of other visualisation and statistical software (e.g. PowerBI and SPSS) will set you up for success in this role.

If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity, apply today via the links provided.

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent and centralised function responsible for objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. RMG designs and oversees the implementation of the risk management framework. Its divisions include Credit, Market Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, Financial Crime Risk, Compliance, Operational Risk & Governance, Behavioural Risk, Enterprise Support and Internal Audit.

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Macquarie is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Two of Australia’s leading telecommunication companies, Vodafone Hutchison Australia and TPG, have come together to form TPG Telecom Limited. TPG Telecom has a powerhouse of brands which include Vodafone, TPG, iiNet, Internode, Lebara, AAPT and felix. As the second largest telecommunications company listed on the ASX, TPG Telecom has a strong challenger spirit and a commitment to delivering the best services and products to our customers. We are driving competition and choice for businesses and consumers across Australia.
The opportunity
As Agile Business Analyst, you will be part of a growing Customer Experience Tribe. Joining a group of customer obsessed, commercially minded team players who love to use data to identify opportunities to solve customer problems and drive incremental value. With a deep understanding of customer needs, commercial acumen and delivery best practices, you will deliver game-changing customer experiences as a market differentiator.
Responsibilities
Create and/or document the Opportunity Canvas, Program Epics, User stories that provide sufficient detail in preparation for the regular backlog grooming sessions.
Work with the Principal Product Owner and internal stakeholders to understand business needs, identify product value, document and prioritise requirements.
Own and manage the feature-level Squad Backlog and provide the delivery squad with clarity and guidance on prioritisation at card level. This includes working with a multi-disciplinary team including a mix of on/offshore and vendor partners.
Document clear functional and non-functional requirements and processes including but not limited to business, performance, operational, system, reporting, security, scalability and / or usability requirements.
Participate in agile ceremonies i.e. estimation sessions, planning meetings, daily stand ups, showcases, and team retrospectives.
Review the functional specifications/design documentation for the Sprints and/or overall Project/Program.
Knowledge and experience
3+ years experience in a fast-paced service industry or organisation that is highly complex with rapid change.
Strong communication and proven facilitation skills across large cross-functional teams.
Critical thinking and attention to detail to write user stories, and experience working within a multi-disciplinary delivery squad (engineers, UX, quality assurance, architects etc) to align and deliver on detailed requirements.
Proven experience of data driven decision making to achieve targets and KPIs
Creative problem solving with consideration across customer, people, process and system.
Customer-centric mindset, preferably with proven examples of human-centered thinking in practice.
Benefits and perks
Flexible hybrid way of working (from home and office)
‘Stay Connected Mobile’ – Access to a free mobile plan
‘Stay Connected NBN’ – Access to a free NBN 100 plan
‘Your Leave’ - an additional 4 days of leave to be used whenever you like - every year
Access to LinkedIn Learning and Vodafone Learning platforms
Access to Corporate Partner Discounts
We are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. You will have access to fantastic benefits, including generous leave policies, leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. You’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative workspace that helps drive innovation.
Interested? We are excited to hear from you!

About this role

About us

Freedom is one of the nation's leading lifestyle retailers; we don't just sell furniture, we sell the dream! With almost 40 years in the furniture and homewares industry, we have established ourselves as a market leader, and are known for our great designs, as well as a customer experience that you will be proud to be part of.

About the role

We are now on the lookout for a Business Intelligence & Data Lead to join our team. Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, you will be instrumental in delivering our technology roadmap across BI, data and reporting, whilst managing the day-to-day tactical operations of your team.

As a core member of our IT leadership team, your key areas of focus will be:

Leadership

Providing subject matter expertise and thought leadership across BI, analytics & data management.

Maximising the capability of your team through collaborative and proactive leadership.

Operations

rd

party relationships to complement and elevate service delivery to the business.

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything’ mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We’re brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.

The Role

Are you interested in using AI and data analysis to improve customer experience? Do you want wish to develop a career in Data Science with an organisation that actively supports learning? IAG might be just the place!

We’re looking for a budding Data Scientist to join our established and highly collaborative Analytics team. In this role you will work under the mentorship of one of our Senior Data Scientists to infuse AI into IAG’s business operations. You will be given the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end analytics lifecycle; from AI concept, model build and deployment of advanced analytical models in programming languages such as SQL, R & Python. If you have a curious mindset with some exposure to advanced analytical models and are eager to progress in the data science world then this will be an amazing opportunity to propel your career!

Key Responsibilities

You will prototype, update and test advanced analytical models under the direction of a data scientist and lead within your team.
You will contribute to building tools and processes supporting the activation of claims analytics within IAG.
You will work with data scientists to produce datasets for use in analysis and model training.
You will contribute to analysis seeking to understand claims processes and the impact of changes to the claims experience that IAG can make, with a view to aiding critical business decisions.
You will conduct preliminary analysis to test hypotheses and assumptions for proposed machine decisioning products and process changes and monitor the impact of changes implemented.

Skills & Experience

Degree qualification in a related field; e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or other relevant technical field.
Elementary programming and statistical modelling experience (including experience with modelling software such as R and Python).
Knowledge of analytics and data processing technologies and architectures is desirable.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences is desirable.
Problem solving skills and with a curious mindset are desirable.

Ready for anything? Let’s talk.


IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.

Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.

IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.
