We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst – Customer Intelligence to join the team on a permanent full-time contract.
As the Analyst, you will contribute to a high-performance team by performing analysis, providing data insights, solving problems, and building solutions for Stockland through customer data and research.
Key Responsibilities:
Proactively support and collaborate with the analysts and data scientists to provide the marketing team with timely and accurate insights to support decision making.
Support and lead initiatives to improve customer centricity in Stockland with other members of the analytics team and the Marketing Leadership Team.
Develop dashboards and embed advanced analytics solutions built by the analytics team to extract value from the insights by applying them to customer-related processes marketing decision making.
Manage quantitative and qualitative data collection and data quality improvement initiatives, including ongoing surveys, that enable a deeper understanding and the potential for targeting improvements. Manage includes, but is not limited to, project scoping, survey design, working with stakeholders, suppliers & agencies and delivering recommendations.
Manage the growth and development of the Stockland research community, as well as utilizing it for research purposes.
Assist with the integration of new data, research tools, digital marketing tools or platforms into the marketing tech stack.
Proactively manage risk for Data Privacy regulations, working with the broader marketing team to drive best practice for the proper collection, storage and use of Customer Data.
Participate in the set-up of objectives and metrics for the measurement and optimization of campaigns, customer conversion initiatives, or referral initiatives.
Work with internal business stakeholders to identify research needs and design, execute and communicate appropriate research solution to give the business guidance/recommendation etc. based on customer insights.
Maintain strong working relationships with external suppliers and internal stakeholders to deliver data and research projects to a high standard, on time and on budget.
What are we looking for?
At least two years’ experience in a marketing, data analysis or research related role.
Experience with SQL is highly sought after. Basic experience with programming languages like Python or R is non-essential but desired.
Experience with designing and scripting surveys, as well as analyzing results from qualitative research
Demonstrated skills in communicating insights and recommendations.
Appropriate tertiary qualification (e.g., marketing, commerce)
The Stockland Proposition
At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.
We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds, and we want our teams to reflect this.
We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidized lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.

Apply today – Stockland – it's your place.

Do work that makes a difference
We currently have an exciting opportunity to join the Enterprise Data Office team. A key focus of the role will be to guide, support and work with the central Data and Analytics team to simplify, standardise and automate key data processes. Provide data management service and solutions to support analysis and research relevant to the Bank's core functions. Support the Enterprise Data Office to embed and improve data management best practices in the RBA. This is a 10-Month Fixed-Term Contract.

Responsibilities will include:

Work with business subject matter experts to understand and document existing data management processes and practices and to identify opportunities for improvement
Provide process management subject-matter guidance to re-design, simplify and standardise data management and analytics processes, and automate using modern data tools
Promote the adoption of modern data management and analytics tools and practices throughout the organisation
Contribute to the improvement of policies, systems and processes, ensuring the integrity, accessibility and suitability of information, as well as solutions resilient to changes in technology and operating environments
Engage and educate stakeholders about the value of data management and data technologies


Your team

This role is part of the Corporate Services Group. The Corporate Services Group is responsible for the effective provision of information technology, workplace (asset management, facilities management, building security, and procurement) and data management services to support the delivery of the Bank’s policy, operational and corporate objectives.


Your background

To be successful in this critical role you will possess:

5+ years experience as a business analyst in large data related projects, ideally in the financial services industry
Experience in process reengineering and documentation
Understanding of programming language concepts such as R or Python, understanding of ETL, database concepts and SQL
Understanding of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts and architectures with experience of software development lifecycle in this context
Prior exposure to data management frameworks such as DAMA DMBOK or equivalent
Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Strong stakeholder management experience


Your development & career

Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.

Why RBA?

The RBA pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.

Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts.

The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.


Advertised29 Jul 2021

You are passionate about all things data related with a positive attitude
We are a values-driven high performing team within the Advice and Insurance space
Together we can deliver an exemplary experience for our stakeholders and the Group

Do work that matters

As a Data Assets Analyst, you will join the Data and Decisioning Science team, more specifically within the Advice and Insurance Data and Analytics space.

Given the recent sale of CBA General Insurance Business to Hollard Insurance, this role will remain employed on a CBA contract until completion of the sale (9-12 months) and will be transitioned over to Hollard Insurance contract after the sales is finalized.


See yourself in our team

This business facing team within DDS (Data and Decisioning Science) are responsible for supporting and advising the Advice and insurance business with their data, reporting, Insights and Analytics requirements.

As a Data Assets Analyst, you will be responsible for development of reporting platform and build robust processes to provision information to support the required monitoring and reporting needs across the General Insurance Business.


Key responsibilities

Exploration and interrogation of new sources of data that add value to the outcomes of the team
Designing and development of reporting for the business, including insights to assist in decision making
Participate in all phases of the development cycle – requirements gathering and analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance of Data Assets
Identify impacts to Data Assets as a result of system or application or business process changes
Identify data quality issues and work within Data Governance framework to design and monitor their resolution and remediation
Provide support and participate in testing activities including unit testing, business verification testing and system testing
We’re interested in hearing from people who have

Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritise and execute multiple concurrent activities and priorities.
Relevant experience in data analysis, analytics and/or business intelligence
Experience in SAS, Teradata/SQL Server, and Excel or equivalent statistical tools
Experience in using visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau) would be highly regarded.
Ability to relate business problems to the underlying data and using the technology to solve the challenges and analyses, solve and transform mapping of measures from disparate source systems
Good experience working in a financial services environment or a similar multifaceted organisation- familiarity with CBA’s data eco system and group data policy would be highly regarded
If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Our Federal Government client is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team.

About the team

The Data, Research and Publications branch provides key support services to the Official Secretary to achieve priorities for this Royal Commission.

Skills & Experience
The successful candidate will be an analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to multi-task in a high volume, fast paced environment.

In this role, reporting to the Assistant Director, Data and Analytics your duties will include:

Provide timely, rigorous and accurate analysis of data, including large unit record datasets, in a form that is easily and quickly understood by its target audience
Work closely with the legal team to develop data materials to support public hearings
Work closely with the policy and legal teams to develop data related content

Proven experience working with data / statistical software such as SAS and MS Excel to analyse large administrative and survey datasets.

Job Title: Global Investment Research, Equity Research, Industrials, An...
Job Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

YOUR IMPACT
 Are you passionate about research and generating investment ideas? We’re looking for a professional to join our Industrials sector team in Sydney/ Melbourne to develop valuable insights and investment ideas for our clients.
OUR IMPACT
From macroeconomic forecasts to individual stock analysis, our team develops tools and insights to help shape investment strategies for clients and the firm. Our analysts work on client-focused research in the equity, fixed-income, currency, and commodities markets, mining big data that enters markets around the world each day to identify game-changing insights. You’ll be part of a team that is intellectually curious, creative, analytical, and passionate about performing market research.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
Working closely with the Senior Analyst and members of the A/NZ Industrials team, the role of the Business Analyst is to:
Building strong industry knowledge across multiple industries
Building, maintaining and updating company and industry models
Interpreting industry data and conduct cross company and sub sector data analysis
Providing support to single stock research analysts
Communicate with the equities sales force and traders, clients and company managements
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR
1-3 years relevant work experience in investment research, comparable business/financial/consulting experience preferred
Natural curiosity, critical thinking, logical thinking
Strong financial modeling and analysis experience
Working knowledge of accounting, finance, and valuation
Meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical and organizational skills
Demonstrated ability to think laterally and exercise good judgment
Ability to multi-task, to work independently and across numerous teams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor’s degree required, preference for commerce/engineering/science
Exposure to Transport and/or Infrastructure sectors an advantage, but not essential
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.


We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.


We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

Join an Insurance leader that is driven by data
Work with in-demand tools and technologies - Google Analytics, PowerBI & more
Monitor and analyse our SEM, an area with our richest data sets
The Opportunity
At Greenstone, we are truly analytics driven business, with analytics driving and informing decisions across all aspects of the business. In this role you will be responsible for monitoring and analysing our Search Engine Marketing, an area that has some of the richest datasets for analysis. What someone has searched for, where they are located, what time of day it is, are they searching from a mobile or computer - these are all import factors that can be used to predict how likely someone is to purchase a product from us, and thus how much we should spend on advertising to them.

Greenstone is a large business with multiple brands, but we don't silo our marketing activities. You will need to determine if and how ads from our own competing brands should be shown to potential customers. You will also work with our existing machine learning models and provide input on the development of new ML models. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with some of the most sophisticated data-driven marketing in Australia, you won't simply report on the performance of our search marketing, but rather be a key player and defining that performance.

What are we looking for?
Tertiary qualification in a relevant Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Science, Engineering or Statistics discipline
Experience (typically 4-6 years) in a similar insight driven data analytics area
Strong experience in SQL and either Python / R / SAS
Strong experience in visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Comprehensive understanding of MS Excel and other applications within the MS Office suit
Strong conceptual, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of Digital Channels (SEM, SEO, FB, EDM)
Knowledge of Web Analytics Tool (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)


Desirable
Exposure to digital marketing campaigns and profitability

Our Promise to Our People

We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That's why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:

Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more
Hybrid Office and Work From Home model
Company funded paid parental leave benefit (18 weeks!)
State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company cafe (weekly free lunch) & on-site gym
Health & well-being initiatives and programs
Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops
Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people
Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, Taronga Zoo entry, live shows + more
Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks)

Who is Greenstone?
Greenstone distributes insurance products under trusted brands such as Real Insurance, RSPCA Pet Insurance, Guardian, Medibank, Woolworths, Guide Dogs Pet Insurance, Kogan Life Insurance, Australian Seniors Insurance Agency and Choosi.

We are the leading distributor of direct Insurance products in the Australian insurance market. Since launching into the Financial Services sector in 2007, Greenstone has experienced a commanding volume of growth being recognised for our credible brands, customer focused values and people-driven work culture.

We are passionate about our core values, which contribute towards the positive culture that supports our employees, our customers and our community.

Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Bella Vista - only a short walk from Norwest Metro station (also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown).

With the exceptional circumstances being experienced globally due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), Greenstone is working hard to support all our candidates and new starters during these critical times. Please be aware that our entire recruitment processes will be conducted virtually. We are also accredited as a Covid-safe workplace by NSW Government.

Apply Now
If this role interests you, we would love to hear from you! Please apply now or email recruitment@greenstone.com.au

www.greenstone.com.au

We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.
This is the place where you’ll be hands on. Where new ideas are welcomed and expected.
At every level – and in every role – we’re doers and builders. Not Managers and minders.
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
What's so exciting about this role?
Be part of a forward thinking team who are responsible for protecting hummgroup and its customers from fraud by data analytics, optimising fraud systems and providing insights through timely reporting. This is an end to end, hands on role, working across all our products.
What does an average day look like?
No day is average at hummgroup, but here’s an idea of what you can expect to do in this role and what you will be responsible for:
Analyse fraud trends and implement detection strategies balancing fraud risk and customer friction
Optimise existing detection strategies to ensure effectiveness and efficiency is maintained within expectations
Engage in projects to assist with testing and change management activities
Complete data analysis to assist in business decisions
Develop accurate and clear reporting that supports effective oversight of fraud performance
Work unsupervised and under challenging deadlines
Prioritise workload and proactively call out delays
Who will thrive in this role?
You are analytical and curious, and put that to use by driving great customer experiences and profitable growth for humm. You can manage a busy workload of top priorities and can be relied on to deliver end-to-end. You are someone who believes in the strength of good relationships. You are flexible, driven and passionate about customers; you can operate in and contribute to a fast paced and dynamic environment.
We’re also looking for someone who brings:
1+ years' experience using data analytics tools such as SQL, SAS or R
1+ years' experience developing application and transactional fraud rules (Digital and card channels preferred)
Advanced verbal, written and numeracy skills
A demonstrated ability to work with business stakeholders to resolve issues
Data analysis and data insights
Data visualisation skills (Power BI preferable)
Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistics, computing, science, engineering or actuarial studies (highly desirable).
And did we mention that we are working in a super-fast-paced environment where change is the only constant? We really mean it so experience working at pace is essential. If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you!

Job Title: Business Analyst for Non Financial Risk Data
Job Description:
This is an exciting new opportunity to assist in defining the future of Data and Business Architecture/Solutions in our Risk Management Group Data team.

In this permanent role you will work with stakeholders across the business and technology to develop a deep understanding of the growing data, analytics and automation needs of different risk functions as well as support the design and build of business solutions to cater to the requirements of each risk function. You will be assisting in managing projects as well as documenting business and functional requirements for risk’s data use cases and work with the tech architecture to develop technical solutions.

You will also be responsible for:

Working on solutions for strategic remediation of Data Quality issues across the broad Risk Management Group
Working on producing data model designs to ensure higher collaboration and efficiency in data usage across the Group’s functions
Being the representative for the Risk Management Group representing all Risk functions in enterprise programs and to ensure that RMG requirements are catered to
Assisting in ensuring all the data relevant to our risk function is brought under governance
Translating business solutions to tech solutions and work with tech delivery teams to deliver the required outcomes for our Risk Functions.

To be successful in this role you will possess vast experience in working with data and solutions in an Investment Bank, ideally as a business/technical analyst or a business solutions architect. Exposure to Risk Management will be highly advantageous.

CFA (any level) or FRM certification is desired but not mandatory.

Possessing a computer science or finance related degree is advantageous. You will be passionate about the potential application of cloud based big data technologies and hold an inquisitive mindset with a genuine desire to understand and solve problems.

About the Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need.

If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity, please apply directly.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job no: RMG-959034
Work type: Permanent - Full time
Location: Sydney

Opening Date: 28/7/2021

Date: 29-Jul-2021

Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU Melbourne, VIC, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:

A dynamic environment which will provide you with a platform to build your career
Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best
World-class learning and leadership programs

Do you want to help some of the largest, most interesting organisations in the world imagine and deliver the future of risk analytics?

Companies face a period of unprecedented complexity, including regulatory change, business disruption, emerging technologies, and ever-increasing customer expectations. Deloitte is here to make an impact that matters by helping solve complex risk and regulatory issues for our globally strategic clients. Our work extends across the full lifecycle of financial services, to transform complex business requirements into practical, implementable solutions. By re-imagining the way organisations can quickly identify, evaluate, manage risk, and deliver on regulatory change, we create:

a more transparent, efficient, and compliant world that ultimately ensures customers get fair outcomes
opportunities for our clients to take risks, so that they can grow and transform in a responsible way

In response to the growing demand for our team’s Risk Analytics services, we are looking to hire data scientists to join our National team, delivering market leading advice and practical data solutions that make a material impact to our clients, our people and society. We are looking for Data Scientists with 2-4 years’ experience either in-industry or with professional services firms, both globally and here in Australia.

We don’t just work with our clients to manage the downside of risk through leading data analytics solutions - we help them understand and seize the opportunities it presents too, helping them accelerate their growth or gain a competitive advantage.
If you’re an ideas person, problem solver and a hands-on doer, who loves to collaborate, you’ll thrive here.

We invest in our people, so you will have access to leading training and development opportunities, allowing you to develop both personally and professionally.

Some of the work we do includes:

Design algorithms, develop scripts and documentation for bespoke data solutions and models to solve complex regulatory, conduct and compliance problems using analytical tools and techniques.
Transform the ways clients leverage people, technology, data, business processes and controls, to better manage risks and optimise processes
Support the delivery of projects across a range of industries focusing on providing our clients with evidence based actionable insights to reduce risk and improve compliance
Working both autonomously, and closely with colleagues, Senior Data Scientists and Managers to deliver data solutions to clients
Taking ownership for the delivery of data analysis activities within a stream of work to deliver project goals
Devise and deploy effective communication strategies and supporting materials

About the team
People working across a wide range of industries and the public sector, our team advise, implement, and deliver analytics to support decision-making. Our team is an inclusive, dynamic, and growing team committed to driving innovation, delivering client outcomes, and making an impact that matters. The strength of our team lies in the diversity of the background and skillset of each member, fostered in a collaborative environment.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:

Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics or Computer Science related degree OR prior data analytics and/or consulting experience
Knowledge of data mining algorithms, statistical and machine learning methods, best practice data transformation and validation techniques
Programming skills in languages and tools such as SAS, R, Python, SQL and SSIS
Data visualization skills, including design, build and communication of data insights using reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Ability to thrive working in a team environment and serving clients with distinction
Highly developed communication skills
Strong attention to detail with a curiosity to understand data
Ideally, a keen interest in third party datasets, emerging analytics tools and technologies within the risk and regulatory compliance
Experience in developing/validating/monitoring Credit Risk Models (PD/LGD/EAD), and / or IFRS9 models, and an understanding of Capital Adequacy (APS112/APS113) and prudential standards, guidelines, and reporting requirements will be valued, but not mandatory

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytic and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?
There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
Our success is our people, for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focussed culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.
We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilising cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.
What you’ll do:
The Big Data Platform Analyst is responsible for ensuring overall performance, availability and fitness of the big data analytic ecosystem of data, applications, tools and environments essential for Equifax Data and Analytics operations.
This team member will analyse platform performance, coordinate activities with Administration, IT and D&A teams to implement new and improved platform functionality and systems to ensure continuous performance of applications critical for D&A success.
Further, the team member will support certification of different parts of the Big Data chain, validating data, flow, and functionality to ensure the tools and data are largely fit for purpose. They will work with various teams to gather testing requirements, as well as build monitoring suites.
This individual must have a balance of strong technical skills and business acumen to elevate performance & quality to the highest level for the company. The individual will leverage data analysis skills and ability to learn quickly in fast evolving technology environment.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor’s Degree required preferably in Computer Science, Engineering or Statistics
2+ years Big Data skills including Hadoop, Python, Linux, BigQuery, GCP dataflow, SQL or equivalent
Experience with data analysis and problem solving with big data
Data mining skills and experience with BI tools such as Spotfire, Tableau or equivalent
Complex problem-solving skills to identify technical performance gaps and develop solutions
Ability to resolve complex issues through active listening and interpretation
Excellent observational skills to validate data
Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to technical staff, managers, and users
Organizational and project management skills
Extra points for any of the following:
Applicable advanced degrees and certificates
Experience in the disciplines of data quality, data governance, data integration and data management
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Brave
Curious
Collaborative
Individualist
Trustworthy
Dedicated
At Equifax, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'
Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process, sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know, we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.
Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge, experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. Where possible, you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.
However you identify, and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

AUS-Sydney-100-Arthur

Function - Tech Dev and Client Services

"At CommBank we are proud to support flexibility, let's discuss what this means for you"
See yourself in our team

Business Banking (BB) is a key client facing business group within the Commonwealth Bank. The clients of BB include the Banks corporate, regional and agribusiness and small business clients and caters to all product needs including business lending, everyday business banking, share trading & margin lending, home lending and consumer finance.
Business Lending Finance is a divisional finance team within the Financial Services division. BB Finance provides specialist finance services and advice to effectively support the business lending product team.
BB Finance has dedicated teams to provide financial performance and analysis services to enable effective decision making by various stakeholders.
Do work that matters
Key areas of impact & contribution include;
Management of month end reporting cycle, half and full year end reporting
Financial controls - financial and non-financial risk control oversight
Engagement with BB Finance to ensure a proactive and transparent approach to risk
Working with BB Finance BI platform focused on commercial value
Compliance with group wide policies and delivery protocols
Assess business opportunities and providing commercial advice and input
Supporting the business with ad-hoc financial analysis and decision support
Ensure integrity and timeliness of financial data, including reconciliation to underlying Product Systems
Facilitate process improvement initiatives to the reporting, planning and analysis
Analysis of business drivers including revenue, costs, asset and liability growth, ROTE and PACC
Capital analysis
We’re interested in hearing from people who have
CA / CPA, or CFA qualification
Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related discipline
Excellent commercial acumen
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Excellent Financial Control experience
High degree of problem solving and analytical ability with a close attention to detail
Self-motivated with an ability to work to deadlines and without supervision
SQL, Alteryx and Tableau (BI/MI tools) experience an advantage
Preferable experience in the Financial Services industry
Ability to collaborate & work as part of a team
Risk Mindset – All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks.

READY FOR ANYTHING

At IAG, we live and work by our purpose to make your world a safer place. We are motivated by a unique culture that celebrates honesty, creativity, empathy, equity and collaboration. We call it the IAG way, and it means we all share a ‘ready for anything’ mindset that sets the tone for positive actions and positive outcomes. We put heart into everything we do which guides us to create amazing things for our customers, our people and our communities.

We’re brimming with ideas, ambition and a readiness to apply bold thinking and risk awareness to make a difference where it matters most.

As the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, we own some of the region’s most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI. We are ready for anything.

The Role

Are you interested in using AI and data analysis to improve customer experience? Do you want wish to develop a career in Data Science with an organisation that actively supports learning? IAG might be just the place!

We’re looking for a budding Data Scientist to join our established and highly collaborative Analytics team. In this role you will work under the mentorship of one of our Senior Data Scientists to infuse AI into IAG’s business operations. You will be given the opportunity to be involved in the end-to-end analytics lifecycle; from AI concept, model build and deployment of advanced analytical models in programming languages such as SQL, R & Python. If you have a curious mindset with some exposure to advanced analytical models and are eager to progress in the data science world then this will be an amazing opportunity to propel your career!

Key Responsibilities

You will prototype, update and test advanced analytical models under the direction of a data scientist and lead within your team.
You will contribute to building tools and processes supporting the activation of claims analytics within IAG.
You will work with data scientists to produce datasets for use in analysis and model training.
You will contribute to analysis seeking to understand claims processes and the impact of changes to the claims experience that IAG can make, with a view to aiding critical business decisions.
You will conduct preliminary analysis to test hypotheses and assumptions for proposed machine decisioning products and process changes and monitor the impact of changes implemented.

Skills & Experience

Degree qualification in a related field; e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or other relevant technical field.
Elementary programming and statistical modelling experience (including experience with modelling software such as R and Python).
Knowledge of analytics and data processing technologies and architectures is desirable.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences is desirable.
Problem solving skills and with a curious mindset are desirable.

Ready for anything? Let’s talk.


IAG rewards and recognises its people with generous benefits, career development opportunities and real work-life balance. Employees also enjoy 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work programs, various corporate partner discounts and a people-focused culture that celebrates achievements big and small.

Creating a workforce that actively embraces diversity, inclusion and a sense of belonging is key to our success. We believe in treating everyone fairly which means that inclusion, removing barriers, striving for equity and embracing diversity are woven through our values and behaviours. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities and are committed to providing a work environment that enables you to thrive, whatever your circumstances. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements please advise us via your application.

IAG has committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on providing a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our company website.

Job Title: Lead Data Analyst/ Data Delivery Lead
Job Description:
Customer data savvy wanted
Permanent full-time Contract
Join an organisation committed to creating spaces where communities thrive
We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst – Customer Intelligence to join the team on a permanent full-time contract.
As the Analyst, you will contribute to a high-performance team by performing analysis, providing data insights, solving problems, and building solutions for Stockland through customer data and research.
Key Responsibilities:
Proactively support and collaborate with the analysts and data scientists to provide the marketing team with timely and accurate insights to support decision making.
Support and lead initiatives to improve customer centricity in Stockland with other members of the analytics team and the Marketing Leadership Team.
Develop dashboards and embed advanced analytics solutions built by the analytics team to extract value from the insights by applying them to customer-related processes marketing decision making.
Manage quantitative and qualitative data collection and data quality improvement initiatives, including ongoing surveys, that enable a deeper understanding and the potential for targeting improvements. Manage includes, but is not limited to, project scoping, survey design, working with stakeholders, suppliers & agencies and delivering recommendations.
Manage the growth and development of the Stockland research community, as well as utilizing it for research purposes.
Assist with the integration of new data, research tools, digital marketing tools or platforms into the marketing tech stack.
Proactively manage risk for Data Privacy regulations, working with the broader marketing team to drive best practice for the proper collection, storage and use of Customer Data.
Participate in the set-up of objectives and metrics for the measurement and optimization of campaigns, customer conversion initiatives, or referral initiatives.
Work with internal business stakeholders to identify research needs and design, execute and communicate appropriate research solution to give the business guidance/recommendation etc. based on customer insights.
Maintain strong working relationships with external suppliers and internal stakeholders to deliver data and research projects to a high standard, on time and on budget.
What are we looking for?
At least two years’ experience in a marketing, data analysis or research related role.
Experience with SQL is highly sought after. Basic experience with programming languages like Python or R is non-essential but desired.
Experience with designing and scripting surveys, as well as analyzing results from qualitative research
Demonstrated skills in communicating insights and recommendations.
Appropriate tertiary qualification (e.g., marketing, commerce)
The Stockland Proposition
At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.
We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds, and we want our teams to reflect this.
We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidized lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.
Due to the nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date.

We currently have an exciting opportunity to join the Enterprise Data Office team. A key focus of the role will be to guide, support and work with the central Data and Analytics team to simplify, standardise and automate key data processes. Provide data management service and solutions to support analysis and research relevant to the Bank's core functions. Support the Enterprise Data Office to embed and improve data management best practices in the RBA. This is a 10-Month Fixed-Term Contract.

Responsibilities will include:

Work with business subject matter experts to understand and document existing data management processes and practices and to identify opportunities for improvement
Provide process management subject-matter guidance to re-design, simplify and standardise data management and analytics processes, and automate using modern data tools
Promote the adoption of modern data management and analytics tools and practices throughout the organisation
Contribute to the improvement of policies, systems and processes, ensuring the integrity, accessibility and suitability of information, as well as solutions resilient to changes in technology and operating environments
Engage and educate stakeholders about the value of data management and data technologies


Your team

This role is part of the Corporate Services Group. The Corporate Services Group is responsible for the effective provision of information technology, workplace (asset management, facilities management, building security, and procurement) and data management services to support the delivery of the Bank’s policy, operational and corporate objectives.


Your background

To be successful in this critical role you will possess:

5+ years experience as a business analyst in large data related projects, ideally in the financial services industry
Experience in process reengineering and documentation
Understanding of programming language concepts such as R or Python, understanding of ETL, database concepts and SQL
Understanding of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts and architectures with experience of software development lifecycle in this context

Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Strong stakeholder management experience


Your development & career

Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports people’s growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility.

Why RBA?

The RBA pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contributes to the welfare of the Australian people.

Our people have a critical role to play in achieving these objectives, whether directly or in a supporting capacity. As a values driven organisation, our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, we treat one another with respect, while promoting the public interest in our efforts.

The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Greenstone is a large business with multiple brands, but we don't silo our marketing activities. We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.
This is the place where you’ll be hands on. Where new ideas are welcomed and expected.
At every level – and in every role – we’re doers and builders. Not Managers and minders.
hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of buy now pay later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
What's so exciting about this role?
Be part of a forward thinking team who are responsible for protecting hummgroup and its customers from fraud by data analytics, optimising fraud systems and providing insights through timely reporting. This is an end to end, hands on role, working across all our products.
What does an average day look like?
No day is average at hummgroup, but here’s an idea of what you can expect to do in this role and what you will be responsible for:
Analyse fraud trends and implement detection strategies balancing fraud risk and customer friction
Optimise existing detection strategies to ensure effectiveness and efficiency is maintained within expectations
Engage in projects to assist with testing and change management activities
Complete data analysis to assist in business decisions
Develop accurate and clear reporting that supports effective oversight of fraud performance
Work unsupervised and under challenging deadlines
Prioritise workload and proactively call out delays
Who will thrive in this role?
You are analytical and curious, and put that to use by driving great customer experiences and profitable growth for humm. You can manage a busy workload of top priorities and can be relied on to deliver end-to-end. You are someone who believes in the strength of good relationships. You are flexible, driven and passionate about customers; you can operate in and contribute to a fast paced and dynamic environment.
We’re also looking for someone who brings:
1+ years' experience using data analytics tools such as SQL, SAS or R
1+ years' experience developing application and transactional fraud rules (Digital and card channels preferred)
Advanced verbal, written and numeracy skills
A demonstrated ability to work with business stakeholders to resolve issues
Data analysis and data insights
Data visualisation skills (Power BI preferable)
Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistics, computing, science, engineering or actuarial studies (highly desirable).
And did we mention that we are working in a super-fast-paced environment where change is the only constant? We really mean it so experience working at pace is essential. If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you!

This is an exciting new opportunity to assist in defining the future of Data and Business Architecture/Solutions in our Risk Management Group Data team.

In this permanent role you will work with stakeholders across the business and technology to develop a deep understanding of the growing data, analytics and automation needs of different risk functions as well as support the design and build of business solutions to cater to the requirements of each risk function. You will be assisting in managing projects as well as documenting business and functional requirements for risk’s data use cases and work with the tech architecture to develop technical solutions.

You will also be responsible for:

Working on solutions for strategic remediation of Data Quality issues across the broad Risk Management Group
Working on producing data model designs to ensure higher collaboration and efficiency in data usage across the Group’s functions
Being the representative for the Risk Management Group representing all Risk functions in enterprise programs and to ensure that RMG requirements are catered to
Assisting in ensuring all the data relevant to our risk function is brought under governance
Translating business solutions to tech solutions and work with tech delivery teams to deliver the required outcomes for our Risk Functions.

To be successful in this role you will possess vast experience in working with data and solutions in an Investment Bank, ideally as a business/technical analyst or a business solutions architect. Exposure to Risk Management will be highly advantageous.

CFA (any level) or FRM certification is desired but not mandatory.

Possessing a computer science or finance related degree is advantageous. You will be passionate about the potential application of cloud based big data technologies and hold an inquisitive mindset with a genuine desire to understand and solve problems.

About the Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need.

If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity, please apply directly.


About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Description:

A dynamic environment which will provide you with a platform to build your career
Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best
World-class learning and leadership programs

Do you want to help some of the largest, most interesting organisations in the world imagine and deliver the future of risk analytics?

Companies face a period of unprecedented complexity, including regulatory change, business disruption, emerging technologies, and ever-increasing customer expectations. Deloitte is here to make an impact that matters by helping solve complex risk and regulatory issues for our globally strategic clients. Our work extends across the full lifecycle of financial services, to transform complex business requirements into practical, implementable solutions. By re-imagining the way organisations can quickly identify, evaluate, manage risk, and deliver on regulatory change, we create:

a more transparent, efficient, and compliant world that ultimately ensures customers get fair outcomes
opportunities for our clients to take risks, so that they can grow and transform in a responsible way

In response to the growing demand for our team’s Risk Analytics services, we are looking to hire data scientists to join our National team, delivering market leading advice and practical data solutions that make a material impact to our clients, our people and society. We are looking for Data Scientists with 2-4 years’ experience either in-industry or with professional services firms, both globally and here in Australia.

We don’t just work with our clients to manage the downside of risk through leading data analytics solutions - we help them understand and seize the opportunities it presents too, helping them accelerate their growth or gain a competitive advantage.
If you’re an ideas person, problem solver and a hands-on doer, who loves to collaborate, you’ll thrive here.

We invest in our people, so you will have access to leading training and development opportunities, allowing you to develop both personally and professionally.

Some of the work we do includes:

Design algorithms, develop scripts and documentation for bespoke data solutions and models to solve complex regulatory, conduct and compliance problems using analytical tools and techniques.
Transform the ways clients leverage people, technology, data, business processes and controls, to better manage risks and optimise processes
Support the delivery of projects across a range of industries focusing on providing our clients with evidence based actionable insights to reduce risk and improve compliance
Working both autonomously, and closely with colleagues, Senior Data Scientists and Managers to deliver data solutions to clients
Taking ownership for the delivery of data analysis activities within a stream of work to deliver project goals
Devise and deploy effective communication strategies and supporting materials

About the team
People working across a wide range of industries and the public sector, our team advise, implement, and deliver analytics to support decision-making. Our team is an inclusive, dynamic, and growing team committed to driving innovation, delivering client outcomes, and making an impact that matters. The strength of our team lies in the diversity of the background and skillset of each member, fostered in a collaborative environment.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:

Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics or Computer Science related degree OR prior data analytics and/or consulting experience
Knowledge of data mining algorithms, statistical and machine learning methods, best practice data transformation and validation techniques
Programming skills in languages and tools such as SAS, R, Python, SQL and SSIS
Data visualization skills, including design, build and communication of data insights using reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Ability to thrive working in a team environment and serving clients with distinction
Highly developed communication skills
Strong attention to detail with a curiosity to understand data
Ideally, a keen interest in third party datasets, emerging analytics tools and technologies within the risk and regulatory compliance
Experience in developing/validating/monitoring Credit Risk Models (PD/LGD/EAD), and / or IFRS9 models, and an understanding of Capital Adequacy (APS112/APS113) and prudential standards, guidelines, and reporting requirements will be valued, but not mandatory

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytic and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?
There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
Our success is our people, for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focussed culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.
We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilising cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.
What you’ll do:
The Big Data Platform Analyst is responsible for ensuring overall performance, availability and fitness of the big data analytic ecosystem of data, applications, tools and environments essential for Equifax Data and Analytics operations.
This team member will analyse platform performance, coordinate activities with Administration, IT and D&A teams to implement new and improved platform functionality and systems to ensure continuous performance of applications critical for D&A success.
Further, the team member will support certification of different parts of the Big Data chain, validating data, flow, and functionality to ensure the tools and data are largely fit for purpose. They will work with various teams to gather testing requirements, as well as build monitoring suites.
This individual must have a balance of strong technical skills and business acumen to elevate performance & quality to the highest level for the company. The individual will leverage data analysis skills and ability to learn quickly in fast evolving technology environment.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor’s Degree required preferably in Computer Science, Engineering or Statistics
2+ years Big Data skills including Hadoop, Python, Linux, BigQuery, GCP dataflow, SQL or equivalent
Experience with data analysis and problem solving with big data
Data mining skills and experience with BI tools such as Spotfire, Tableau or equivalent
Complex problem-solving skills to identify technical performance gaps and develop solutions
Ability to resolve complex issues through active listening and interpretation
Excellent observational skills to validate data
Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to technical staff, managers, and users
Organizational and project management skills
Extra points for any of the following:
Applicable advanced degrees and certificates
Experience in the disciplines of data quality, data governance, data integration and data management
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Brave
Curious
Collaborative
Individualist
Trustworthy
Dedicated
At Equifax, there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'
Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process, sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know, we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.
Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities, knowledge, experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. Where possible, you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.
However you identify, and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

Join an Insurance leader that is driven by data
Work with in-demand tools and technologies - Google Analytics, PowerBI & more
Monitor and analyse our SEM, an area with our richest data sets
The Opportunity

At Greenstone, we are truly analytics driven business, with analytics driving and informing decisions across all aspects of the business. In this role you will be responsible for monitoring and analysing our Search Engine Marketing, an area that has some of the richest datasets for analysis. What someone has searched for, where they are located, what time of day it is, are they searching from a mobile or computer - these are all import factors that can be used to predict how likely someone is to purchase a product from us, and thus how much we should spend on advertising to them.


Greenstone is a large business with multiple brands, but we don't silo our marketing activities. You will need to determine if and how ads from our own competing brands should be shown to potential customers. You will also work with our existing machine learning models and provide input on the development of new ML models. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with some of the most sophisticated data-driven marketing in Australia, you won't simply report on the performance of our search marketing, but rather be a key player and defining that performance.


What are we looking for?

Tertiary qualification in a relevant Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Science, Engineering or Statistics discipline
Experience (typically 4-6 years) in a similar insight driven data analytics area
Strong experience in SQL and either Python / R / SAS
Strong experience in visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Comprehensive understanding of MS Excel and other applications within the MS Office suit
Strong conceptual, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of Digital Channels (SEM, SEO, FB, EDM)
Knowledge of Web Analytics Tool (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)

Desirable

Exposure to digital marketing campaigns and profitability
Our Promise to Our People
We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That's why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:
Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more
Hybrid Office and Work From Home model
Company funded paid parental leave benefit (18 weeks!)
State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company cafe (weekly free lunch) & on-site gym
Health & well-being initiatives and programs
Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops
Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people
Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, Taronga Zoo entry, live shows + more
Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks)
Who is Greenstone?

Greenstone distributes insurance products under trusted brands such as Real Insurance, RSPCA Pet Insurance, Guardian, Medibank, Woolworths, Guide Dogs Pet Insurance, Kogan Life Insurance, Australian Seniors Insurance Agency and Choosi.


We are the leading distributor of direct Insurance products in the Australian insurance market. Since launching into the Financial Services sector in 2007, Greenstone has experienced a commanding volume of growth being recognised for our credible brands, customer focused values and people-driven work culture.


We are passionate about our core values, which contribute towards the positive culture that supports our employees, our customers and our community.


Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Bella Vista - only a short walk from Norwest Metro station (also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown).


With the exceptional circumstances being experienced globally due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), Greenstone is working hard to support all our candidates and new starters during these critical times. Please be aware that our entire recruitment processes will be conducted virtually. We are also accredited as a Covid-safe workplace by NSW Government.


Apply Now

About us
Over the next 40 years, Sydney’s population is projected to swell to over 12 million residents and regional NSW will accommodate an extra 700,000 people. Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy which will bring together several?modes and cutting edge?technologies to deliver satisfaction and safety for our customers while supporting a rapidly growing economy.
The Division
We are a trusted partner to our clients, within Customer Strategy and Technology, developing and delivering smart, integrated and sustainable data platform which enable data-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities.
The opportunity
Right now, we have an exciting temporary opportunity (until 30 Jun 2022) for a Technical Business Analyst to join us in Data & Systems Integration team and provide analysis, technical specifications and advice to support the translation of business requirements to data modelling and/or business intelligence solutions to ensure the correct solution design and implementation.
You will play a pivotal role in conducting analysis, evaluation of functional and non-functional requirements and documentation of technical specifications while also act brand ambassador for the Advanced Analytics & Integration branch.
What you will be involved in but not limited to:
Translate business requirements into technical specification including data models and functionality of end user apps (e.g. Business Intelligence solutions).
Identify gaps in current availability of data to delivery solution and propose recommendations to address these including new definitions, metrics, dimensions or metadata.
Work with different teams to identify future data needs to deliver target state or models as per customer needs.
Conduct investigative work to identify appropriate and practical solutions which meet the needs of the business, align to enterprise standards, and ensure that the team can deliver outcomes.
Ensure technical specifications communicate user requirements in technical terms for submission to development teams.
Interpret and translate analysis results into quality technical specifications and or user stories that are insightful, clear and succinct.
Develop a deep understanding of system functionality and design as well as target state outcomes to ensure that technical specifications are aligned, feasible, sustainable and scalable.
About you:
Demonstrated experience in gathering and understanding technical requirements from a IT Data centric program/projects.
Experience in large and complex system integrations with data and data modelling principles.
Experience in developing functional and non-functional requirements for business solutions.
Unfulfilled quench for digging data, analyse trends and provide valuable insights.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills.
Ability to influence and quickly build relationships.
Experience in Cloud, Knowledge of networking fundamentals, Data ingestion techniques, Data integration would be considered as a bonus.
Want to know more?
Interested?
Right now is an exciting time to join our team as we deliver an iconic $72.2 billion investment into future transport infrastructure and services over 40 years.
Be a part of something big. Apply today to register your interest!

We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.
