SafetyCulture is an Australian-based, international tech scale-up. We create SaaS solutions that empower front line workers to drive operational excellence and take ownership of their safety and wellbeing.
iAuditor was launched in 2012 to solve a global problem. Reduce workplace injuries and help frontline workers get home safely to their families. Fast forward 7 years, and we have hundreds of thousands of workers in over 150 countries using our platform, conducting millions of inspections every month. We’re excited to have a largely untapped global market and ambitious goals to reach 100 million workers. We’re looking for talented and mission-driven people to drive that growth.
Our Customer Support team delivers an exceptional customer experience and is continuously striving to set the bar higher and higher every day. Our Support Analysts live and breath our “Think Customer” value every day. They combine their incredible people skills with technology expertise and the result is a a market leading customer experience.
So what does this mean for you? You have the opportunity to work with seriously talented people who will continue to encourage and help you to achieve the very best. You will have the opportunity to “Be Bold, Bring Action” by delivering new insights and ideas designed to fill those gaps we have. Our Support Analysts are the bridge between our teams and SafetyCulture customers.
What will I be doing?
Responding to our customers’ concerns across chat, email, and calls based on the SLA set or even faster!
Always striving to educate our customers about the company, our product and our products’ features.
Using data analysis to evaluate the customer problem, helping you to find an accurate and long-term solution.
Walking your customers through tricky installation processes and troubleshooting.
Looking for alternative solutions that will allow you prioritise. Bring ideas on how to help your customers achieve the same outcome just without you.
Create and send technical documentation to customers and within the technology platforms that the company uses. Notes provided in all the systems should be complete, accurate and follows the quality framework.
Knowing the escalation cases (based on guidelines for escalation) that should be reassigned to the Level 2 Analysts.
Research required information using SafetyCulture prescribed and approved resources.
Confidence in your decision to close customer cases, knowing that you came to a solution both yourself and the customer is excited about.
What do I need?
Customer centric approach and dedicated to solving customer problems
Love for technology and solving technical issues
Prior experience in customer support highly desirable
Why SafetyCulture?
We’re operating at a scale few other companies are, and you’ll be doing challenging work that impacts millions every day and helps to move the world forward.
Opportunity to work with Australia's Voted 4th Best Place to Work and Global Tech Unicorn
Paid Parental Leave Program and supportive and inclusive company culture
Continuous Career Development programs.
Equity with high growth potential, and a Competitive Salary and Bonus Structure
In-house chef that cooks a delicious lunch, plus a breakfast bar and unlimited snacks
Pet-friendly office with onsite cafe and bar
Regular social events and celebrations, including the annual ShipIt global offsite
Solid onboarding program, regular training and additional development programs
We operate within a largely untapped market with endless possibilities and we are a part of a new, exciting wave of SaaS companies that focus on frontline workers
The Company
SafetyCulture is a customer and product-driven company with an ambitious mission: empower front line workers to drive operational excellence and take ownership of their safety and wellbeing. The company started in Townsville, our HQ is in Sydney, and we have offices in Kansas City, Manchester and Manila.
This is an exciting time in SafetyCulture’s history. We now have more than 300 mission-obsessed people driving outcomes for our customers. We have a strong senior leadership team with experience taking start-ups through the critical scale-up phase. We’ve raised more than $150 million in funding, which will be used to evolve the product into an alerts platform for distributed teams, and expansion into insurance, sensors and IoT, and telematics for fleets. The goal is to have 100 million people using our products every day.
To all recruitment agencies: we do not accept resumes or partnership opportunities. Please do not forward resumes to SafetyCulture or any of our employees. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
At SafetyCulture, we respect and appreciate what makes each of our team members different in terms of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation. We unite to support one another as allies and we take deliberate steps to ensure that our people feel like they belong and can thrive at work each day.

Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. Job Title: Senior Analytics and Data Warehouse SA
Job Description:
Exciting role
How will I help?
The key purpose to this role is to perform enhanced customer due diligence (ECDD) to investigate the background of the customer by performing analysis to determine high ML/TF risk. This team works closely with the Monitoring and Reporting team where Suspicious Matter Reports are required to be investigated and reported to AUSTRAC.
You will be required to:
Understanding of AML/CTF legal requirements relating AML/CTF policies and applying them
Conduct end to end review of Legal notices cases to identify any unusual activity and escalate the cases to Tier 2 (Monitoring and Reporting team) or HRC (High-Risk Customer) Team for further review depending on the red flags identified as per AUSTRAC typologies
Managing complex cases involving matters such as notices involving multiple Person of Interest (POIs), international wire transfers involving banks designated to High-Risk Jurisdictions
Investigate further through Enhanced Customer Due Diligence when you are required to know more about the customer (KYC)
Act as a reference point to internal stakeholders by educating and complying with Westpac’s Standards
Raise an Unusual Matter Report (UMR) when red flags are identified as per AUSTRAC typologies.
Assist and provide input in ad-hoc projects at any given time.
Escalation of all high risk customers with adherence to the AML Operations Agreement
What is in it for me?
In a word, lots! As well as job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers) you will be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You will also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer. Importantly you will play a significant role in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years.
What do I need?
You will have knowledge of Anti- Money Laundering & Counter Terrorism Finance (ML/TF) and ability to read and interpret information and apply to the relevant controls. In addition, you will have to the ability to made decisions.
You must have excellent time management skills and ability to be adaptable to change. Also, you will have knowledge across multiple banking systems, to operate efficiently across platforms.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility- and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

About Woolies X
WooliesX is part of the Woolworths Group. We’re an innovation business that brings together the brightest minds in e-commerce, technology, media and data to transform the way people live and shop. We’re here to create better everyday experiences for our customers. In the big picture, and the fine detail. In moments big and small.
We’ve worked together with our partners to create all kinds of initiatives you know and love – like Everyday Rewards, one of Australia’s most popular loyalty programs. Alongside Woolworths Supermarkets, we’ve helped make online shopping simpler and more intuitive, and were awarded #1 in customer satisfaction for online groceries by Canstar for our combined effort.
About the role
The role will provide analysis, process modelling and recommendations to support concept
development, and costing and development of solutions to be implemented.
The role leads process design/improvement of medium and large initiatives to successful outcomes through the use of industry standard business improvement methodologies, such as Lean/Six Sigma, and other problem-solving methodologies.
The role delivers business analysis and outcomes through the application of data analysis techniques such as SQL and other data analytics techniques.
Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Lead the analysis of existing process:
Problem/objective statement
Key measures of success and data collection planning
Detailed analysis of the as-is process
 Lead the design of process:
Process flow charts
Standard Operating Procedures
Process validation and verification
 Conduct work measurement studies, including data collection and analysis
 Complete labour modelling to identify and validate process and productivity improvements
 Assist in improving labour performance; develop recommendations and initiatives that generate long-term sustainable change
 Facilitate workshops with stakeholders at multiple levels within the organization

Who we are looking for
This is a varied and hands-on role that will require working in a range of environments to observe and assess different processes. We are looking for someone who enjoys working in a dynamic environment, talking to a wide range of people and can be flexible and pivot quickly when required.
Skills Required
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certified (with project experience)
Process Mapping and Modelling - Visio, ARIS, Promapp - is a plus
Problem solving - different techniques
SQL database extraction and query writing
MS Excel data analysis skills
Understanding of retail, demand planning and logistics fundamentals
Lead the design of process through process flow charts, Standard Operating Procedures, Process validation and verification
Able to extract metrics from database
Able to manipulate data to answer business questions
Capable of joining multiple datasets together
Complete labour modelling to identify and validate process and productivity improvements
Experience with improving labour performance; develop recommendations and initiatives that generate long-term sustainable change
Stakeholder management

About Us
At Optus, we are striving to become Australia’s most loved everyday brand with lasting customer relationships and truly believe digital is one of the keys to unlocking our vision. When we consider how we interact with our customers, our vision is at the forefront of our thinking.

About the Team
The Analytics Team at Optus are leaders in driving value out of data. We enable stakeholders to make informed, data based decisions to build connections with our customers, deliver digitally engaging experiences, improve business processes and explore new innovation opportunities while maintaining the highest data privacy standards. It's our collaborative culture that’s focused on growth and development with an entrepreneurial spirit that makes us unique. We love helping data tell a story and unlocking the value of data to help make better decisions for our business and our customers. Every day presents a new opportunity to create rich insights, learn new skills and work across the organisation to do good things with data for our customers.

About the Role
As a key member of the Analytics leadership team, the Associate Director of Data Analytics leads the data insights generation business for Optus Consumer. You will own the Analytical Asset & Data Insights Roadmap, gathering input from business stakeholders, aligned to our business strategy with a specific focus on creativity, innovation and value. By working with our Analytics Community and stakeholders to improve data literacy across the organisation, you’ll drive the adoption and utilisation of data insights to help solve business problems and build strong connections with our customers.

More specifically your responsibilities will include:
Coordinating our strategic analytical investments and scaling insights/solutions across Optus
Building strong, trusted advisor relationships with all stakeholders to foster a collaborative and innovative culture moving from a traditionally transactional engagement model
Regularly updating ExCo Steering Committees to provide visibility of the impact that Analytics is having on achieving our vision and delivering on the strategy
Pragmatically developing analytical assets and data insights for business problems that appropriately balance insight richness/quality/timeliness/performance/value
Aligning the technology ecosystem, data environments, analytical methodologies & analytical assets to the Optus strategic roadmap
Working in an Agile environment, this role has Chapter lead responsibilities and accountability for a current team of 8 data insights experts
Ensuring team members have a growth oriented, proactive, innovative and entrepreneurial mindset
Ensuring chapter members have appropriate technical competencies/soft skills to perform their roles to a high standard, providing necessary coaching support and plan for future talent needs through enablers including the Analytics Community/OptusU
Maintaining an appropriate working knowledge of Optus products, lines of business and processes to ensure that any insights/solutions developed are contextually appropriate and valuable to the organisation
Negotiating with IT/vendors/third parties to ensure that appropriate technology enablers and data assets are available and leveraged effectively across Analytics

About You
We are looking for the following skills, experience and attributes:
Tertiary qualifications in a STEM or business discipline
Leadership experience in an Agile environments
Driving and embedding change across large organisations with multi-disciplinary teams
Advanced communication skills using different mediums and to a variety of audiences with varying levels of technical competency
Sound leadership, coaching and mentoring skills
Sound negotiation skills
Advanced time/project management skills
Visualisation tool vendor certification (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, etc)
Self-service data preparation tool vendor certification (e.g. Alteryx, etc)
Agile certification (e.g. SP, SSM, SA, POPM, etc)

Why Optus ?
We offer all kinds of benefits, such as:
Work collaboratively in an open agile environment
Discounts with over 400 companies Australia wide (Technology, Retail, Home, Fashion and more!)
Mobile & Internet discounts, Novated Car Leasing, and other Financial benefits
Training, Mentoring and further learning opportunities
Staff buses to and from campus at Epping & Wynyard train stations
Up to five days of Volunteer Leave per year

Blended Ways of Working
We understand that flexibility means different things to different people. We are proud to offer a variety of options to work in different ways, such as flexible hours, partial remote working, job share and part-time. Please talk to us about how we can make this role work for you. Our flexible hybrid remote model lets our people work across home and one of our offices across Australia. Optus is an inclusive, multigenerational workplace where people at different life and career stages can feel valued and supported. We recognise and appreciate that we're at varied phases in our work and our lives. That's why we do all we can to offer the flexibility needed to manage time and family commitment.

Applicants to this role must have work authorization in Australia. This role is not eligible for work visa sponsorship.

At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working with statistical packages (e.g., R, SAS, Stata, MATLAB, etc.).
Experience articulating product questions, drawing data from datasets (i.e., SQL), and using statistics to arrive at an answer.
Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Sciences).
Experience in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of estimated time to launch (ETL) flows.
Experience in an inter-disciplinary/cross-functional field.
Interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation.
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Ability to speak and write in Japanese fluently.
About the job
Product Analysts provide quantitative analysis, market expertise, and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you'll serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make key recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management.
As a Product Analyst, you will tally up the numbers one minute and communicate your findings to a team leader the next. You will see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you will know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful recommendations on strategy.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis).
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and presentations.
Help Google to focus on key decisions to improve products and services.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

About us
Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.
About the team
The Corporate Service team within Sydney Metro supports the whole organisation including Operational and Project teams with best-in-class IT, Technology, Procurement, HR, Financial Management and Communications functions. We partner closely with the business as well as with senior stakeholders, media and community groups to drive performance, build relationships and manage our exemplary reputation.
The opportunity
Right now, we have an opportunity for a Reporting Analyst to join us in Finance reporting to the Senior Manager, Management Accounting.
The primary purpose of the role is to provide a range of financial and management reporting services to support high standards across financial, budget and funding matters. The role works collaboratively across internal stakeholders including involvement in reporting of finances and monitoring of financial information.
What you will be involved in:
Working closely and managing the financial performance of a Division within Sydney Metro including the identification of risks at an early stage across a large, diverse and complex organization to continually improve financial performance and minimise financial risks.Liaise regularly with the Management Reporting Team to assist the development of high quality management reporting packs and enhance understanding, identify trends and resolve issues.Support the analysis of financial performance, budgets, forecasts, forward estimates and other financial and performance metrics to provide input to the consolidated Delivery Management Budget for Sydney Metro.Adapting to a dynamic work environment as it evolves and progresses through substantial change
About you
You are tertiary qualified in a Finance discipline from a recognised tertiary institution with demonstrated experience in finance programs (SAP), and be looking for an opportunity to utilise your finance experience and work in a team with a supportive culture to develop your career.
You have demonstrated experience in financial analysis and management reporting, with advanced computer literacy. Ideally, you are on the pathway of getting CA or CPA, you will have a can-do-attitude and have professional communication skills both written and verbal.
Salary and benefits
The salary for this position is Grade 8 ($118,015 - $132,898) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.
Interested?
Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and answer all questions within the online application process.
Applications close: 11:59 pm, Sunday 15th August 2021

SafetyCulture is an Australian-based, international tech scale-up. We create SaaS solutions that empower front line workers to drive operational excellence and take ownership of their safety and wellbeing.
iAuditor was launched in 2012 to solve a global problem. Reduce workplace injuries and help frontline workers get home safely to their families. Fast forward 7 years, and we have hundreds of thousands of workers in over 150 countries using our platform, conducting millions of inspections every month. We’re excited to have a largely untapped global market and ambitious goals to reach 100 million workers. We’re looking for talented and mission-driven people to drive that growth.
Our Customer Support team delivers an exceptional customer experience and is continuously striving to set the bar higher and higher every day. Our Support Analysts live and breath our “Think Customer” value every day. They combine their incredible people skills with technology expertise and the result is a a market leading customer experience.
So what does this mean for you? You have the opportunity to work with seriously talented people who will continue to encourage and help you to achieve the very best. You will have the opportunity to “Be Bold, Bring Action” by delivering new insights and ideas designed to fill those gaps we have. Our Support Analysts are the bridge between our teams and SafetyCulture customers.
What will I be doing?
Responding to our customers’ concerns across chat, email, and calls based on the SLA set or even faster!
Always striving to educate our customers about the company, our product and our products’ features.
Using data analysis to evaluate the customer problem, helping you to find an accurate and long-term solution.
Walking your customers through tricky installation processes and troubleshooting.
Looking for alternative solutions that will allow you prioritise. Bring ideas on how to help your customers achieve the same outcome just without you.
Create and send technical documentation to customers and within the technology platforms that the company uses. Notes provided in all the systems should be complete, accurate and follows the quality framework.
Knowing the escalation cases (based on guidelines for escalation) that should be reassigned to the Level 2 Analysts.
Research required information using SafetyCulture prescribed and approved resources.
Confidence in your decision to close customer cases, knowing that you came to a solution both yourself and the customer is excited about.
What do I need?
Customer centric approach and dedicated to solving customer problems
Love for technology and solving technical issues
Prior experience in customer support highly desirable
Why SafetyCulture?
We’re operating at a scale few other companies are, and you’ll be doing challenging work that impacts millions every day and helps to move the world forward.
Opportunity to work with Australia's Voted 4th Best Place to Work and Global Tech Unicorn
Paid Parental Leave Program and supportive and inclusive company culture
Continuous Career Development programs.
Equity with high growth potential, and a Competitive Salary and Bonus Structure
In-house chef that cooks a delicious lunch, plus a breakfast bar and unlimited snacks
Pet-friendly office with onsite cafe and bar
Regular social events and celebrations, including the annual ShipIt global offsite
Solid onboarding program, regular training and additional development programs
We operate within a largely untapped market with endless possibilities and we are a part of a new, exciting wave of SaaS companies that focus on frontline workers
The Company
SafetyCulture is a customer and product-driven company with an ambitious mission: empower front line workers to drive operational excellence and take ownership of their safety and wellbeing. The company started in Townsville, our HQ is in Sydney, and we have offices in Kansas City, Manchester and Manila.
This is an exciting time in SafetyCulture’s history. We now have more than 300 mission-obsessed people driving outcomes for our customers. We have a strong senior leadership team with experience taking start-ups through the critical scale-up phase. We’ve raised more than $150 million in funding, which will be used to evolve the product into an alerts platform for distributed teams, and expansion into insurance, sensors and IoT, and telematics for fleets. The goal is to have 100 million people using our products every day.
To all recruitment agencies: we do not accept resumes or partnership opportunities. Please do not forward resumes to SafetyCulture or any of our employees. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
At SafetyCulture, we respect and appreciate what makes each of our team members different in terms of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation. We unite to support one another as allies and we take deliberate steps to ensure that our people feel like they belong and can thrive at work each day.

Exciting role
How will I help?
The role requires a strong analytical background with a focus on using data, research, advance visualisation and analytics to improve the risk management of the mortgage portfolio. You will research and develop risk insights on significant portfolio performance trends, regional economic drivers, housing market dynamics and customer behaviours.
As a Risk Analyst, you will develop and enhance portfolio reporting with advanced data visualisation to discover deeper portfolio insights. You will support the development, implementation and monitoring of credit policies and strategies, such as property valuation, serviceability assessment, scorecards, comprehensive credit bureau, to improve portfolio profitability and customer experience.
You will be maintaining effective partnership with key stakeholders by providing timely support in relation to credit risk, business development and portfolio management initiatives.
What is in it for me?
In a word, lots! As well as job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers) you will be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You will also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer. Importantly you will play a significant role in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years.
What do I need?
You will have tertiary qualifications in Statistics, Maths, Actuarial or Business.
You will have strong programming skills in SQL or SAS and experience with data extraction, manipulation and analysis. Having strong Excel skills with Tableau experience is preferred.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team of people who love helping others succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility- and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We have developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident, safe and healthy whether they are working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.

Are you energized by solving tough business problems, wrangling massive datasets, and exploring new analytical tools and capabilities?
As Data & Insights Analysts, we combine analytics and data science techniques to directly influence business strategy, pricing, media investments, retail, go-to-market strategy ... and much more. We use our data and boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it, and how we can grow our brands through immersive exploration and in-depth analysis. We influence the strategic decisions of management and work with multi-functional teams in Australia and around the region. We use programs and tools like PowerBI, KNIME, JMP, Python and apply techniques such as machine learning to analyse data and answer tough business questions. We're business facing and embedded in key business processes.
Does this sound interesting? Here's your opportunity! We're looking for hardworking and data-driven individuals. Join P&G as a Data & Insights Analyst and help us anticipate what consumers want to grow our business.
Your team
You will work with the Head of Analytics & Insights (A&I) for the Australia business, who is based in Sydney. You will be part of a winning team that is made up of business leaders and technical experts working on multi-million-dollar projects across the region and globe. We do this through state of the art analytics, deep understanding of the consumer, and passion for the business.
Job Responsibilities
Lead analytical projects and be accountable for delivering business value.

Lead creation and execution of analytic action plans that addresses top priority business challenges and create valuable insights.

Develop in-depth business and analytical knowledge for building relevant solutions and services - spanning retail analytics, ecommerce, media analytics and others.

Consult and coach business teams on appropriate uses of data, analytical solutions and tools.

Work in multi-functional teams to evaluate business activities.

Work with a diverse group of people within the P&G organization and the global analytics community as well as with external business partners.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Undergraduate or Masters Degree level qualifications. Preferred (but not a requirement) disciplines include: Business Analytics, Business Studies/MBA, Economics, Statistics, Engineering.

Min 2 years work experience in a business-facing role, preferably within FMCG or similar industries.

Track record of solving tough business problems, all the way from understanding a business question to communicating and actioning the solution, leveraging multiple, complex data sources in the process.

Work experience mining vast amount of data using statistical methods or machine learning models to provide actionable insights.

Advanced knowledge of analytical tools. Work experience or certification in SQL and Python or R.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills to influence others to take action

Comfortable handling multiple priorities, strong problem-solving skills and a "can do" attitude

Business background and interest and technical/analytical skills are preferred
Other qualifications:
Positive, pro-active & 'can do' attitude, willingness to learn and to work across many different areas of law.
Must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident
Flexible and proactive team player with ability to work effectively under pressure
Highly organized and works with a high attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously.
Strong communication and analytical skills.
The ability to work effectively in a global matrix organization across geographic and functional boundaries.
A strong work ethic and an exceptional business partnering focus
The ability to multi-task and manage complexity and take a solution focused approach
An energetic, outgoing, self-motivated and team-oriented approach
Good attention to detail; effective organizational and time management skills

Start your career with Amazon's Australia Retail team. Located in Sydney, Amazon Strategic Vendor Services team is looking for data driven, customer obsessed, results orientated Retail Brand Analysts to join our fast growing team.

As a Brand Analyst you will partner with our top vendors to maximize their potential on Amazon and make a major impact on our customer's experience. You will be responsible for owning the strategic planning, execution and reporting for our key strategic vendors. You will work with Vendor Managers, Category Managers, Instock, Finance, Operations, Marketing and wider Amazon teams to drive best possible outcomes for our strategic vendors and customers. You’ll lead planning and performance sessions with your strategic vendors, and act as the main point of contact for them at Amazon.

You will provide detailed analysis of business opportunities and inefficiencies; proposing changes to operational processes; driving a high standard in customer satisfaction; ensuring high-quality product pages; and making recommendations for effective growth plans.

To achieve success in this role, you will have a huge appetite for learning and the ability to pick up new skills quickly. You will also have strong analytical, relationship management and organisational skills. You'll be solution focused, identifying problem areas and then creating plans to find resolutions. You'll have strong communication skills and a proven track record of building positive working relationships.

You will have to be very comfortable delivering results in an ambiguous environment, being exceptionally detail orientated while looking around corners and thinking bigger about how we create a compelling customer offer.

You will also use a wide range of skills working across major functional areas:


Vendor management: growing selection of products available to Amazon customers, driving traffic and conversion initiatives, promotion planning, identifying and resolving vendor-related issues
In-stock management: inventory planning and sales forecasting, tracking purchase orders through to delivery, managing inventory sell-through, working with vendors on PO automation
Content management: improving product detail page content, developing and executing marketing and merchandising plans, improving customer experience onsite

Prior experience working in Retail (Buying &/or Supply Chain) and managing multiple stakeholders. Prior experience working in data & analytics (Excel, SQL, Tableau).

Job Title: Data and Reporting Analyst – AML, Financial Crime and Fraud...
Job Description:
We are looking for a Data and Reporting Analyst to join the Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention (FCFP) Data and Reporting Team. This team and role exists to provide valuable and insightful reporting to the FCFP operations teams and divisional stakeholders.
How will I help?
As a Data and Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for a wide variety of work including regular daily / weekly / monthly reporting but the majority of your time will be spent working with stakeholders to design, build and implement new reporting or enhance existing.
You will design, build and implement operational reporting, analytics and solutions that support operational excellence for the production teams. Additionally, you will assist with the development of AML and Sanctions reporting, analysis and insights to our divisional stakeholders.
You will work collaboratively with key stakeholders to drive engagement and develop strong working relationships. This includes engaging, negotiating and advising business partners to provide first-class reporting solutions and seek feedback from the business to drive and influence future developments.
Strong SQL and Visualisation/Business Intelligence skills will enable you to source, extract and present your data but it is your ability to think independently, anticipate stakeholder needs and deliver to the highest standards that will enable you to excel in this role.
What is in it for me?
In a word, lots! As well as job flexibility and the financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers) you will be paid well, and trained so your career can grow as you do. You will also be encouraged to take part in our fun community projects as a paid volunteer. Importantly you will play a significant role in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years.
What do I need?
Strong SQL DDL and/or DML skills (in Oracle and Teradata)
Ability to anticipate stakeholder needs and own the end-to-end report design and build including ad-hoc reporting, regular reporting and automation
Demonstrated ability to source, analyse and verify new data sources
Excellent analytical skills, carrying out analysis and providing useful insights to stakeholders
Strong understanding of technology and business systems strategically and operationally
Proven experience in Tableau Desktop is desirable
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Experience and knowledge across Anti Money Laundering, Counter Terrorism Finance and Economic Trade Sanctions
Financial industry and/or Operations experience
Other scheduling, reporting & data visualisation tools ie Power BI
What is it like to work there?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth, and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.
T

Job no: 537058
Work type: Full Time
Location: Homebush West
Categories: Franchisor Office

As one of Australia’s fastest growing retailers, with nearly 200 stores across Australia, we have been a part of almost every Australian’s shopping experience. Whether getting the latest electronic gadgets, or furnishing your first home, Harvey Norman is the place where you can shop with confidence.

The Opportunity

The Inventory and Planning team sits within Harvey Norman’s Technology and Entertainment division. We deliver business as usual technical functions to ensure that our merchants, suppliers and franchised stores can focus on their goal of delivering a world class retail experience to our customers.

Located in Homebush West, we are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our Inventory and Planning team as a Data and Operations Analyst. Your responsibilities will include:

Build systems and processes to effectively communicate the distribution of new products and product lines to relevant stakeholders
Coordinate and direct the supply of stock throughout our franchised stores
Assist in maintaining accurate and up-to-date information on all the moving parts of the business that relate to inventory
Assist in documenting relevant procedures and processes as they are developed
Review and report on the future impact of forecasts and potential supply issues
Ensure all required deadlines are being met by the Inventory and Planning team
Build and maintain relationships with relevant stakeholders
Manage store queries and process orders
Design and maintain various reports and visualisations
Other responsibilities as required by the business

 About you
Sound knowledge of basic retail processes such as cashiering and in-store stock management
Effective planning, problem solving and time management skills
Advanced written communication skills (i.e., grammar and spelling)
Proficient in Microsoft Office products, particularly Excel
Exceptional interpersonal skills with a focus on rapport building and listening
The ability to contribute and work effectively as part of a team
Sound knowledge of basic accounting practices and theory
Sound knowledge of basic business statistics
Experience in report visualisation software (i.e., Power BI, Tableau etc.) a plus
Minimum 1 year experience in a consumer electronics (CE) business, or a thorough understanding of the products sold in the CE market.

What’s in it for you?

Experience working with one of Australia’s leading retailers;
A positive work environment working with a supportive team
Versatile role that provides opportunity for career progression
Opportunity to network with key external stakeholders
Free staff Parking onsite or 10-minute walk from Flemington station
Access to discounted offers from Corporate partners
Generous staff discounts on Harvey Norman, Domayne and Joyce Mayne products & services

This role is an essential part of the Technology and Entertainment team. To be successful you will have thorough attention to detail, a strong work ethic and flexibility with a can-do attitude. If you meet the above requirements, and are excited at the opportunity to join the team, click !

Please note that only people with the right to work in Australia should apply for this position.

Recruitment Agencies: Harvey Norman does not accept unsolicited resumes or appreciate unsolicited calls from recruitment agencies. Please do not contact our line managers. Non-compliance will result in your company being removed from our approved supplier list or become ineligible to be considered as a supplier in the future.

Job Title: Strategic Accounts Analyst Graduate/Intern – Sydney, NSW
Job Description:
Careers that Change Lives

Be a part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems, make progress, and deliver meaningful innovations. At Medtronic you’re working within a team of talented, friendly, and highly professional individuals who strive as a team to succeed. As an organisation, we offer outstanding training and development opportunities and for this reason recently gained recognition as one of LinkedIn’s Top 25 Companies and a certified great workplace in Australia & New Zealand.

A Day in the Life

As the Strategic Accounts Analyst Graduate/Intern, you will have the responsibility and authority to work within the Commercial Analytics function of Strategic Accounts to support the Medical Surgical & Neuroscience Portfolios. In this position, you will support Medtronic’s commercial programs, by maximizing executed deals via performance tracking and analytics, preparing sales reporting and analysis, and utilizing data for preparation of content for internal and external presentations across Corporate Buying Group partnership and Strategic Accounts contracts.

This is an incredible opportunity to join the leader in medical technology. You will be mentored and given plenty of diverse and stimulating work and be making a meaningful impact to the lives of many!

Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist the Strategic Accounts Team to execute their commercial strategy by:
Extracting large amounts of raw sales data from Medtronic’s Global Sales Reporting system and manipulate using MS Excel to produce meaningful reports and insights.
Using MS excel to:
Build templates and dashboards to allow Strategic Account Managers and Corporate Accounts Managers to track contract performance and report results to measure deal effectiveness.
Model and analysing commercial deals during contract negotiations
Provide analytics and insights to assist in gaining market share.
Take responsibility for tracking and reporting of program metrics to measure success
Preparing PowerPoint presentation slides for internal and external customers, showing graphs, trends, insights and opportunities to drive business growth
Working across various departments and systems, including Finance, Customer Service and Sales Teams, to reconcile errors in sales results
Implementing continual process improvement and task standardisation to your day-to-day work
Supporting ad hoc reporting requests in a responsive manner
Participation in strategy and planning meetings
Ensure market share data is captured in the Strategic Accounts Team databases and systems for the complete, accurate and timely analysis of all business opportunities.
Maximising the impact of the data but analysing and presenting data in an easy to use way.
Update, disseminate and improve ANZ business performance reporting and analytics, including:
Therapy dashboards
Team Scorecards
Contract Analysis & KPIs
Group Contract ROI reports
6-monthly audit
Must Haves
Fresh graduate or second year student and above of a relevant Undergraduate Business or Marketing degree
Advanced of MS Office suite of software
Advanced Excel skills are a pre-requisite
Intermediate PowerPoint skills as a minimum are a pre-requisite
Demonstrated experience in devising and implementing process improvement projects
Your personal skills include:
Enthusiasm & willingness to learn
Positive attitude to change
Articulate, proactive, accountable
Reliable and a team player
Outgoing and friendly

Nice to Have
Project planning skills an advantage but not a pre-requisite
Experience with the CRM platform Salesforce.com is an advantage
Tableau, PowerBI and other data analytics programs experience is highly desirable

Your Answer

Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button!

Please apply with a CV and Cover Letter detailing why you are a suitable candidate for the role along with your interest in Medtronic. As part of this process selected candidates will be invited to a video interview process.

We Offer

In our 5th Tenet of our Mission we recognize the personal worth of employees by providing an employment framework that allows personal satisfaction in work accomplished, security, advancement opportunity, and means to share in the company's success.

Also, a competitive package is of course part of that. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to all our employees:
Flexible working environment.
Annual Incentive Plan % depending on company results.
Pension scheme and group discount on healthcare insurances
Training possibilities via Cornerstone/Harvard Manage Monitor/GetAbstract
Employee Assistance Program and Recognize! (our global recognition program)

About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations – but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Medtronic has been servicing Australia and New Zealand since 1973. We are a Best Place to Work in Australia and certified a Great Place to Work in both Australia and New Zealand. Medtronic was named by LinkedIn as a top company in Australia in 2021. We have also been recognized by the AFR on their ‘Most Innovative Companies List’ in 2019 and 2020.

Learn more about working at Medtronic: https://www.medtronic.com/au-en/about/careers.html

Help drive solutions to enable data-driven decisions aligned to People and Qantas Group strategic goals.
Use your innovative, curious mindset and drive for continuous improvement as you work with multiple stakeholders to build dashboards and help shape workforce initiatives
Full time permanent position based at our Mascot Campus.
Today, we’re busy planning for tomorrow. We look to the future to guide the way we innovate, helping us stay relevant and responsive in an always evolving industry.
The People Data and Insights Analyst is responsible for providing accurate and timely data solutions to inform and enable the business to make data - driven decisions aligned to Qantas Group and People strategic goals . This role will constantly look to deploy tools and technology to harness process, create insights and predict effectiveness of strategies using subject matter expertise in Qualtrics analytics and reporting, PowerBI and a range of other People analytics tools to design and deliver reporting solutions.
Reporting to Manager People Analytics t his role will develop , build and maintain effective relationships with internal stakeholde rs to develop knowledge and influence change through an extensive understanding of business - driven data, providing advice and solutions on key People metrics and operational indicators across the Group. This role has an employee centric mentality, is data driven, and detail orientated with an innovative and curious mindset who strives for continuous improvement whilst tasked with balancing people, policy, process and technology to create meaningful datasets, build dashboards, improve efficiencies and provide accurate insights to drive workforce initiatives .
You’ll have;
3+ years demonstrated experience in a data and insights role.
Degree in quantitative discipline or related analytical field.
Advanced statistical and data analysis skills
Experience turning large structured and unstructured raw data into actionable insights and recommendations, with a proven track record of success
Prior experience in building custom reports in Workday and proficiency with Excel , including pivots and formulae
Prior experience with BI tool s (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
Proven ability to communicate insights , provide recommendations and influence stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Self - directed with the aptitude to set priorities and work effectively in a fast paced environment in order to meet strict deadlines
High initiative, pro-active and solutions orientated.
Professional, calm and considered approach under pressure and when working to tight deadlines.
Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.
We’re committed to helping you build your career. Let’s start a conversation about making your next move.
Please note: applications will only be considered for candidates who have the right to work in Australia / New Zealand without restriction or sponsorship.
Applications close Sunday, 22nd August 2021 .

Company Name: NSW Department of Communities and Justice
Job Description:
Division: Information & Technology
Location:
Sydney, NSW, AU, 2000
Req ID: 27739
Business Analyst, Information and Technology

Temporary opportunity (up to 12 months)
Sydney location
Clerk Grade 7/8

We are hiring a Business Analyst to analyse existing systems, applications and functions within NSW Trustee and Guardian to ensure strategic ICT objectives are met.

About Us

At NSW Trustee & Guardian, we protect, promote, and support the rights, dignity, choices and wishes of our customers. Whether we’re writing a Will, acting as an executor, attorney, trustee, guardian, or financial manager, we’re here for critical moments in our customers’ lives. Join our dedicated NSW Government agency and make a difference in the lives of over 45,000 people each year.

About the role

The Business Analyst reviews and analyses the organisation’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. The role also builds and maintains key relationships with users, technical staff and stakeholders to determine and resolve issues.

The Information Technology division is driving digital innovation and the way we interact with our customers through the development of digital products, IT support, cyber security and information management services.

In the role you will:

Translate business requirements into technical specification including data models and functionality of end user apps (e.g. Business Intelligence solutions)
Identify gaps in current availability of data to delivery solution and propose recommendations to address these including new definitions, metrics, dimensions or metadata
Work with different teams to identify future data needs to deliver target state or models as per customer needs
Conduct investigative work to identify appropriate and practical solutions which meet the needs of the business, align to enterprise standards, and ensure that the team can deliver outcomes
Ensure technical specifications communicate user requirements in technical terms for submission to development teams
Interpret and translate analysis results into quality technical specifications and or user stories that are insightful, clear and succinct
Develop a deep understanding of system functionality and design as well as target state outcomes to ensure that technical specifications are aligned, feasible, sustainable and scalable

This is a temporary role in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013 for a period of up to 12 months.

What we offer

As a NSW Government organisation we offer competitive benefits and opportunities to employees including:
Base Salary $97,443 - $107,864 plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
Full-Time (35 hours per week)
Flexible and remote working arrangements considered subject to negotiation and operational requirements
Ongoing career development and support
Generous leave entitlements including flex leave
Health and wellbeing benefits including Fitness Passport
About you

You will bring excellent stakeholder engagement skills, ability to influence and quickly build relationships. A commitment to working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to influence business process improvement, support and monitor strategic delivery and promote organisational efficiency and effectiveness.

Essential requirements
Similar relevant experience in a business analyst role
Understanding of NSW government and NSWTG’s key services and client base.

For detailed information on the key accountabilities and capability framework please

Applying for the role

Only applications submitted online will be accepted for this role. To apply please click the ‘Apply Now’ button located on this page.

When applying you will need to:

Supply an updated copy of their resume (maximum 5 pages) and a brief cover letter (maximum 2 pages) that outlines your skills and experience relevant to the role and its capabilities.
Answer all pre-screening questions on the application form and provide answers to following targeted questions below:

Targeted question 1: Outline your experience gathering user requirements for ICT projects.
Targeted question 2: Describe your experience working with programmers, to develop solutions that align to technical requirements.

The above will be used to shortlist applicants for interview. For further information about how to address targeted questions please visit:
https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/writing-your-job-application#answer-targeted-questions

Contact: Jamien Broder, Senior Manager Development and Digital Products, by email on jamien.broder@tag.nsw.gov.au or by phone on 0419 804 913.

Closing Date: Friday, August 27th 2021 at 11:59 pm

For any recruitment enquiries please email: linda.tummarello@tag.nsw.gov.au.

Appointments are subject to reference checks and may also require the following checks/clearances:
National Criminal History Record Check in accordance with the Disability Inclusion Act 2014

By doing so, we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place.

Great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to make a meaningful impact in a Royal Commission. The findings and recommendations of this report will create a lasting impact on the lives of Australians and will be highly progressive in achieving social justice. This is an Identified position and we would love to hear from Aboriginal/ Torres Strait Islanders or candidates who have strong experience working with First Nations’ people.

The role:

Provide timely, rigorous and accurate analysis of data, including large unit record datasets, in a form that is easily and quickly understood by its target audience
Build partnerships and collaborate with policy and legal teams across the Commission, to translate quantitative and qualitative data into a format and narrative that supports evidence-based policy
Report on publicly available data and data obtained via notice
In consultation with policy and legal teams, develop data-related content for hearings, issues papers, other external Commission documents and the final report
Demonstrate agility and resilience in response to changing demands. a high workload and tight timeframes
Contribute personal expertise to projects across the Commission – for example, expertise may include in the areas of aged care delivery, policy developed, legal, economics, data, health, management, workforce and medical
Undertake data and metadata acquisition, security, governance, curation, access, dissemination and interpretation
Duties:

Significant experience in data management and analysis to support business functions and policy outcomes.
Previous experience working with data/statistical software such as SAS and Excel to analyse large administrative and survey datasets.
Strong strategic thinking and communication skills
The ability to uphold and model the APS Values, Code of Conduct, Employment Principles and AGD Performance Expectations.

Please note this role is with a Federal Government client and applicants require Australian Citizenship.

To register your interest, please submit your CV in MS Word format by hitting APPLY NOW or call Nicole on 0400 666 053 with any queries.

Join an award-winning transport and tourism company
Transit Systems is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with strong analytical, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills with a robust financial background.
Looking for an exciting new work environment?
We encourage you to apply!
About Us
Transit Systems is Australia's largest private operator of metropolitan public bus services, completing more than 285 million customer journeys per year. Transit Systems has built a reputation for its ability to collaborate with Government and improve public transport solutions for customers.
Transit Systems is a subsidiary of Sea Link Travel Group, Australia's largest tourism and marine transport company. Carrying more than 285 million passengers a year in different locations around the world, our Group has over 8,840 employees operating more than 3,500 buses and 114 ferries in New South Wales, Victoria, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, the Northern Territory, Western Australia, London and Singapore.
For more information about Transit Systems, please visit our website. http://www.transitsystems.com.au
About the Role
Reporting to the General Manager Fleet, Innovation & Business Intelligence, you will be responsible for driving business improvement and enabling key decision makers by developing, maintaining & presenting accurate financial business intelligence models and reports to both internal & external stakeholders.
You will also be required to work collaboratively with our Business Development team in preparing bids, financial reviews and other due diligence for new business opportunities.
About You
The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:
A strong understanding of financial modelling that enables senior executives to make data-based decisions.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work with others to find solutions that deliver improved business outcomes.
High-level reporting and presentation skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Sound knowledge of corporate finance and financial reporting.
Experience in preparing financial models for tender bids.
Ability to work effectively to deadlines and support others to meet tight deadlines.
Track record working in small, fast paced project teams.
Performing cost-benefit analysis on BAU and other projects aimed to optimise the performance of the organisation
Collaborating with management and co-workers to drive improvements
Assessing the efficacy of adopted strategies
Consulting with relevant stakeholders and management to map strategic goals and pathways to ensure success
Conducting interactive presentations and preparing reports for effective communication of data and intelligence to a diverse audience
Qualifications
You will hold a relevant tertiary qualification in finance, business, data science, or equivalent.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role with tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline
Advanced Tableau, PowerBI skills or a similar business intelligence tool
Intermediate SQL skills including SQL Server Reporting Services
Advanced Excel skills
CPA/CA/CFA qualification will be advantageous
Experience in the Bus Industry will also be advantageous
To be considered, you must be entitled to work in Australia and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.
We are requesting your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the best person for this position.
Please fill in as much information as you can in track record section of the application and pay close attention to the questions.
Applications close on 3 September 2021
SeaLink Travel Group is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
Job Description Summary: Delivering on the regulatory requirements for PayPal Australia Pty Ltd, this position is responsible for supporting and providing analytics across the second line oversight of the Risk and Compliance Management Program in Australia, driving a data-driven approach that meets both the PayPal global framework and all local regulatory requirements.
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Supporting business partners in the development of controls for reviewing new products and features and other business initiatives.
Assist in conducting assessments of applicability and impact of new and/or changes to Austalian regulations and regulatory guidance.
Support the business in the implementation of regulatory change management initiatives.
Provide support for local regulatory interactions, examinations and adhoc requests.
Assist in execution of risk assessments and provide effective challenge to the first line of defence.
Provide ongoing support of issue management and remediation efforts.
Assist with the development of policies, procedures and/or guidelines.

Job Title: Media Research Analyst, Strategic Communications, Sydney
Job Description:
About the Role


We're looking for an enthusiastic self-starter to join our team to provide media analysis and research reports to our clients and internal teams.


As a Media Research Analyst, you'll be responsible for compiling daily media coverage reports and for other research tasks as required. The internal title will be As Needed Research Analyst.


You'll be joining a leading Strategic Communications team working with high-profile clients from many different industries. We provide our clients with a suite of services, including financial communications, corporate reputation, transaction communications, and public affairs in all the major markets around the world.


We've advised Boards and governing councils of industry representatives and not for profit organisations on strategies to strengthen and improve their communications capabilities and have acted as trusted advisors to high profile business and community leaders at critical times in their careers.


What You'll Do


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Media monitoring and identifying trends in the media
Creating and curating media lists
Conducting research and creating report papers
Demonstrates a high level of integrity and asks the necessary questions to manage firm and client data responsibly.
Understands FTI's values, Code of Ethics and the Strategic Communications Rules of Practice and demonstrates a strong commitment to applying these concepts in daily interactions with colleagues and clients. (Additional information about FTI's values, Code of Ethics and the Strategic Communications Rules of Practice can be accessed here .)


Qualifications & Experience


This is a casual position - approximately three hours each weekday, with an early start - and may suit a final year University student or someone looking for flexibility in their career.


We want to hear from candidates who are motivated to learn and are not afraid to ask questions. To be successful, you'll need:


A strong interest in news and current affairs
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment to tight deadlines
An eye for detail, backed by solid research and analytical skills
Efficient communication skills, verbally or in writing
A strong work ethic and an ability to be a self-starter

Our Benefits


Apart from the well-structured career path and collaborative team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:

Attractive remuneration
Medical insurance program (corporate membership) for individual and dependent(s)
Employee Assistance Program ("EAP") - free to all employees and their immediate families


About FTI Consulting


What makes us unique? With more than 6,250 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.


FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognised as a Best Firm to Work For by C onsulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes . For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com .


FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.


#LI-MŚ1

Unit Pricing Analyst


Great team environment
Invaluable on the job learning supported by skilled professionals
Opportunity to lead initiatives


About the Division


The Unit Pricing Team resides in the Investment Control function and plays a strategic role in enabling the execution of product, investment and client initiatives on behalf of the NM Super - Super Directions Fund. The team is a key control function and enabler for the Product and Investment Divisions and has responsibility across the breadth of investment operations activities including Unit Pricing, Transition Management, Vendor Management and Governance and Oversight.


About the Role


Reporting to the Unit Pricing Manager, the purpose of this role is to provide support to the end to end investment management process including unit pricing and leading organisational initiatives involving Investment Control.


This will entail performing a series of checks on the unit prices, which are calculated by BNP. The role also provides a key support function for projects and transitions within AMP by providing technical subject matter expertise on investment management processes. In addition, the role will incorporate a focus on key enterprise projects and transitions, continuous improvement initiatives, exploring and implementing efficiency gains and enhancing the member experience.


The successful candidate will need to demonstrate an aptitude for clear, logical thinking and excellent numerical, reconciliation and analytical skills. They will have strong technical unit pricing expertise and have the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.


More specifically your responsibilities will be:

Reviewing the accuracy of unit prices provided by BNP
Verifying reasonableness of product cash flows processed by AMP each day
Understanding of tax, fees, spreads, benchmarks and other standing data that could potentially impact unit prices
Data interpretation and analysis
Reporting and analysis for other functions within AMP on a timely basis
Process and control design/improvement and implementation
Providing technical unit pricing expertise to support AMP projects and transitions


What we look for in you:

Degree - Accounting/ Commerce/ Finance
Financial Services industry experience (ideally 7+ years)
Superannuation fund or Investment Management operations end-to-end experience (ideally 7+ years)
Custodian experience (either working at or with a back office outsource provider)
Advanced Excel


To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate an aptitude for clear, logical thinking and excellent numerical, reconciliation and analytical skills. You will be an excellent communicator with the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders. You will have strong technical unit pricing expertise and will be proactive and enjoy leading and delivering initiatives that add value to the business.


You will be a team player and take pride in the quality of your work and are able to deliver within tight timeframes and with competing priorities.


Wellbeing & Benefits

As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.


Inclusion & Diversity

AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.


Message to recruitment agencies and search firms

AMP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any AMP employee, location or address. AMP is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Title: Market Intelligence Analyst | Motor Industry Services | Sydn...
Job Description:
Are you energized by solving tough business problems, wrangling massive datasets, and exploring new analytical tools and capabilities?
As Data & Insights Analysts, we combine analytics and data science techniques to directly influence business strategy, pricing, media investments, retail, go-to-market strategy ... and much more. We use our data and boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it, and how we can grow our brands through immersive exploration and in-depth analysis. We influence the strategic decisions of management and work with multi-functional teams in Australia and around the region. We use programs and tools like PowerBI, KNIME, JMP, Python and apply techniques such as machine learning to analyse data and answer tough business questions. We're business facing and embedded in key business processes.
Does this sound interesting? Here's your opportunity! We're looking for hardworking and data-driven individuals. Join P&G as a Data & Insights Analyst and help us anticipate what consumers want to grow our business.
Your team
You will work with the Head of Analytics & Insights (A&I) for the Australia business, who is based in Sydney. You will be part of a winning team that is made up of business leaders and technical experts working on multi-million-dollar projects across the region and globe. We do this through state of the art analytics, deep understanding of the consumer, and passion for the business.
Job Responsibilities
Lead analytical projects and be accountable for delivering business value.

Lead creation and execution of analytic action plans that addresses top priority business challenges and create valuable insights.

Develop in-depth business and analytical knowledge for building relevant solutions and services - spanning retail analytics, ecommerce, media analytics and others.

Consult and coach business teams on appropriate uses of data, analytical solutions and tools.

Work in multi-functional teams to evaluate business activities.

Work with a diverse group of people within the P&G organization and the global analytics community as well as with external business partners.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Undergraduate or Masters Degree level qualifications. Preferred (but not a requirement) disciplines include: Business Analytics, Business Studies/MBA, Economics, Statistics, Engineering.

Min 2 years work experience in a business-facing role, preferably within FMCG or similar industries.

Track record of solving tough business problems, all the way from understanding a business question to communicating and actioning the solution, leveraging multiple, complex data sources in the process.

Work experience mining vast amount of data using statistical methods or machine learning models to provide actionable insights.

Advanced knowledge of analytical tools. Work experience or certification in SQL and Python or R.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills to influence others to take action

Comfortable handling multiple priorities, strong problem-solving skills and a "can do" attitude

Business background and interest and technical/analytical skills are preferred
