You’ll be part of a dedicated project team, partnering with stakeholders across Transport for NSW. Your expertise will be in high demand and you’ll be well positioned to provide professional advice for other transformation programs.

You are energetic, adaptive and comfortable working within the variability that can be associated with Enterprise Agreement bargaining in a complex environment. You are highly inquisitive and a keen problem solver who is excited to challenge the status quo and look at things differently.

Job Title: Financial Services Technology Consulting, Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!
The opportunity
We are growing our Data & Analytics team in FSO and now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for people to join our diverse team who are passionate about technology & data with financial services experience. If you are a Consultant at the start of your career through to Director looking for your next role across the whole breadth and depth of Data & Analytics from next generation solution architecture, large scale data and technology delivery through to data risk, controls and governance, we would love to talk you. These opportunities are in Sydney and Melbourne.
You could be:
Working on a team to help our clients to find solutions to their most complex business challenges
Using your energy, enthusiasm and storytelling skills to convey the big idea to our client and our leadership while not forgetting the important details
Use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to design and develop cutting edge Data & Analytics solutions
Designing, building and implementing some of the largest data and cloud solutions in the market
Collaborating with your team and clients to develop the data & analytics strategy of tomorrow, today
Cross Pollinating with other EY competencies and teams such as business domain SMEs, technology teams including Cyber, Digital and Emerging tech to deliver large scale client transformations
Helping us grow a DnA FSO that is inclusive and diverse and that builds a better working world for our people
We are looking for team members to join us who are interested in any of the roles below:
Data Engineering and Development
Data Architects
Cloud Architects
Data Modellers
Data Regulatory & Controls Experts
Data Governance
Data Operations & Data Management
Technical Business Analysis & Data Analysis
Skills and attributes for success
Passionate about solving big complex problems using data and technology
Working with diverse and inclusive teams of talented people solving client issues
Financial Services experience (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level)
We would love to talk to you if you want to hear more about a career in consulting or are considering a move back after taking a break from consulting or your career.
What we offer
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.
We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).
We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary for Consultant is $90,000 including 10.0% superannuation.
EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytics and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we have also challenged ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Client Implementation team?
Our people are important to us and we are devoted in ensuring that lives outside of work are supported and a successful work-life balance is achieved. We offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program.
Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
What you’ll do:
The Client Implementation Analyst will provide end to end support and guidance for onboarding of small to medium clients to specific products and services offered by Equifax. In this role you will also provide technical and business support to Equifax’s API channel, support the Sales and Product teams with customer inquiries/issues across various platforms and take part in training on new platforms and transformation journeys from existing API to a new API.
What are we looking for?
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Excellent communications both written and verbal
Strong background in troubleshooting – experience around REST API and familiarity with Cloud concepts
Basic knowledge of XML, JSON, REST Services
Proven ability in working in a fast-paced environment where priorities are changing
Extra points for any of the following:
Experience working within Financial Services
Business Analysis and/or Project Management related qualifications
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Confident
Curious
Team player
Trustworthy
Positive
Dedicated
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

An extra week of annual leave after your first year as part of our Fifth Week program, and the opportunity to purchase annual leave to help you recharge

At Metcash, we’re the power behind an independent Australia. For almost 100 years we’ve been proudly supporting local, family-owned businesses – sticking up for the little guys and helping them become the best stores in town. Today we’re Australia and New Zealand’s leading independent retail partner and wholesaler in the food, liquor and hardware sectors. And while we may be large, we’ll always be locals at heart.

So, roll up your sleeves and bring your best self to work, and we’ll give you the support you need to develop a rewarding career and make your mark on the future of retail.

Make your Mark!

Are you a natural influencer and have a knack for analysis? We’re looking for someone to join the best Pricing team in media. You will be highly analytical and able to work with data sets to provide key insights to the business. You will be accountable for providing pricing guidance, developing customer solutions, and providing approvals to sales teams.
The Role

Supportive and friendly environment. We encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. Fun, fast-paced and excellent opportunities for growth and development.
Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation
On-site gym and wellbeing centre
Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward
Employee discount with multiple brands including Audi, Qantas, Apple, Samsung etc
Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands
Who are we?
We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.

Job Title: Machine Learning Data Engineer: Advance Analytics
Job Description:
At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.
Do your life’s best work!
As the CRM Junior Data Analyst, you will join our global project team to help deliver high quality data into our Salesforce Platform. In this role, you will work closely with our CRM Business Analyst to analyse, cleanse, and improve data flowing into the CRM. This will be a 3 months full time or part time contract role with the view to be extended.
Over the course of this role, you will get exposure to Salesforce Health Cloud and begin and grow your knowledge of Salesforce and it’s reporting capabilities. We are looking for an energetic, self-motivated and proactive individual who thrives working in a fast paced, dynamic organisation and build strong positive relationships across stakeholder groups.
What you’ll do:
Manage data including creation, updating and deletion of records in CRM
Assist in designing and carrying out of data cleansing initiatives to drive alignment to our data principles and standards
Undertake data verification and processing tasks
Collaborate with the Referrer Engagement and Marketing teams to understand their data requirements to drive performance and analyse accessible data
Build meaningful reports in Salesforce to support business operations and decision making
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal key stakeholders, working to resolve data issues and queries in a timely manner
Identify and highlight areas for opportunities and data improvements
Produce key process and system documentation
Assist in the development of training documentation
Who you are:
Bachelor’s degree in IT or relevant industry
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel
Ability to manage with a large volume of data set
Critical and strategic thinking skills
Exposure to CRM Platforms (Salesforce beneficial)
Ability to work fast moving agile teams and able to prioritize competing requests
Excellent communication, attention to detail and organisation skills
What’s in it for you:
To be part of the exciting digital transformation journey in healthcare and make a difference in our patients’ clinical and emotional needs
Own your career development with dynamic opportunities
Learn everyday in a rapidly growing global healthcare company
To collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders in cross functional delivery squads
Work/life balance with full time or part time ( option
Who we are:
We are 5500+ highly trained healthcare professionals and support staff across Australia, the U.K., Spain, China and the United States, designing innovative treatments and care for people with cancer, heart and sleep disease.
Global care
Across the world, we have more than 440+ centres to help us bring the right care to our patients. For radiation therapy, that includes 14 centres in the UK, 21 in Spain, 36 in Australia and 300 in the U.S. We also offer cardiology and sleep services at more than 80 locations across Australia. Every year our team sees more than 400,000 people globally.
People centricity is at the heart of what we do—whether that person is a patient, a referring doctor, a partner or someone in our team. We aim to build culture of ‘care’ that is patient focused and performance driven. Our people promise is “do your life’s best work, by always growing, having a profound human impact and making great things happen together.” If you’d like to make a difference, join us at GenesisCare.
GenesisCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Deliver on our Premiers priority for digital transformation and be part of a high-profile digital program


Ongoing full-time role - Clerk Grade 7/8
Salary package up to $121070/annum
Sydney – CBD location ( remote working across NSW)
The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a service provider and regulator, focusing on delivering first-class customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform to create better outcomes for the people of NSW.

DCS has proudly introduced many innovations in service delivery and is continuing to adopt contemporary tools, techniques, and systems to improve customer outcomes and operational efficiency.
DCS is currently undertaking an ambitious digital transformation of government services, underpinned by the Digital Government Strategy.
We support flexible working practices with staff working remotely during this time.
About the Project:
The Licensing Program is key to DCS’ vision to be the world’s most customer centric government. It is our aim to engage through delivering smarter, user orientated digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.
The Licensing Program delivered by the NSW Department of Customer Service (DCS) is one of eight Lighthouse Programs, with a vision “To be the world’s easiest regulator to engage with through delivering smarter, customer centric digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.” To achieve that, about 130 existing licence ‘schemes’ will be digitised. This will be achieved by moving away the existing Siebel system into a new state of art licensing platform “Amanda”. As part of this transition all license information will be migrated from the existing Siebel system into the new Amanda system in a phased and agile delivery approach.

The existing Siebel system is a on on-prem solution, with and underlying database in MS SQL Server. Due to the complexity of the data and the scope of the project, additional source systems with varying source types are likely required to be included as part of the data migration execution. The target system Amanda is deployed on Microsoft Azure cloud with its underlying database as MS SQL Server.
DCS is looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the recently established data migration team and be part of the exciting and challenging journey ahead.
Responsibilities:
Engage with Business users, application development team, and current systems teams in defining data quality requirements.
Understand the source and target systems from data quality requirements perspective and Identify the data quality rules.
Develop the data quality profiling code/scripts using SQL’s, stored procedures, Data Quality Services (DQS), Talend DQ.
Execute the DQ scripts to identify and analyse data issues
Create Data quality assessment reports and dashboards.Drive data working group meetings to prioritize and remediate data quality issues.
Devise and implement data enrichment and remediation solutions.
Develop and execute data quality scripts as a readiness check for trial migrations, dress rehearsal and production migration to pre-empt issues during migration.
Develop and implement data reconciliation.
Providing ad-hoc support to ensure that best practice is followed.
Measuring and reporting to management on the progress of data quality improvement.
Developing good relationships with users across the product teams and interacting with them to resolve any data quality issues.
Requirements:
Ability to review, analyse and manage large volumes of data.
Expert knowledge in writing SQL code and queries is required.
Expert knowledge in Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel is required.
Expert knowledge in tools like DQS, Talend DQ is preferred.
Should be able to generate graphs and produce presentations of professional standards.
Outstanding attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
Experience in data quality in data migration projects is preferred
Knowledge of Siebel would be beneficial but not essential.
Experience in regulatory licensing domain would be considered an advantage.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at $99,431.00 base plus superannuation
Closing Date: Thursday 2nd SEP 2021 [09:59am]
Working with Department of Customer Service
Our Commitment to Diversity & Flexibility
We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and new ways of working

The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, carers, refugees, people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.

We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done, and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.

If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify us on your application form.

Work in a high performing team as an expert in Ampol supply chains
Flexible workplace options, new office in Alexandria (Sept 2021)

About the role:
We currently have an opening for a Supply Chain Analyst, who will help identify and analyse improvement opportunities across the Fuels and Infrastructure business.
This is a highly visible role within the Fuels Pricing and Optimisation team and supports a range of supply chain projects such as: infrastructure investments, analysis of shipping import capabilities, terminal and tankage optimisation, analysis of costs and capabilities to support sales tenders, and/or other strategic projects.

Key objectives:
Engaging broadly with stakeholders across the F&I Business to identify and/or assess opportunities for analysis to support business decision making
Framing and conducting key analysis to answer critical questions, test the impact of proposed initiatives, and understand key scenarios or risks
Building and leveraging expertise in Ampol supply chains, including an understanding of operational factors, business processes, and competitors’ capabilities
Thinking commercially across the supply chain to identify the best financial outcomes for the total business
Engaging with our data science team and/or data experts to identify new ways of solving problems through data analytics
Communicating and engaging with different audiences and experts regarding complex analytical projects
Demonstrating your ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and drive strong business outcomes

About you:
Tertiary qualification in Engineering, Business, Finance or a related discipline, supported by direct exposure within bulk commodities, import supply chains, and/or fuels. Applicants with indirect but relevant experience through consulting will also be considered.
Your developed knowledge (4yrs+) includes a strong foundation in business problem solving, an understanding of business processes and core analytical skills.

About the NSW RFS
For over 100 years, the NSW Rural Fire Service (RFS) has been a vital part of the community, working hard to protect life, property and the environment from bush fires. We are the world’s largest volunteer firefighting service, with over 76,000 members, proudly built on a strong tradition of service, trust, resilience, respect, and teamwork.

To hear more about the RFS and our values:

About the role
The Data Analyst role provides technical expertise and capability in the design, management and maintenance of health and safety data assets and management systems. The role supports initiatives of the NSW RFS, following the objectives of the ICT strategy and best practices within industry.

We are looking for a person who enjoys interrogating data and developing online solutions for our geographically dispersed membership. You enjoy working with people and understanding business processes and developing IT and business solutions.
The Safety Business Unit is situated within the Health and Safety Directorate, which also includes two other business units; Mental Health Services, and Health & Wellbeing.

The Safety Team is a small team of 7 staff, including a Manager, Supervisor, Senior Advisors and a Safety Data Analyst.

The key functions of the Safety Business Unit include:
Safety culture that is supported by effective systems and practices that are compliant with WHS obligations and requirements.
Regulatory safety functions.
Advice and guidance for health & safety concerns.
Management of safety incidents, hazards and investigations.
Oversight of corrective actions and compliance.
Safety reports and analysis of trends.

You must meet the following essential requirements
A Certificate IV in a relevant discipline, or equivalent expertise.
Ability to perform accurate and high volume data entry when required.
Current drivers licence, ability and willingness to travel.
During periods of major fire activity, the incumbent may be required to support operational management activities consistent with their skills and background.

We offer
Flexible work practices
Attractive salary, superannuation and leave entitlements
Great team environment and collaborative workforce
Learning and development opportunities
Working for a highly regarded emergency service
A location close to Sydney Olympic Park Train Station and transport services.

For further information, please review the role description or contact David Heslop on 02 8741 5218.

Applications Close: 11:59pm, Sunday 5 September 2021.

Applying for the role
To apply for this role, you will need to submit an online application via http://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/, which includes responding to the targeted questions and essential requirements, and attaching the following PDFs:
A cover letter (maximum one A4 page)
A resume which clearly details skills, experience and capabilities required for this role as per the role description. This should include two referees, one of which is a current or recent supervisor, and their contact details. (maximum 5 pages)

Other Information
Prior to applying for this role candidates should download the Role Description. Candidates must demonstrate in their application how they meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements.
The NSW Rural Fire Service is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community we serve. We welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.
Relevant criminal history, referee checks and prior employment checks will be conducted on recommended applicants.
A recruitment (talent) pool may be created through this recruitment process. A recruitment (talent) pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role or similar roles, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary or ongoing roles, over the next 18 months.

Key Application Responses

Targeted Questions:

2. Describe a time when you developed reports from a dataset to articulate trends and areas for improvement in an organisation. What reports did you produce and how did they improve business outcomes. (500 words maximum)

Portfolio Analyst
The Risk Management BU is responsible for developing and deploying the risk policies, processes, and frameworks that allow the Group to take conscious exposures decisions to credit, market, operational, and insurance risks within both the Group’s Board-approved appetite, our regulatory commitments, and the expectations of the community in which we operate.
Enterprise Risk forms part of the Risk Management Support Unit, supporting the Group Chief Risk Officer to deliver against Risk Management’s strategic priorities in the most effective way.
To best support this delivery, Enterprise Risk is made up of several core functions, Strategy & Governance, Capability Change & Communications, Transparency & Visualisation, and the Risk Strategic Portfolio.
Y our Impact
As a Portfolio Analyst in the Risk Strategic Portfolio you would be involved in the governance and reporting of the Risk project portfolio, providing timely insights and analytics to help inform senior leaders, and shape the project portfolio going forward.
You will work closely with various internal stakeholders to gather information and analyse project performance, identify opportunities for improvements or enhancements, as well as recommend solutions that enable Risk Management and the Group to achieve its goals.
Reporting into the Executive Manager Risk Prioritisation - Risk Strategic Portfolio, your immediate responsibilities will align to the delivery of the highest priority Risk initiatives under way across the Group.
Your Responsibilities
Track and analyse Group Risk’s investment portfolio by reporting on performance against agreed KPIs, key risks, variances, and trends
Provide accurate, timely and transparent project analysis data and reports to senior leadership and business stakeholders
Develop and deliver meaningful insights to drive better business outcomes across the Group Risk investment portfolio
Work with key business stakeholders, building rapport in order to deliver responsibilities in an effective and timely manner
Contribute to the development and ongoing enhancements of relevant frameworks; processes, reporting suite, and SoPs required to manage the Group risk investment portfolio
Provide subject matter expertise to support business partner’s and bespoke requests for the Group risk investment portfolio
Risk Mindset –All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks
Advanced written communication skills with excellent attention to detail
Strong organisational and time management skills with ability to act with high levels of autonomy
3 + years financial services or risk management experience desirable, but not essential
A tertiary degree in a relevant field, such as business, finance, statistics, math, law, science, technology
Your skills and Experience
Proven data analytics skills
SQL - able to build sophisticated tables & queries from scratch
Experience with statistics, Python, and/or R preferred
Sophisticated in Excel / Google Sheets
Ability to map out processes and automate.
If this sounds like you, apply now!

Join an Iconic Australian Brand
Multi-layered role in our eCommerce business
Surry Hills based with WFH Flexibility
If you’re driven by a customer mission and passionate about being part of a tribe of great people, join us at WooliesX.
Our story

As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.
Having been awarded the Canstar Blue Award for No.1 in Customer Satisfaction for online groceries, and more recently being voted the most popular Loyalty Program in Australia, we’re proud of the work we do and are being recognised for delivering innovative and best in class service that is convenient, frictionless and personalised to our customers.
With an industry leading technology team, backed by analytics, we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online. We are currently expanding our agile capability, across the whole of WooliesX.

What we are looking for:
The role of the Commercial Analyst within the B2C Tribe is to measure, track, and optimise performance of merchandising & trade activities across our multifaceted eCommerce business. Partnering with teams within the Commercial Practice, you will be delivering data-driven insights related to sales & profit, range, and pricing & promotions within our core Customer Value Propositions (CVPs).
What you’ll do:
Provide insights to inform strategic decision making by analysing various commercial lenses in both digital and offline platforms
Build reports and customised data models/dashboards to track & evaluate performance of commercial activities such campaigns & promotions, proof of concepts (POC), and more
Work across multiple systems in content management, financial reporting, & BI
Collaborate with BI team on dashboard requirements, use cases, and designs
Support data & insights requests relating to category management, product availability, and digital trade planning
Being embedded within our Connected Interfaces squads and ensuring they keep analytics at the forefront of their thinking - from utilising the insights provided to ensuring anything that is developed can be tested
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
Be an advocate of analytics and collaborate within the Analytics & Insights Chapter to promote knowledge sharing

Role Summary:

We are currently seeking an experienced and professional Network Insights & Strategy Analyst on a permanent basis. Reporting to the Network Strategy Manager, your primary responsibility will be to provide strategic and economic assessment on potential opportunities / risk and development of solutions to be implemented for the online delivery and collection network. You will act as a key liaison across all related operational, logistics and development functions.
This is in conjunction with working with operational teams to deliver a cost effective solution, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and wider Woolworths team.
As part of this role, the Network Insights & Strategy Analyst will be responsible for:
Strategy Development
Support the long term development of an efficient, robust and competitive network by leveraging experience and industry knowledge to run a number of To-Be scenarios options and evaluate the impact in terms of capacity, cost and service
Engagement with the relevant stakeholders to ensure the required information and stakeholder expectations are captured accordingly
Development of terms of reference, activity plan and concept evaluation storyboards for the required pieces of work
Network Insights Development
Development of documentation that supports the overall network strategy such as the exit and timing of facilities, extensions to existing facilities and changes to either throughput or capabilities across the network
Data analysis and ad hoc reports that provide operations support and strategy decisions across the organization
Network Content and Team Development
Support the development of a strategic capacity insights tool to provide timely, accurate and up to date capacity information across all facilities in the Woolworths eCommerce logistics network
Embed the capacity insights tool within the business having outlined a clear process for maintaining the tool as well as providing capacity insights to be used to inform the overall network strategy
Engaging with the relevant stakeholders to collect the required information and ensure the tool is up to date and providing value within eCommerce Operations

Network Innovation and other
Where applicable, the Network Analyst is responsible for developing and implementing innovative solutions that provide a competitive advantage for Woolworths eCommerce operations
Identifying opportunities to leverage innovation supporting cost efficiency solutions and customer experience enhancement
Lead projects complex problem solving
Develop robust but flexible analysis models using MS Excel and SQL
Skills required:
At least 3-4 years of logistics network analytics/supply chain/retail/eCommerce experience
An excellent understanding of retail and logistics fundamentals
Ability to work autonomously to deliver pieces of work
Ability To structure of work and manage multiple parties through the duration of engagements
Exceptional analytical skills – proficient in Excel and SQL
Ability to develop analysis and recommendation storyboards
Advanced communications & presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders and all levels

At Deputy we’re on a mission to change the way the world works & we are looking for fantastic people to help us do that. Our mission is to simplify shift work, with a future state vision to enable thriving workplaces in every community.
Deputy is a SaaS Workforce Management Product company. HQ'd in Sydney (AU), with offices in Melbourne, London (UK), Atlanta and San Francisco (USA). We’ve helped hundreds of thousands of people across all industries in 70+ countries save time and money managing their hourly workforce so they can focus on what they do best, and be amazing.
Currently, our employees are predominately working from home and this role will also be remote for the time being. We anticipate employees will be returning to the office, in a flexible capacity, during 2021 as appropriate & when it is safe to do so.
YOUR MISSION
Deputy generates billions of data points on how shift-work businesses run, and how Deputy itself runs, and we need your help turning those into insights that can help our customers simplify shift work.
Deputy’s Data & Analytics team works with nearly all parts of the business to help the company better understand our customers and make data-driven decisions. You will get exposure to teams as diverse as product, marketing, growth, operations, and more, supporting them in making better, more data driven decisions.
You will get exposure to commercial business decisions, data engineering, analytics and data science, and presentation.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Auditing and restructuring of outdated data reports and building effective, scalable for growth versions of essential reporting capabilities in Finance and Operations departments
Analyst on the Data & Analytics team with exposure to a variety of problems and challenges across the business
Deputy has millions of data points on how shift-work businesses run and we need your help in turning those into insights that can help our client business run and grow effectively
Help design, build and maintain reporting of the business’s performance and monitor trends in key business KPIs, providing valuable insights to relevant departments aiding business performance improvement
Work with key internal and external stakeholders as well as departmental leaders and executives fostering a relationship of trust and playing an advisory role in the use of data to improve performance and product strategy formulation
Work on large technical projects such as our overhaul of marketing automation and attribution
Perform data analysis to support our business strategy, creating insightful reports around product usage, marketing performance and other critical activities, uncovering insights/trends in user behaviour and product feature usage across all web and app platforms
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
3-4 years experience in a Data Analytics or similar technical role
Finance experience (FP&A, Audit, or Commerce) is A MUST
Strong experience working with finance teams on data reporting - A MUST
Logical thinker with business acumen - think commercially and execute technically
Strong knowledge/mastery of SQL (we use Snowflake)
Experience with BI data viz platforms like Tableau, Chartio or similar, and possibly more customised data viz through Python or R
Programming: working knowledge of Python, Scala, Java, or similar general purpose language. You will be using Python a bit. Knowledge of statistics & ML concepts also a plus
Very strong investigative and problem-solving skills, with an ability to marry together different data sets and make reasonable assumptions to get to a conclusion
Strong communicator who can turn data into actionable insight
Team Player - results-driven individual, highly creative and analytical, a strategic thinker, having an ability to work comfortably in a collaborative setting, highly organised, and an ability to work on multiple simultaneous projects and meet deadlines
WHY JOIN?
- Australian Hyper-Growth Startup - Head Office in SydneyWhy IVP Invested in DeputyDeloitte's #21 Fastest Growing Technology Startups in Aus 2018Raised $111M Series B Round led by IVP, OpenView (our Series A investor), Square Peg Capital and EVP.

We are 5500+ highly trained healthcare professionals and support staff across Australia, the U.K., Spain, China and the United States, designing innovative treatments and care for people with cancer, heart and sleep disease.

Deliver on our Premiers priority for digital transformation and be part of a high-profile digital program


Ongoing full-time role - Clerk Grade 7/8
Salary package up to $121070/annum
Sydney – CBD location ( remote working across NSW)
The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a service provider and regulator, focusing on delivering first-class customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform to create better outcomes for the people of NSW.

DCS has proudly introduced many innovations in service delivery and is continuing to adopt contemporary tools, techniques, and systems to improve customer outcomes and operational efficiency.
DCS is currently undertaking an ambitious digital transformation of government services, underpinned by the Digital Government Strategy.
We support flexible working practices with staff working remotely during this time.
About the Project:
The Licensing Program is key to DCS’ vision to be the world’s most customer centric government. It is our aim to engage through delivering smarter, user orientated digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.
The Licensing Program delivered by the NSW Department of Customer Service (DCS) is one of eight Lighthouse Programs, with a vision “To be the world’s easiest regulator to engage with through delivering smarter, customer centric digital solutions, reducing red tape, enhancing business productivity and protecting NSW communities.” To achieve that, about 130 existing licence ‘schemes’ will be digitised. This will be achieved by moving away the existing Siebel system into a new state of art licensing platform “Amanda”. As part of this transition all license information will be migrated from the existing Siebel system into the new Amanda system in a phased and agile delivery approach.

The existing Siebel system is a on on-prem solution, with and underlying database in MS SQL Server. Due to the complexity of the data and the scope of the project, additional source systems with varying source types are likely required to be included as part of the data migration execution. The target system Amanda is deployed on Microsoft Azure cloud with its underlying database as MS SQL Server.
DCS is looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the recently established data migration team and be part of the exciting and challenging journey ahead.
Responsibilities:
Engage with Business users, application development team, and current systems teams in defining data quality requirements.
Understand the source and target systems from data quality requirements perspective and Identify the data quality rules.
Develop the data quality profiling code/scripts using SQL’s, stored procedures, Data Quality Services (DQS), Talend DQ.
Execute the DQ scripts to identify and analyse data issues
Create Data quality assessment reports and dashboards.Drive data working group meetings to prioritize and remediate data quality issues.
Devise and implement data enrichment and remediation solutions.
Develop and execute data quality scripts as a readiness check for trial migrations, dress rehearsal and production migration to pre-empt issues during migration.
Develop and implement data reconciliation.
Providing ad-hoc support to ensure that best practice is followed.
Measuring and reporting to management on the progress of data quality improvement.
Developing good relationships with users across the product teams and interacting with them to resolve any data quality issues.
Requirements:
Ability to review, analyse and manage large volumes of data.
Expert knowledge in writing SQL code and queries is required.
Expert knowledge in Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel is required.
Expert knowledge in tools like DQS, Talend DQ is preferred.
Should be able to generate graphs and produce presentations of professional standards.
Outstanding attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
Experience in data quality in data migration projects is preferred
Knowledge of Siebel would be beneficial but not essential.
Experience in regulatory licensing domain would be considered an advantage.
Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Salary Grade 7/8, with the base salary for this role starting at $99,431.00 base plus superannuation

About the NSW RFS
For over 100 years, the NSW Rural Fire Service (RFS) has been a vital part of the community, working hard to protect life, property and the environment from bush fires. We are the world’s largest volunteer firefighting service, with over 76,000 members, proudly built on a strong tradition of service, trust, resilience, respect, and teamwork.

To hear more about the RFS and our values:

About the role
The Data Analyst role provides technical expertise and capability in the design, management and maintenance of health and safety data assets and management systems. The role supports initiatives of the NSW RFS, following the objectives of the ICT strategy and best practices within industry.

We are looking for a person who enjoys interrogating data and developing online solutions for our geographically dispersed membership. You enjoy working with people and understanding business processes and developing IT and business solutions.
The Safety Business Unit is situated within the Health and Safety Directorate, which also includes two other business units; Mental Health Services, and Health & Wellbeing.

The Safety Team is a small team of 7 staff, including a Manager, Supervisor, Senior Advisors and a Safety Data Analyst.

The key functions of the Safety Business Unit include:
Safety culture that is supported by effective systems and practices that are compliant with WHS obligations and requirements.
Regulatory safety functions.
Advice and guidance for health & safety concerns.
Management of safety incidents, hazards and investigations.
Oversight of corrective actions and compliance.
Safety reports and analysis of trends.

You must meet the following essential requirements
A Certificate IV in a relevant discipline, or equivalent expertise.
Ability to perform accurate and high volume data entry when required.
Current drivers licence, ability and willingness to travel.
During periods of major fire activity, the incumbent may be required to support operational management activities consistent with their skills and background.

We offer
Flexible work practices
Attractive salary, superannuation and leave entitlements
Great team environment and collaborative workforce
Learning and development opportunities
Working for a highly regarded emergency service
A location close to Sydney Olympic Park Train Station and transport services.

The Risk Management BU is responsible for developing and deploying the risk policies, processes, and frameworks that allow the Group to take conscious exposures decisions to credit, market, operational, and insurance risks within both the Group’s Board-approved appetite, our regulatory commitments, and the expectations of the community in which we operate.
Enterprise Risk forms part of the Risk Management Support Unit, supporting the Group Chief Risk Officer to deliver against Risk Management’s strategic priorities in the most effective way.
To best support this delivery, Enterprise Risk is made up of several core functions, Strategy & Governance, Capability Change & Communications, Transparency & Visualisation, and the Risk Strategic Portfolio.
Y our Impact
As a Portfolio Analyst in the Risk Strategic Portfolio you would be involved in the governance and reporting of the Risk project portfolio, providing timely insights and analytics to help inform senior leaders, and shape the project portfolio going forward.
You will work closely with various internal stakeholders to gather information and analyse project performance, identify opportunities for improvements or enhancements, as well as recommend solutions that enable Risk Management and the Group to achieve its goals.
Reporting into the Executive Manager Risk Prioritisation - Risk Strategic Portfolio, your immediate responsibilities will align to the delivery of the highest priority Risk initiatives under way across the Group.
Your Responsibilities
Track and analyse Group Risk’s investment portfolio by reporting on performance against agreed KPIs, key risks, variances, and trends
Provide accurate, timely and transparent project analysis data and reports to senior leadership and business stakeholders
Develop and deliver meaningful insights to drive better business outcomes across the Group Risk investment portfolio
Work with key business stakeholders, building rapport in order to deliver responsibilities in an effective and timely manner
Contribute to the development and ongoing enhancements of relevant frameworks; processes, reporting suite, and SoPs required to manage the Group risk investment portfolio
Provide subject matter expertise to support business partner’s and bespoke requests for the Group risk investment portfolio
Risk Mindset –All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks
Advanced written communication skills with excellent attention to detail
Strong organisational and time management skills with ability to act with high levels of autonomy
3 + years financial services or risk management experience desirable, but not essential
A tertiary degree in a relevant field, such as business, finance, statistics, math, law, science, technology
Your skills and Experience
Proven data analytics skills
SQL - able to build sophisticated tables & queries from scratch
Experience with statistics, Python, and/or R preferred
Sophisticated in Excel / Google Sheets
Ability to map out processes and automate.

Join an Iconic Australian Brand
Multi-layered role in our eCommerce business
Surry Hills based with WFH Flexibility
If you’re driven by a customer mission and passionate about being part of a tribe of great people, join us at WooliesX.
Our story

As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.
Having been awarded the Canstar Blue Award for No.1 in Customer Satisfaction for online groceries, and more recently being voted the most popular Loyalty Program in Australia, we’re proud of the work we do and are being recognised for delivering innovative and best in class service that is convenient, frictionless and personalised to our customers.
With an industry leading technology team, backed by analytics, we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online. We are currently expanding our agile capability, across the whole of WooliesX.

What we are looking for:
The role of the Commercial Analyst within the B2C Tribe is to measure, track, and optimise performance of merchandising & trade activities across our multifaceted eCommerce business. Partnering with teams within the Commercial Practice, you will be delivering data-driven insights related to sales & profit, range, and pricing & promotions within our core Customer Value Propositions (CVPs).
What you’ll do:
Provide insights to inform strategic decision making by analysing various commercial lenses in both digital and offline platforms
Build reports and customised data models/dashboards to track & evaluate performance of commercial activities such campaigns & promotions, proof of concepts (POC), and more
Work across multiple systems in content management, financial reporting, & BI
Collaborate with BI team on dashboard requirements, use cases, and designs
Support data & insights requests relating to category management, product availability, and digital trade planning
Being embedded within our Connected Interfaces squads and ensuring they keep analytics at the forefront of their thinking - from utilising the insights provided to ensuring anything that is developed can be tested
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
Be an advocate of analytics and collaborate within the Analytics & Insights Chapter to promote knowledge sharing
What you’ll bring:
5+ years Commercial experience in an Analyst or Retail (Buying, Pricing, Replenishment Planning) role
Strong data visualisation and communication skills (both written & verbal)
Strong SQL, data analysis, and modelling skills
Experience with BigQuery, Tableau, and PowerBI highly desirable
Able to synthesise large amounts of data from a variety of sources
A self-starter – able to work with minimal supervision, able to deal with ambiguity, and self-motivated
Comfortable working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments
Challenges the status quo and existing assumptions in order to promote innovative thinking and new solutions
Adaptable, collaborative, high attention to detail, improvement orientated
What's in it for you?
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus.
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependant).
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too.
Work variety - The opportunity to work on multiple brands and sizable initiatives.
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative.

As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. Deputy is a SaaS Workforce Management Product company. HQ'd in Sydney (AU), with offices in Melbourne, London (UK), Atlanta and San Francisco (USA). We’ve helped hundreds of thousands of people across all industries in 70+ countries save time and money managing their hourly workforce so they can focus on what they do best, and be amazing.
Currently, our employees are predominately working from home and this role will also be remote for the time being. We anticipate employees will be returning to the office, in a flexible capacity, during 2021 as appropriate & when it is safe to do so.
YOUR MISSION
Deputy generates billions of data points on how shift-work businesses run, and how Deputy itself runs, and we need your help turning those into insights that can help our customers simplify shift work.
Deputy’s Data & Analytics team works with nearly all parts of the business to help the company better understand our customers and make data-driven decisions. You will get exposure to teams as diverse as product, marketing, growth, operations, and more, supporting them in making better, more data driven decisions.
You will get exposure to commercial business decisions, data engineering, analytics and data science, and presentation.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Auditing and restructuring of outdated data reports and building effective, scalable for growth versions of essential reporting capabilities in Finance and Operations departments
Analyst on the Data & Analytics team with exposure to a variety of problems and challenges across the business
Deputy has millions of data points on how shift-work businesses run and we need your help in turning those into insights that can help our client business run and grow effectively
Help design, build and maintain reporting of the business’s performance and monitor trends in key business KPIs, providing valuable insights to relevant departments aiding business performance improvement
Work with key internal and external stakeholders as well as departmental leaders and executives fostering a relationship of trust and playing an advisory role in the use of data to improve performance and product strategy formulation
Work on large technical projects such as our overhaul of marketing automation and attribution
Perform data analysis to support our business strategy, creating insightful reports around product usage, marketing performance and other critical activities, uncovering insights/trends in user behaviour and product feature usage across all web and app platforms
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
3-4 years experience in a Data Analytics or similar technical role
Finance experience (FP&A, Audit, or Commerce) is A MUST
Strong experience working with finance teams on data reporting - A MUST
Logical thinker with business acumen - think commercially and execute technically
Strong knowledge/mastery of SQL (we use Snowflake)
Experience with BI data viz platforms like Tableau, Chartio or similar, and possibly more customised data viz through Python or R
Programming: working knowledge of Python, Scala, Java, or similar general purpose language. You will be using Python a bit. Knowledge of statistics & ML concepts also a plus
Very strong investigative and problem-solving skills, with an ability to marry together different data sets and make reasonable assumptions to get to a conclusion
Strong communicator who can turn data into actionable insight
Team Player - results-driven individual, highly creative and analytical, a strategic thinker, having an ability to work comfortably in a collaborative setting, highly organised, and an ability to work on multiple simultaneous projects and meet deadlines
WHY JOIN?
- Australian Hyper-Growth Startup - Head Office in SydneyWhy IVP Invested in DeputyDeloitte's #21 Fastest Growing Technology Startups in Aus 2018Raised $111M Series B Round led by IVP, OpenView (our Series A investor), Square Peg Capital and EVP.
Global Growth across APAC, America and EMEA.

PERKSShare Options
Paternity/Maternity Leave Policies
Personal Learning & Development FundFlexible Work Policy
Company wide Development & Coaching
Hackathons
- Awards - "Your Time to Shine & Celebrate Success"Social Events & variety of social clubs (Books, LGBT, Games, Sports)
Mental Health Support
Munch & Learns

OUR MISSION
At Deputy we’re on a mission to change the way the world works. Since 2008 over 200 million shifts have been rostered on Deputy, in over 90 countries, and across 245 different industries.

We’re making it easier for businesses and teams to roster staff, manage leave, complete payroll and take the admin out of work so that our customers can focus on doing what they love. We hire amazing people to do what they’re best at, and work with some incredible businesses all around the world.
Check out this video: Deputy Explained
Check out why our customers love us: GetApp and G2Crowd.
Deputy believes in equal opportunity and that inclusiveness and diversity promotes innovation. Our global team members are from a variety of cultures. And we welcome different perspective and skills.

About us
NSW TrainLink is a multi-mode transport provider connecting communities across NSW. We are part of the exciting and unprecedented investment in integrated transport infrastructure and services, delivering benefits for our customers and communities as they travel across NSW as well as to Brisbane, Melbourne and Adelaide.


Project-based opportunity - fixed term full time for 12 months
Based in Sydney or regional NSW - we offer flexible working arrangements
Salary RC Grade 6: $127,559 - $141,442 + Superannuation + Annual Leave loading
Conduct advanced business and financial modelling and analyse complex workforce data sets

The opportunity
Right now, big things are happening in NSW TrainLink. There’s unprecedented investment in integrated transport as we deliver against a long term transformation blueprint which positions us to deliver even better outcomes for communities across NSW.

We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support key workstreams relating to the Enterprise Agreement and a broader transformation agenda. You’ll play a pivotal role in establishing a range of workforce analytics and modelling, financial models, and in preparing critical and complex information to a confidence level that enables executive decision making.
You’ll be part of a dedicated project team, partnering with stakeholders across Transport for NSW. Your expertise will be in high demand and you’ll be well positioned to provide professional advice for other transformation programs.
This position will be a full time fixed term position for 12 months.

About you
In addition to possessing relevant tertiary qualifications, you have highly developed business and financial analytical skills and are experienced in workforce data analytics, including the preparation of modelling, dashboards and process maps.
You are energetic, adaptive and comfortable working within the variability that can be associated with Enterprise Agreement bargaining in a complex environment. You are highly inquisitive and a keen problem solver who is excited to challenge the status quo and look at things differently.

You are highly skilled at organising and presenting complex information to suit the needs of different stakeholders.
A background which relates to rostering and payroll analysis, particularly as they apply within a large, dynamic operational context, would be highly competitive. Experience relating to rostering and payroll in particular would be highly valued.
You must be comfortable and confident to work independently, and to interface with the business through digital platforms if working remotely.

Importantly, you are motivated by a desire to make a real difference, for our people in NSW TrainLink as well as for our customers in Regional NSW.

The salary for this position is: RC Grade 6: $127,559 - $141,442 per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.

Free travel on Government trains, buses and ferries
Flexible work practices

Job Title: Senior Manager, Data Governance and Analytics, Corporate Rep...
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!
The opportunity
We are growing our Data & Analytics team in FSO and now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for people to join our diverse team who are passionate about technology & data with financial services experience. If you are a Consultant at the start of your career through to Director looking for your next role across the whole breadth and depth of Data & Analytics from next generation solution architecture, large scale data and technology delivery through to data risk, controls and governance, we would love to talk you. These opportunities are in Sydney and Melbourne.
You could be:
Working on a team to help our clients to find solutions to their most complex business challenges
Using your energy, enthusiasm and storytelling skills to convey the big idea to our client and our leadership while not forgetting the important details
Use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to design and develop cutting edge Data & Analytics solutions
Designing, building and implementing some of the largest data and cloud solutions in the market
Collaborating with your team and clients to develop the data & analytics strategy of tomorrow, today
Cross Pollinating with other EY competencies and teams such as business domain SMEs, technology teams including Cyber, Digital and Emerging tech to deliver large scale client transformations
Helping us grow a DnA FSO that is inclusive and diverse and that builds a better working world for our people
We are looking for team members to join us who are interested in any of the roles below:
Data Engineering and Development
Data Architects
Cloud Architects
Data Modellers
Data Regulatory & Controls Experts
Data Governance
Data Operations & Data Management
Technical Business Analysis & Data Analysis
Skills and attributes for success
Passionate about solving big complex problems using data and technology
Working with diverse and inclusive teams of talented people solving client issues
Financial Services experience (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level)
We would love to talk to you if you want to hear more about a career in consulting or are considering a move back after taking a break from consulting or your career.
What we offer
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.
We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).
We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary for Consultant is $90,000 including 10.0% superannuation.
EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytics and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment, not only have we remained a market leader, we have also challenged ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.
Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Client Implementation team?
Our people are important to us and we are devoted in ensuring that lives outside of work are supported and a successful work-life balance is achieved. We offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA, access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts, and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program.
Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
What you’ll do:
The Client Implementation Analyst will provide end to end support and guidance for onboarding of small to medium clients to specific products and services offered by Equifax. In this role you will also provide technical and business support to Equifax’s API channel, support the Sales and Product teams with customer inquiries/issues across various platforms and take part in training on new platforms and transformation journeys from existing API to a new API.
What are we looking for?
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Excellent communications both written and verbal
Strong background in troubleshooting – experience around REST API and familiarity with Cloud concepts
Basic knowledge of XML, JSON, REST Services
Proven ability in working in a fast-paced environment where priorities are changing
Extra points for any of the following:
Experience working within Financial Services
Business Analysis and/or Project Management related qualifications
Success attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountable
Confident
Curious
Team player
Trustworthy
Positive
Dedicated
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
Get on board and potentially make the best career decision ever. Send us your resume!

About Us
Established in 1999, Law In Order is one of the most recognised outsource service providers to law firms and legal teams specialising in legal technology support services. With offices across Australia and India, we are looking for a motivated sales professional to join our high performing sales team in Sydney.

The Opportunity
The Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and implementing a suite of Power BI reports and dashboards for companywide departments. They will utilise the latest data technology to bring together data across operational, financial, job management system, salesforce, and other associated systems. The role will also ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting, by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures. This role offers the opportunity to gain experience with technologies and make difference to the business.

Roles and responsibilities


Reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead you will:
Be the SME for POWER BI development and administration.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data source and maintain databases/data system.
Execute the development and validation data to support reporting.
Implement Data Warehousing and take ownership of the data integration from disparate data sources.
Dashboard reporting including financial and statistical data.
Explore available data by applying analytical techniques to provide insights.
Support with business cases, business requirements, functional requirements, test plans and test cases, data flow diagrams, ERD diagrams, APIs.
Assist with integrations between varied systems and data sources.
Significant experience in data modelling, analysis and reporting using Power BI
Experience in financial data modelling and reporting
Extensive experience with ETL processes, SQL Query and ERP systems
Ability to write code in Python or R
The Ideal Candidate

We are seeking a dedicated and technically savvy operator who is solutions focused and a strong team player. You will also possess:
Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, computer science or a related quantitative field.
Extensive experience in POWER BI, SQL and advanced Excel skills
Experience with DAX and M language.
Experience in Python, R or other programming language.
High level of initiative and customer service delivery skills.
What we will offer you
This is a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst who enjoys working in a well-established and respected organisation with a supportive team to drive the delivery of key projects. In return you will be rewarded with the satisfaction of designing and building data ecosystem from the ground up and the opportunity to grow in the data sciences field. We support and encourage ongoing training for all our employees and provide opportunities to undertake training courses and certifications in your chosen field.
Some of the many benefits we offer our people include:
Corporate employee discounts and offers
Employee reward and recognition program
Birthday leave and Lifestyle & Wellbeing leave
Social & friendly culture
If you are interested in this role, APPLY NOW by following the prompts. Please include in your application an updated CV and cover letter addressing the above selection criteria. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are focusing on the future. You can help us shape the experience of higher education
Feel motivated and driven by the scale and dynamism of everything happening around you.
Be inspired by the talent and passion of colleagues and students

UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community; a community doing great things. But what makes us different isn’t what we do, it’s how we do it. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do.

Why your role matters

The Data Analyst supports and implements strategies and initiatives which enable the continuing development and operational management of UNSW’s enterprise student systems to meet University goals and priorities, and to deliver quality student services that meet the needs of stakeholders. The primary focus for this role will be to work with the Senior Data Analyst to embed and support the new TCSI compliance reporting framework. The Data Analyst will provide technical data analysis support required for the University’s core enterprise student system, referred to as SiMS, to ensure we meet our compliance obligations to various Government departments.

Who you are
Ideally with role will suit someone experienced in extracting, analysing and evaluating student data.

A degree and/or relevant experience, knowledge and understanding of student and academic administration systems and services in a University or similar setting, or a demonstrated capacity to acquire knowledge in this area
Demonstrated skills in analysing or reviewing data structures, and applying business processes and policies for the purpose of improving or developing new or existing services, procedures and/or policies
Demonstrated skills in engaging with a wide range of stakeholders and a capacity to influence decisions
Demonstrated experience in the provision of effective business solutions and involvement in change management programs
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, with proven ability to establish effective working relationships as well as understand and manage conflicting needs
Demonstrated ability to provide high level analysis and advice in relation to the development and implementation of systems and services. Demonstrated ability to develop and use SQL for querying data will be highly advantageous
Familiarity with compliance reporting processes, including HEIMS and TCSI reporting frameworks will be highly regarded also
Demonstrated skills and experience in participating on complex projects would also be advantageous
An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines
Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training

About us

Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.


About the team
The Operations, Customer and Place-making team ensures Sydney Metro is equipped to deliver integrated, reliable, customer-focused and efficient services. We are also managing large scale place-making projects, designing and developing thriving precincts where community members can gather, connect, shop, work and play. We are proud of what we have achieved so far and excited for the full vision of Sydney Metro to come to life.

The Opportunity
We have opportunities for a Customer Experience Analyst to join our Customer Experience & Analytics team, which is responsible for owning and delivering on customer experience (CX) requirements across all Sydney Metro projects. We are currently working on the biggest public transport projects in Australia, and Sydney Metro is committed to putting the customer at the centre of their design, construction and operation. Our CX team members are dedicated to using our Customer-Centred Design (CCD) toolkit to create the best possible journey for all Sydney Metro customers.
You will be part of the team that is at the forefront of the design and delivery of an easy and seamless experience for our customers. The role will provide support for our project-focussed CX teams, running data analysis and insight generation. The role will include responsibilities across research, measurement, project coordination and continuous improvement. As a Customer Experience Analyst, you will be championing the customer and assisting with the delivery of an easy experience for all Sydney Metro customers.

Please click here to view a copy of the role description.

About you
You will be an experienced analyst with outstanding data management skills and a superior ability to wrangle Excel models and PowerPoint decks. You are passionate and vocal about all things customer. Ideally you will have solid skills and experience with customer insights and qualitative or quantitative research. You will use your highly developed communication skills, your planning and time-management skills and your proactive approach to collaborate with multiple internal/external stakeholders to support the team in a complex multi-project environment.
You will be a current CX analyst looking to move into a role where you are involved in the ground-up design of customer experience, or a Business/Operations Analyst looking to change to a customer-focussed role. Your willingness to learn CX methodologies in the context of major infrastructure projects will be pivotal to your success in the role.

Salary and Benefits
The salary for this position is Grade 7 ($103,965 - $116,441) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading. For more information on employee benefits at Sydney Metro please click here.
