You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues.
Consumer Remediation Team
Office location - Barangaroo
Fixed-term CTR until September 2022
How will I help?
You will play a pivotal role in the Consumer Remediation team by working with stakeholders as directed to elicit, analyse, communicate, validate and manage requirements for changes to business processes, reporting requirements, information management and data. You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues. You will evaluate, analyse, and communicate requirements on a continuing basis, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties. Key responsibilities will be to assess change impacts to requirements when new needs or possible solutions are identified ensuring alignment with scope, change strategy and project timelines and obtain agreement on and approval from stakeholders of requirements evidenced via sign-off without direction or guidance. Documentation of requirements in accordance with team practices is a requirement of the role.
What's in it for you?
You will build your profile internally with a range of stakeholders and be part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. You'll be working for an organisation that supports development, internal career moves and flexible working (open to candidates-based interstate). Along with competitive salary, you'll receive Westpac’s generous benefits and a whole array of customer discounts.
What do I need?
We expect you to have proven analytical abilities, practical experience generating process documentation and reports. Be an excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and have a strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Visio. Knowledge of Westpac and St George processes and systems is an advantage but not essential. You will have the ability to turn quantitative and qualitative analysis into business insights, opportunities, and solutions. Product knowledge of Mortgages, Deposits and/or Credit Cards and loans is desirable. You enjoy collaborating with others to solve problems, perform to a high-quality standard and have exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills. Financial industry and previous experience in remediation programs is highly desirable.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to help Australians succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we're proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility and champions inclusion.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces as long as required.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst – Business Consulting and Strategy
Job Description:
Senior Test Analyst
Treasury Technology
Sydney Based, Max Term Role
How will I help?
As a Senior Test Analyst, your main role will focus on engaging with a portfolio of programs and projects introducing change impacting Treasury Technology’s applications and their businesses.
What you will do
Responsible for Integration , functional, non-functional & user acceptance testing
Developing and maintaining collaborative working relations with Senior Business Analysts and our Business Partners to:
Analyse user stories, use cases, requirements for validity and feasibility
Validate the business acceptance criteria ie evidence required to sign-off the change
Build up your business knowledge and apply that knowledge to risk/impact assessments and testing scope.
Determine, build and execute a comprehensive suite of test cases, test scenarios and test scripts for all assigned projects/enhancements to deliver consistent and quality outcomes.
Design and develop automation scripts when needed
Document evidence of actual v’s expected results
Provide regular updates on progress of allocated test designs and test cases to ensure testing deadlines are met
Determining if test pass or fail, record findings, and analyse unexpected results.
Provide detailed description of test cases that failed.
Presenting testing outcomes to Business partners for their sign-off
Owning and creating the test case traceability matrix.
Automating testing processes where feasible.
Contributing to the defect lifecycle – defect triage, retest and reporting
Contributing to in-house testing standards and processes.
What’s in it for me?
You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?
Required Skills
Strong technical skills and abilities including databases and SQL
Ability to create, execute & present UAT test plans, business focused test cases and scripts.
Experience of writing test plans and test cases in the database and data analytics spaces.
Project delivery in Banking
Experience of integration, functional, non-functional & user acceptance testing
Experience with MS Word, Excel, Project Management and Analytics software
Experience working in Agile / Scrum teams
Desirable Skills
Experience in Investment Banking
Experience In Treasury domain
What is it like to work in Westpac?
As well as good pay and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth, and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply?
Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.
As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

Job Title: Senior Analyst | External Audit - PCAOB | Sydney
Job Description:
About Us
Established in 1999, Law In Order is one of the most recognised outsource service providers to law firms and legal teams specialising in legal technology support services. With offices across Australia and India, we are looking for a motivated sales professional to join our high performing sales team in Sydney.

The Opportunity
The Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and implementing a suite of Power BI reports and dashboards for companywide departments. They will utilise the latest data technology to bring together data across operational, financial, job management system, salesforce, and other associated systems. The role will also ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting, by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures. This role offers the opportunity to gain experience with technologies and make difference to the business.

Roles and responsibilities


Reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead you will:
Be the SME for POWER BI development and administration.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data source and maintain databases/data system.
Execute the development and validation data to support reporting.
Implement Data Warehousing and take ownership of the data integration from disparate data sources.
Dashboard reporting including financial and statistical data.
Explore available data by applying analytical techniques to provide insights.
Support with business cases, business requirements, functional requirements, test plans and test cases, data flow diagrams, ERD diagrams, APIs.
Assist with integrations between varied systems and data sources.
Significant experience in data modelling, analysis and reporting using Power BI
Experience in financial data modelling and reporting
Extensive experience with ETL processes, SQL Query and ERP systems
Ability to write code in Python or R
The Ideal Candidate

We are seeking a dedicated and technically savvy operator who is solutions focused and a strong team player. You will also possess:
Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, computer science or a related quantitative field.
Extensive experience in POWER BI, SQL and advanced Excel skills
Experience with DAX and M language.
Experience in Python, R or other programming language.
High level of initiative and customer service delivery skills.
What we will offer you
This is a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst who enjoys working in a well-established and respected organisation with a supportive team to drive the delivery of key projects. In return you will be rewarded with the satisfaction of designing and building data ecosystem from the ground up and the opportunity to grow in the data sciences field. We support and encourage ongoing training for all our employees and provide opportunities to undertake training courses and certifications in your chosen field.
Some of the many benefits we offer our people include:
Corporate employee discounts and offers
Employee reward and recognition program
Birthday leave and Lifestyle & Wellbeing leave
Social & friendly culture
If you are interested in this role, APPLY NOW by following the prompts. Please include in your application an updated CV and cover letter addressing the above selection criteria. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

External recruitment company support is not required at this stage.

Job no: 502654
Work type: Full-time
Location: Sydney, NSW
Categories: Information Technology

Data Analyst - 502654

Employment Type: Full-time (35 hour week)

Duration: Fixed Term role – 12 months

Remuneration: $98 - $106,000 (plus 17% superannuation and leave loading)

Location: Kensington NSW

We are focusing on the future. You can help us shape the experience of higher education
Feel motivated and driven by the scale and dynamism of everything happening around you.
Be inspired by the talent and passion of colleagues and students

UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community; a community doing great things. But what makes us different isn’t what we do, it’s how we do it. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do.

Why your role matters

The Data Analyst supports and implements strategies and initiatives which enable the continuing development and operational management of UNSW’s enterprise student systems to meet University goals and priorities, and to deliver quality student services that meet the needs of stakeholders. The primary focus for this role will be to work with the Senior Data Analyst to embed and support the new TCSI compliance reporting framework. The Data Analyst will provide technical data analysis support required for the University’s core enterprise student system, referred to as SiMS, to ensure we meet our compliance obligations to various Government departments.

Who you are
Ideally with role will suit someone experienced in extracting, analysing and evaluating student data.

To be successful you must have:
A degree and/or relevant experience, knowledge and understanding of student and academic administration systems and services in a University or similar setting, or a demonstrated capacity to acquire knowledge in this area
Demonstrated skills in analysing or reviewing data structures, and applying business processes and policies for the purpose of improving or developing new or existing services, procedures and/or policies
Demonstrated skills in engaging with a wide range of stakeholders and a capacity to influence decisions
Demonstrated experience in the provision of effective business solutions and involvement in change management programs
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, with proven ability to establish effective working relationships as well as understand and manage conflicting needs
Demonstrated ability to provide high level analysis and advice in relation to the development and implementation of systems and services. Demonstrated ability to develop and use SQL for querying data will be highly advantageous
Familiarity with compliance reporting processes, including HEIMS and TCSI reporting frameworks will be highly regarded also
Demonstrated skills and experience in participating on complex projects would also be advantageous
An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines
Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training


To Apply: Please submit your CV and Cover Letter outlining your relevant experience and why you would be an ideal candidate for the role.

Please note applications sent to the contact below can not be accepted.

Contact:

Kim Symons

Talent Acquisition Consultant

k.symons@unsw.edu.au

Applications close: August 29 - Before 11:55pm

UNSW aspires to be the exemplar Australian university and employer of choice for people from diverse backgrounds. UNSW aims to ensure equality in recruitment, development, retention and promotion of staff, and that no-one is disadvantaged on the basis of their gender, cultural background, disability, sexual orientation or identity. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria to apply.

Job Segment: Data Analyst, Data Management, Data, Research

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity
We are seeking Data Engineers at Senior Consultant and Manager level to join our EY Data and Analytics team in our Melbourne, Brisbane or Canberra office. This role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.
EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations.
We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.
Your key responsibilities:
Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
Develop and maintain strong effective working relationships with key management personnel and internal client base including data engineers, BA’s and directly with the services/businesses
Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques
Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies
Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform
Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.
Keep a track of trends, patterns and correlation in case of complex data sets.
Be involved in all aspects of the project life-cycle, including strategy, road-mapping, architecture and implementation to gain maximum exposure to set you up for a successful consulting career.
Skills and attributes for success

 Collect, collate, and analyse data from diverse sources
 Develop presentations, papers, and briefing notes
 Assist with the coordination and facilitation of working groups or project teams to achieve business outcomes

Analyst, Investment Objectives & Reporting

Opportunity to join a top 5 Australian investment manager
Help NSW government family clients meet their investment objectives
Advocate on behalf of clients across the broader investments team

TCorp provides best-in-class investment management, financial management, solutions and advice to the New South Wales (NSW) public sector. With over A$111 billion of assets under management, TCorp is a top 5 Australian investment manager and is the central borrowing authority of the state of NSW, with a balance sheet of A$117 billion. It is rated Aaa (Stable) by Moody’s and AA+ (Stable) by S&P.

TCorp champions and protects the financial interests of the state and delivers sustainable returns and financial efficiencies that allow its clients to achieve their broader business objectives.

TCorp delivers this through its expert team, ability to anticipate the future needs of the state and with a deep understanding of the unique needs of the NSW Government family. We work exclusively for the NSW Government and public sector entities and our work and influence delivers positive impact for the people of NSW.

Our Investment Management division constructs and manages client-centric investment portfolios for the NSW Government family. With over $111 billion of assets under management, TCorp is a top five Australian asset manager, placing us within the top 100 in the world. Through careful engagement with our clients, understanding their needs and bringing together our investment beliefs and comparative advantages, we deliver appropriately designed solutions. This results in the best possible risk adjusted performance for our clients.

Reporting to the Head of Investment Objectives & Reporting, this role will contribute to the building of TCorp’s investment advisory capability by supporting the development of investment reporting, analysis, and client communications in line with the team’s strategic initiatives.

Key accountabilities in this role include:

Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to support investment advice to clients on return objectives, risk appetite and benchmarking
Prepare high quality reports and presentations, consistent with policy and client needs
Support other members of the team in engaging existing and potential clients on TCorp’s Total Portfolio Approach
Work collaboratively on projects and tasks
Maintain an ongoing understanding and clear articulation of the drivers of client performance versus expectations

Key capabilities required to be successful in this role include:

Ability to communicate effectively (both verbally and in writing) with the senior management team and from time to time with external parties (including clients) on a range of investment issues
Strong quantitative analysis and problem-solving skills
Strong solution and outcome focus
Ability to use initiative and research to analyse and interpret information from a variety of sources
High attention to detail and process
Ability to work in a team and independently
Ability to manage competing priorities to ensure deadlines are met

The successful candidate will hold a relevant tertiary qualification; at least 3 years’ relevant industry experience; knowledge of investment management disciplines; experience working in an investment consultant, asset manager or asset owner; knowledge and experience of diversified portfolio management and multiple asset classes; and knowledge of Australian and international investment markets’ operations and practices.

At TCorp we actively collaborate with our stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for our clients and the state of NSW. We aim to build an inclusive culture so we can benefit from each employee’s unique perspective and contribution. We also understand the importance of flexible working and we support our people to balance their commitments and thrive both professionally and personally.

Agency Overview
At Transport, we’re passionate about making NSW a better place to live, work and visit. Our vision is of a connected roads and public transport network that has higher capacity and gives people the freedom to choose how and when they get around, no matter where they live and work. Right now, Transport is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy.

Great people come from all walks of life and at Transport for NSW we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Planning and Portfolio analyst in the Product and Solutions team within the Customer Strategy & Experience branch. The primary purpose of the role is to establish and manage the Digital Products dashboard to provide fact-based information and metric tracking to ensure that Product Managers are informed to make better decisions, determine effectiveness and quality of initiatives and assist with prioritisation of products and product features. This involves coordinating support services in a climate of constantly changing and competing stakeholder requirements and priorities. You will be a part of a team which works together to provide the best possible service to various teams within Transport that are working towards improving the lives of customers and communities by making their journeys safer and efficient.

 What you would be involved in:

 Contribute to strategic planning that balances multiple demands and initiatives from across the Transport Cluster, with sensitivity to relationships with stakeholders and impacts on project delivery
 Work with the Product Managers to enable them to prioritise, review and monitor their initiatives
Conduct research, and source, collate and compile information to support analysis of associated data and enable informed decision-making.
Respond to ad-hoc requests for product usage and other requests for internal usage and reporting
Model collegiate and collaborative behaviours to achieve the greater good for the community, celebrate a diverse workforce, create an environment where people can innovate and thrive, and support people’s wellbeing.

About you
You are a self-driven, proactive, motivated and autonomous analytics practitioner. The applicant must be able to demonstrate skills such as accountability, judgement and decision making, customer service capability, advanced knowledge and skills in data analytics tools and data visualisation, personal timekeeping and management skills and an ability to adapt. Job Segment: Research

About us
Sydney Metro is a fully automated rapid transit system which offers a new generation of fast, safe and reliable train services. Sydney Metro also leads the development of vibrant station precincts to meet customer and community needs, transforming the way Sydney travels and helping shape the future of Australia’s largest city.
About the team
The Operations, Customer and Place-making team ensures Sydney Metro is equipped to deliver integrated, reliable, customer-focused and efficient services. We are also managing large scale place-making projects, designing and developing thriving precincts where community members can gather, connect, shop, work and play. We are proud of what we have achieved so far and excited for the full vision of Sydney Metro to come to life.
The Opportunity
We have opportunities for a Customer Experience Analyst to join our Customer Experience & Analytics team, which is responsible for owning and delivering on customer experience (CX) requirements across all Sydney Metro projects. We are currently working on the biggest public transport projects in Australia, and Sydney Metro is committed to putting the customer at the centre of their design, construction and operation. Our CX team members are dedicated to using our Customer-Centred Design (CCD) toolkit to create the best possible journey for all Sydney Metro customers.
You will be part of the team that is at the forefront of the design and delivery of an easy and seamless experience for our customers. The role will provide support for our project-focussed CX teams, running data analysis and insight generation. The role will include responsibilities across research, measurement, project coordination and continuous improvement. As a Customer Experience Analyst, you will be championing the customer and assisting with the delivery of an easy experience for all Sydney Metro customers.
About you
You will be an experienced analyst with outstanding data management skills and a superior ability to wrangle Excel models and PowerPoint decks. You are passionate and vocal about all things customer. Ideally you will have solid skills and experience with customer insights and qualitative or quantitative research. You will use your highly developed communication skills, your planning and time-management skills and your proactive approach to collaborate with multiple internal/external stakeholders to support the team in a complex multi-project environment.
You will be a current CX analyst looking to move into a role where you are involved in the ground-up design of customer experience, or a Business/Operations Analyst looking to change to a customer-focussed role. Your willingness to learn CX methodologies in the context of major infrastructure projects will be pivotal to your success in the role.
Salary and Benefits
Interested?
Joining Transport for NSW, you’ll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!

You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues.
Consumer Remediation Team
Office location - Barangaroo
Fixed-term CTR until September 2022
How will I help?
You will play a pivotal role in the Consumer Remediation team by working with stakeholders as directed to elicit, analyse, communicate, validate and manage requirements for changes to business processes, reporting requirements, information management and data. You will use analytical and problem-solving techniques to extract information from various stakeholders, and author and update documentation, and deliver requirements to support the Consumer Bank's Remediation programs in the initial discovery and execution phases for the remediation of issues. You will evaluate, analyse, and communicate requirements on a continuing basis, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties. Key responsibilities will be to assess change impacts to requirements when new needs or possible solutions are identified ensuring alignment with scope, change strategy and project timelines and obtain agreement on and approval from stakeholders of requirements evidenced via sign-off without direction or guidance. Documentation of requirements in accordance with team practices is a requirement of the role.
What's in it for you?
You will build your profile internally with a range of stakeholders and be part of the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. You'll be working for an organisation that supports development, internal career moves and flexible working (open to candidates-based interstate). Along with competitive salary, you'll receive Westpac’s generous benefits and a whole array of customer discounts.
What do I need?
We expect you to have proven analytical abilities, practical experience generating process documentation and reports. Be an excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and have a strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Visio. Knowledge of Westpac and St George processes and systems is an advantage but not essential. You will have the ability to turn quantitative and qualitative analysis into business insights, opportunities, and solutions. Product knowledge of Mortgages, Deposits and/or Credit Cards and loans is desirable. You enjoy collaborating with others to solve problems, perform to a high-quality standard and have exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills. Financial industry and previous experience in remediation programs is highly desirable.
What is it like to work there?
We aim to provide one big, supportive team to help us reach our vision to help Australians succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, we're proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility and champions inclusion.
The health and wellbeing of our employees is our priority and we will ensure that physical distancing requirements are met in all our workplaces as long as required.

Senior Test Analyst
Treasury Technology
Sydney Based, Max Term Role
How will I help?
As a Senior Test Analyst, your main role will focus on engaging with a portfolio of programs and projects introducing change impacting Treasury Technology’s applications and their businesses.
What you will do
Responsible for Integration , functional, non-functional & user acceptance testing
Developing and maintaining collaborative working relations with Senior Business Analysts and our Business Partners to:
Analyse user stories, use cases, requirements for validity and feasibility
Validate the business acceptance criteria ie evidence required to sign-off the change
Build up your business knowledge and apply that knowledge to risk/impact assessments and testing scope.
Determine, build and execute a comprehensive suite of test cases, test scenarios and test scripts for all assigned projects/enhancements to deliver consistent and quality outcomes.
Design and develop automation scripts when needed
Document evidence of actual v’s expected results
Provide regular updates on progress of allocated test designs and test cases to ensure testing deadlines are met
Determining if test pass or fail, record findings, and analyse unexpected results.
Provide detailed description of test cases that failed.
Presenting testing outcomes to Business partners for their sign-off
Owning and creating the test case traceability matrix.
Automating testing processes where feasible.
Contributing to the defect lifecycle – defect triage, retest and reporting
Contributing to in-house testing standards and processes.
What’s in it for me?

Agency Overview
At Transport, we’re passionate about making NSW a better place to live, work and visit. Our vision is of a connected roads and public transport network that has higher capacity and gives people the freedom to choose how and when they get around, no matter where they live and work. Right now, Transport is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy.
Great people come from all walks of life and at Transport for NSW we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Planning and Portfolio analyst in the Product and Solutions team within the Customer Strategy & Experience branch. The primary purpose of the role is to establish and manage the Digital Products dashboard to provide fact-based information and metric tracking to ensure that Product Managers are informed to make better decisions, determine effectiveness and quality of initiatives and assist with prioritisation of products and product features. This involves coordinating support services in a climate of constantly changing and competing stakeholder requirements and priorities. You will be a part of a team which works together to provide the best possible service to various teams within Transport that are working towards improving the lives of customers and communities by making their journeys safer and efficient.
 What you would be involved in:
The ultimate purpose is to provide excellent service that delivers value and meets system and operational requirements. The role involves working on:Contribute to strategic planning that balances multiple demands and initiatives from across the Transport Cluster, with sensitivity to relationships with stakeholders and impacts on project deliveryWork with the Product Managers to enable them to prioritise, review and monitor their initiativesConduct research, and source, collate and compile information to support analysis of associated data and enable informed decision-making.Respond to ad-hoc requests for product usage and other requests for internal usage and reportingModel collegiate and collaborative behaviours to achieve the greater good for the community, celebrate a diverse workforce, create an environment where people can innovate and thrive, and support people’s wellbeing.
About you
You are a self-driven, proactive, motivated and autonomous analytics practitioner. The applicant must be able to demonstrate skills such as accountability, judgement and decision making, customer service capability, advanced knowledge and skills in data analytics tools and data visualisation, personal timekeeping and management skills and an ability to adapt. Experience in in interpreting complex data and conveying information to non-technical users in a large complex environment will set you up for success.
